<SUBJECT>Multiple Award Construction Contract
<SOLNBR>FA4877-12-R-0003
<RESPDATE>032812
<CONTACT>Chad R Walton, Phone 5202284183, Fax 5202282369, Email chad.walton@dm.af.mil - David A. Maida, SSgt, Phone 520-228-4185, Fax 520-228-2369, Email david.maida@dm.af.mil
<DESC>NOTICE TO OFFERORS: FUNDS ARE NOT PRESENTLY AVAILABLE FOR THIS PROJECT. NO AWARD WILL BE MADE UNDER THIS SOLICITATION UNTIL FUNDS ARE MADE AVAILABLE. THE GOVERNMENT RESERVES THE RIGHT TO CANCEL THIS SOLICITATION EITHER BEFORE OR AFTER THE CLOSING DATE.<br /><br />Department of the Air Force, Air Combat Command, 355th Contracting Squadron, will solicit for a Multiple Award Construction Contract, at Davis-Monthan AFB, Tucson, AZ. The applicable NAICS code is 236220 with a small business size standard of $33,500,000.00. The work to be performed consists of furnishing all plant, labor, materials, equipment, supplies, and supervision necessary to complete the following seed projects and the associated numbers:
<p>Seed Project 1 - FBNV 11-0026, Construct/Repair Enlisted Dorm 3509</p>
<p>Seed Project 2 - FBNV 11-0043A, Construct Facility to Replace Maintenance Shop Facility, Bldg 5131 and FBNV 11-0043D, Demo Maintenance Shop Facility, Bldg 5122</p>
<p>Seed Project 3 - FBNV 12-0038 FBNV 12-0038 Consolidate the EC130H Parts Warehouse</p>
<p>Seed Package 4 - FBNV 12-0013A Construct Parking Area and FBNV 12-0013D Demo 10th Street</p>
<p>at Davis-Monthan AFB, AZ in accordance with the proposed specifications and drawings (see attachments at time of solicitation issuance).</p>
<p>IAW FAR 36.204, the project magnitude for this contract is more than $10,000,000.00.</p>
<p>This is a Multiple Award Construction Contract where four contractors will receive an award based on Sections L &amp; M in the solicitation. Seed Projects will be awarded to four different contractors and become one of four MACC contract awardees. Subsequently contractors are required to bid on all four (4) projects to be included in the evaluation process. Using this evaluation criteria multiple awards may be issued to the same contractor based on the Lowest Price Technically Acceptable (LPTA) procedures outlined in Section M of the solicitation to include Technical Acceptability, Past Performance and Price.</p>
<p>The performance period's range from 30 calendar days to 380 calendar days depending on the project. The anticipated Liquidated Damages for this project have been calculated at $236.70 for the first day and $166.61 for each day thereafter. The successful contractor(s) will be selected using Lowest Price Technically Acceptable (LPTA) procedures, resulting in the Best Value to the Government. Upon evaluation of pricing for each seed project. The lowest priced offeror will be determined the awardee for that project. Once an offeror has been determined the awardee for a seed project, they will not be considered for the award of any additional seed projects. The process will continue until up to four awards are made with the lowest priced offeror on each seed project being the awardee. In the event any/all Seed Projects are not funded the government will award the minimum contract amount of $2K to the individual contractors selected for award based off of the Seed projects and a MACC Performance Conference held at Davis-Monthan AFB. Evaluation factors will be set forth in Sections L &amp; M of the solicitation.</p>
<p>It is anticipated the solicitation will be issued electronically on or about 30 March 2012 on the Federal Business Opportunities web page at http://www.fbo.gov. Paper copies will not be available.</p>
<p>NOTE: IAW FAR 52.236-1, Performance of Work by the Contractor, the contractor shall be required to perform on the site, and with its own organization, work equivalent to at least 15 percent of the total amount of work to be performed under the contract.</p>
<p>AS A MINIMUM, THE FOLLOWING INFORMATION IS REQUIRED:</p>
<p>THIS PROCUREMENT IS SET ASIDE AS AN 8(a) COMPETITIVE LIMITED TO ARIZONA 8(a) FIRMS WITH A BONA-FIDE ARIZONA OFFICE.<br />(a) Interested 8(a) firms will be required to show Evidence of bonding capability to the maximum magnitude of the project to include both single project bond capability of $5M and a minimum aggregate total of $10M respectively as outlined in the solicitation.</p>
<p>Once the solicitation is posted, it is incumbent upon the interested parties to visit this website frequently for any updates and/or amendments to all documents. All prospective contractors must be actively registered in the Central Contractor Registration, (CCR), in order to be eligible for an award. Primary point of contact: TSgt Chad Walton, Contracting Specialist, Phone (520) 228-4183, FAX (520) 228-2369, e-mail: chad.walton@dm.af.mil. Alternate point of contact: SSgt David Maida, Contracting Specialist, Phone (520) 228-4185, e-mail: david.maida@dm.af.mil. Send all correspondence to: 355th Contracting Squadron, Attn: TSgt Chad Walton or SSgt David Maida, 3180 S. Craycroft Rd., Davis-Monthan AFB, AZ 85707.</p>

<SUBJECT>Fuels Management Services
<SOLNBR>FA8601-12-R-0023
<RESPDATE>031912
<CONTACT>Sara Blue, Email sara.blue@wpafb.af.mil
<DESC>TYPE OF ANNOUNCEMENT: Presolicitation Notice for Solicitation FA8601-12-R-0023
<p>NOTE: A sources sought notice for this requirement was originally posted to the Federal Business Opportunities (FedBizOpps) website under solicitation number FA8601-12-R-0023 14 February 2012. All further information regarding this requirement will be posted under FA8601-12-R-0023.</p>
<p>This is a Presolicitation Notice regarding Fuels Management Services to be performed at Wright-Patterson Air Force Base (WPAFB). The Government is in no way obligated to do business with or to enter into any form of contractual relationship with any person, firm or entity that receives this announcement, submits inquiries pursuant to this announcement or otherwise responds to this announcement. The Government anticipates issuing a request for proposals (RFP) approximately 4 April 2012 to include detailed information on competition, sub-contracting, source selection, evaluation factors, etc., as applicable. Should an RFP be issued, it will be issued electronically under this announcement number on the FedBizOpps website. All prospective contractors must be registered in the Contractor Registration (CCR) database in order to be eligible for award. Information concerning CCR registration requirements may be viewed via the Internet at http://www.ccr.gov or by calling the CCR Registration Center at 1-888-227-2423. In addition, it is anticipated that a pre-award clearance will be required to ensure no contract is entered into with a person who has been found ineligible by the Deputy Assistant Secretary of Labor for reasons of noncompliance with the requirements of Executive Order 11246 concerning Equal Opportunity. In an effort to speed up the award process when the time comes, all interested parties are requested to verify that their companies have been found to be "In Compliance" with the Equal Employment Opportunity (EEO) regulations by the Office of Federal Contract Compliance Programs (OFCCP) office within the last two years. This can be verified by accessing the OFCCP National Pre-award Registry at http://www.dol-esa.gov/preaward/ .</p>
<p>EXISTING CONTRACT INFORMATION: These services are currently provided under the DO-C9 RATED contract FA8601-12-C-0038, which expires 31 July 2012. The North American Industry Classification System (NAICS) Code is 488190. The estimated value of the current contract (including its 6-month base year period and three 2-month option year periods) is $1,957,762.00. The contract is a commercial, firm fixed price and set-aside for small businesses. The current contractor provides fuel service to include alongside aircraft refueling, bulk storage and distribution, ground fuel delivery, cryogenics operations, service station operations, and fuel laboratory operations within Wright Patterson Air Force Base, Ohio.</p>
<p>DESCRIPTION OF REQUIREMENT: It is anticipated that the contemplated requirement will again be a 100% small business set-aside with a 1-year base period and one 1-year option. It is anticipated that the period of performance will begin 1 August 2012 with a 20-day orientation period beginning 12 July 2012. The anticipated contract will be COMMERCIAL and DO-C9 RATED. A rated contract demands priority attention from the successful offeror. The small business threshold for 488190 NAICS is $7,000,000. For a better understanding of this qualification, please visit the small business link at http://sba.gov.</p>
<p>After award of the contract, the contractor shall be required to submit a completed DD Form 254, Quality Control Plan, Site Spill Plan, a Safety and Health Plan and Site Safety Checklist. The successful offeror shall also be required to obtain a Technical Order Distribution Account (TODA) and maintain liability insurance throughout the life of the contract. Obtaining facility clearance and individual security clearances for personnel is an additional contractor responsibility.</p>
<p>SITE VISIT: A site visit will be scheduled. Participatory information will be listed in the formal RFP.</p>
<p>UPDATES/CHANGES: Should you wish to receive notices of updates/changes regarding this announcement; click the "Add to Watch List" button at the bottom of this page and follow the registration instructions. If you do not register, it is your responsibility to periodically review this web site for any updates/changes associated with this announcement to include cancellation, notice of amendments, updates or changes to the solicitation. No hard copies will be mailed or emailed.</p>
<p>POINT OF CONTACT: Contract Specialist, Sara Blue, sara.blue@wpafb.af.mil, (937) 522-4520. All correspondence sent via e-mail must contain a subject line that reads "FA8601-12-R-0023, FUELS MANAGEMENT SERVICES". E-mail filters at WPAFB are designed to filter e-mails without subject lines or with suspicious subject lines or contents (i.e., .exe or .zip files). Therefore, if the prescribed subject line is not included, the e-mail will not get through the e-mail filters. Also .zip or .exe files are prohibited attachments and may be deleted by the WPAFB e-mail filters. Ensure only .pdf, .doc, or .xls documents are sent as attachments to e-mail. The e-mail filters may delete any other form of attachments. You may also fax correspondence to (937) 656-1412. Please notify the Contract Specialist via telephone or e-mail of any documents faxed to this number. If not using e-mail or fax, please send correspondence regarding this announcement to:</p>
<p>ASC/PKOB<br />ATTN: Sara Blue<br />1940 Allbrook Drive, Ste 3, Room 109<br />Wright-Patterson AFB OH 45433-5309</p>
<p>Please include in all correspondence a reference to "FA8601-12-R-0023, Fuels Management Services".</p>

<SUBJECT>TT&E plus Repair of B-2 Safelock Actuator
<SOLNBR>FA8118-12-R-0028
<RESPDATE>041812
<CONTACT>David L Zawisza, Contracting Officer, Phone 405-739-5457, Fax 405-739-4417, Email david.zawisza@tinker.af.mil
<DESC>This is a requirement for the teardown, test and evaluation (TT&amp;E) plus repair of the B-2 Safelock Actuator. The contractor shall provide all labor, facilities, equipment and all material to accomplish repair, test, packing, preservation and packaging of the B-2 Safelock Actuator. A firm fixed price requirements type contract is contemplated. The contract period will be one year with four one-year options. The items and quantities are as follows: <br />Item 0001: TT&amp;E NSN 1680-01-368-7808FW, P/N 747984B; Applicable to B-2 aircraft; Basic Year BEQ Quantity, 5 each; Option I Year BEQ Quantity, 5 each; Option II Year BEQ Quantity, 5 each; Option III Year BEQ Quantity, 3 each; Option IV Year BEQ Quantity, 3 each.<br />Item 0002: Repair NSN 1680-01-368-7808FW, P/N 747984B; Applicable to B-2 aircraft; Basic Year BEQ Quantity, 5 each; Option I Year BEQ Quantity, 5 each; Option II Year BEQ Quantity, 5 each; Option III Year BEQ Quantity, 3 each; Option IV Year BEQ Quantity, 3 each.<br />Item 0003: Over and Above Work; <br />Item 0004: Data IAW DD1423s. <br />Deliveries are to be in accordance with instructions received from the Production Management Specialist prior to shipment(s): 1 ea on or before 30 days ARO after receipt of order and repairables whichever is later.<br />QUALIFICATION REQUIREMENTS APPLY. For qualification information/source approval requests contact Source Development Office, OC-ALC/BC (405) 739-7243. Award will be based on meeting our requirements and cannot be delayed pending qualifications of additional sources. Subject solicitation is sole source to Hamilton Sundstrand Corporation (OEM) who is currently the only known and qualified source to repair this item and the Government does not possess the test equipment nor data to repair this item. Hamilton Sundstrand Corporation is the only known source that has the necessary data and tools/test equipment to repair this item. A valid TO for this item is not available and this item cannot be repaired competitively without a valid TO. APPROVED SOURCES are Hamilton Sundstrand Corporation (99167). <br />The approximate solicitation issue date will be 19 March 2012.<br />NOTE: An Ombudsman has been appointed to hear concerns from offerors or potential offerors during the proposal development phase of this acquisition. The purpose of the Ombudsman is not to diminish the authority of the program director or contracting officer, but to communicate contractor concerns, issues, disagreements, and recommendations to the appropriate government personnel. When requested, the Ombudsman will maintain strict confidentiality as to source of the concern. The Ombudsman does not participate in the evaluation of proposals or in the source selection process. Interested parties are invited to call the Ombudsman at 405-736-3273. DO NOT CALL THIS NUMBER FOR SOLICITATION REQUESTS.

<SOLNBR>FA855312R0003

<DESC><p><span style="FONT-FAMILY: 'Arial', 'sans-serif'; FONT-SIZE: 8.5pt; mso-fareast-font-family: 'Times New Roman'; mso-ansi-language: EN-US; mso-fareast-language: EN-US; mso-bidi-language: AR-SA">This is a notice of intent that WR-ALC anticipates issuing a contract for Automated Inspection Repair Corrosion Aircraft Tracking (AIRCAT) system support for the Royal Saudi Air Force. 235 Byron St,,, Warner Robins GA 31098-1611
<SUBJECT>Procurement of  Monolithic Microwave Integrated Circuits (MMIC) & Linear Application Specific Integrated Circuits (LASIC)
<SOLNBR>FA8523-12-R-31623
<CONTACT>Magdalene Dickerson, Contracting Specialist, Phone 4789267210, Email magdalene.dickerson@robins.af.mil - Jennifer S. Cook, Contracating Officer, Phone 4789267070, Email jennifer.cook@robins.af.mil
<DESC>Robins AFB, Georgia intends to procure one (1) Lot of Monolithic Microwave Integrated Circuits (MMIC), P/N G554931-3 and one (1) Lot of Linear Application Specific Integrated Circuits (LASIC) P/N G555838-1 in support of an upcoming USAF acquisition for AN/ALE-50 Towed Decoy production. The AN/ALE-50 Towed Decoy System (TDS) is an anti-missile countermeasures decoy system used on multiple U.S. Air Force, Navy and Marine Corps aircraft. The ALE-50 system consists of a launcher, launch controller installed on the aircraft, and one or expendable towed decoys. When deployed, the decoy is towed behind the host aircraft, protecting aircraft and crew against RF-guided missiles by luring the missile toward the decoy and away from the intended target. The delivery schedule is approximately 6 months ARO and the subject material will ship in place for use in an upcoming AN/ALE-50 Towed Decoy production run. This procurement will be accomplished utilizing only one source in accordance with policy at 10 USC 2304(c), as authorized by FAR 6.302-1, Only One Responsible Source and No Other Supplies or Services will Satisfy Agency Requirements. Raytheon Space and Airborne Systems, CAGE 06129 is the OEM of the AN/ALE-50 Towed Decoy system. As the OEM, Raytheon retains proprietary rights to the engineering documentation to include test requirements/procedures and system drawings. Additionally, only Raytheon possess the applicable support and test equipment to verify the system requirements. Interested parties may identify their interest and capability to respond to the requirement or submit proposals. A determination by the Government not to compete this proposed contract based upon responses to this notice is solely within the discretion of the Government. Information received will normally be considered solely for the purpose of determining whether to conduct a competitive procurement. Foreign participation is not permitted at the prime contractor level. Solicitation is expected to be released on or around 15 March 2012, with a response due 30 days after issuance of the solicitation. All responsible sources may submit a proposal which shall be considered by the agency. The RFP will NOT be posted at www.fedbizopps.gov. If you desire to obtain a copy (NO TECHNICAL DATA AVAILABLE), your emailed request must be submitted to Magdalene Dickerson at Magdalene.Dickerson@robins.af.mil. No telephone requests will be honored.

<SUBJECT>Consolidate Telepost, BMC, and BX
<SOLNBR>FA2523-12-R-0003
<CONTACT>Robert A. Hanks, Phone +45 3341 7467, Fax +45 3526 5108, Email robert.hanks@det1.dk
<DESC>Consolidate APO, Telepost, BMC Post & BX in Bldg.211, Project No. WWCX 10-1022

The scope of the Consolidate APO, Telepost, BMC Post & BX in Bldg.211 (Project No. WWCX 10-1022) requires the contractor to furnish all supervision, plant, labor, materials, tools, and equipment to renovate 17,700 square Feet (SF) of building on Thule Air Base (AB), Greenland. The building at Thule AB was constructed in 1952-53.  In 1962, the building was repaired and the installations were upgraded.  The building does not currently meet life safety code. Installations are old and worn and part of the installations contains asbestos. The building is poorly isolated. Operational and energy efficiency is low and appearance is lacking.  

The work includes but is not limited to:
1.	Completely renovate/upgrade building #211.
2.	Insulation on inside of outside walls.
3.	Adding 2” exterior sidings for additional insulation.
4.	Completely replace interiors (Wall covers, Ceiling and floors).
5.	One Arctic and two cargo entrances.
6.	Key Card lock system, HVAC system and PA system.

The contractor shall be responsible for determining the amount of work needed to fulfill the requirements of the contract specifications and drawings.  All quantities listed in the contract documents are estimates only. The awardee will be responsible for determining actual needs. The awardee will be responsible for obtaining the necessary shipping and use permits for explosives, etc. required to perform the work. The location of Thule Air Base limits exterior work to the months of June through September, although work is sometimes possible in May or October. Additionally, Thule Air Base's location demands that all supplies/personnel must be shipped/transported in/out via air/sealift. Thule Air Base is not a commercial air/sea port and there is no other access. Shipping schedules are dictated by Defense contracts, and materials and labor are not available locally. The project magnitude is between $1,000,000 and $5,000,000. The performance period for this project shall be approximately 1 year from issuance of the Notice to Proceed (NTP). ”Notice to Offerors: Funds are not presently available for this effort. No award will be made under this solicitation until funds are available. The Government reserves the right to cancel this solicitation, either before or after the closing date. In the event the Government cancels this solicitation, the Government has no obligation to reimburse an offeror for any costs.” Price-Performance Tradeoff (PPT) shall be used as the method of evaluation. It is anticipated the solicitation documents, including specifications and drawings, shall be posted electronically sometime in Mar 2012 with offers due 30 days thereafter. Any and all amendments shall be likewise posted. This solicitation and award is restricted in accordance with 10 U.S.C. 2304(c)(4) and FAR 6.302-4 International Agreement, to Danish and Greenlandic firms except when procurement from such sources is not feasible. No hard-copies of the solicitation will be distributed. Offerors are required to be registered in the Central Contractor Registry (see www.ccr.gov).  Point of Contact: Jesper Nielsen, Contract Administrator, Phone +45 33 41 74 68, Fax +45 35 26 51 08, Email jesper.neilsen@det1.dk, or Robert Hanks, Contracting Officer, Phone +45 33 41 74 67, E-mail robert.hanks@det1.dk

<DESC>The U.S. Army, Army Contracting Command (ACC), Picatinny Arsenal, NJ 07806-5000, on behalf of the Armament, Research, Development and Engineering Center (RDECOM-ARDEC) Firing Tables and Ballistics Division is contemplating award of a Blanket Purchase Agreement(s) (BPA) to contractors who can provide software maintenance and technical support for GNAT Pro ADA native environment to develop ADA software for x86 Windows, x86 GNU Linux, and .NET on Windows platforms. Software maintenance must include product updates, bug fixes, and technical support. Technical issues/advice must be resolved /given by expert support engineers via telephone, e-mail, and web. At times, the customer may require direct access to the developers who build GNAT Pro ADA. If additional licenses are required, the vendor must be able to provide the licenses/software.
This synopsis is open to all business concerns; however, in accordance with FAR 19.501, the Governments intent is to establish Blanket Purchase Agreements (BPAs) with small businesses. In the event there arent enough responses from responsible, capable small businesses, then large business responses will be considered.  All interested and potential firms must be registered in CCR, and current firms must update once a year to maintain active status.  Please visit the CCR website to register and update https://www.bpn.gov/ccr/default.aspx . Whether applying for assistance awards, contracts agreements, or other business opportunities, all entities are considered "registrants". However, registration in no way guarantees that a contract or assistance award will be issued. The following information is required to register in CCR: DUNS Number; Tax Identification Number (TIN) and Taxpayers Name; Statistical Information about your business; Electronic Funds Transfer (EFT) Information.  Once a business has been registered in CCR, it also has to be registered in ORCA, https://orca.bpn.gov/.  Firms/companies are invited to indicate their interests and capabilities by providing specifications, brochures, manuals, reports, information pertaining to experience on previous projects, specific work previously performed or being performed, any in-house research and development effort, and any other specific and pertinent information as pertains to this particular area of procurement. All information is to be submitted via email (10MB limit) at no cost or obligation to the Government; information provided will not be returned.  Responses shall also indicate the size of the business entity; large or small and provide your DUNS or Cage Code.  Please provide the name of your firm, address, POC, phone/fax number, and email address.  TELEPHONE INQUIRIES WILL NOT BE ACCEPTED.  The Government will accept written questions by email.  Interested firms/companies are encouraged to submit their capabilities/qualification data NO LATER THAN March 16, 2012. Submittals and questions should be directed to the following point of contact: US Army Contracting Command, Attn. <DESC>Mission and Installation Contracting Command-Fort McCoy (ICO) intends to award a contract for (20) twenty RS Means Licensing, Base plus Four Option Years.  on a sole source basis under the authority of FAR 13.501.(a)(1)(ii)-Sole Source to RS Means Company, LLC, 700 Longwater Drive, Norwell, MA  020601.  This action is being procured in accordance with FAR Part 12-Commericail Items, utilizing procedures from FAR Part 13-Simplified Acquisition Procedures (SAP).  Currently, the 88th RSC is utilizing the RS Means system.  RS Means Licensing provides the hosting environment to access RS Means Data online via the internet without local client.  RS is data that is utilized for estimating costs for planning services as defined in the Statement of Work (SOW) and required under AR 420.  <br>20 Licenses-Hosting Environment of the RS Means Data: Facility Manager's Package to include the following price books and online access:<br>1)2012 Commercial New Construction<br>  -Building Construction Cost Data<br>2)2012 Facilities and Commercial Renovation<br>  -Facilities Construction Cost Data<br>  -Commercial Renovation Cost<br>3)2012 Facilities Maintenance and Repair<br>  -General Maintenance<br>This data is to be accessed via the internet for field personnel of the 88th RSC throughout the nineteen state region.  Internet accessibility only, is to alleviate the costs of labor and other expenses associated with having software loaded onto field personnel government supplied computers and who are located throughout the nineteen state region of the 88th RSC. <br>***Location of Delivery/Set up: Fort McCoy, WI<br>Interest parties may submit a capabilities statement, proposal, or quotation which shall be considered by the Government to the identified point of contact no later than 16 March 2012-0800 AM CST.  Such capabilities will be evaluated solely of determining whether or not to compete this proposed effort on a full and open competition basis base upon responses of this notice, is solely within the discretion of the Government.  No RFP will be issued based upon this Notice of Intent.  Oral communication is not acceptable in response to this notice.  Submit the aforementioned document to laurie.a.ehlinger.civ@mail.mil. <SOLNBR>VA24312B0753

<DESC>PRESOLICITATION NOTICE

This Pre-Solicitation Notice is for Solicitation VA243-12-B-0753 to REPLACE ROOFS PHASE 5- PROJECT 526-09-124 at the James J. Peters Bronx VAMC, 130 W. Kingsbridge Road, Bronx, New York 10468. This shall be a Total Service Disabled Veteran Owned Small Business Set-Aside (SDVOSB). As a result all certified SDVOSB's 's may submit a bid, which shall be considered by the agency. This project is classified under NAICS Code 236220, and has a size standard of $33.5 Million. The cost estimate range for this project is between $1,000,000 and $2,000.000.

The work for this requirement consists of, but is not limited to the following statement of bid items:
Replace Roofs Phase V Statement of Work & Timeline

A.	BASE BIDE BID:  Contractor shall completely prepare site for building operations, including demolition and removal of existing structures, and furnish labor and materials and perform work for the complete removal of the existing roof systems on building 100 main roof, building 100 penthouse roof and the entire building 110 roof, modifying existing roof curbs and  the installation of a new roof system in the areas of removed roof along with all required flashing to install a new roof system with a 20 year warranty and preventive maintenance services and all required work to construct a weather-tight system as required by drawings, specifications and manufacturer's requirements. Also included is repairs at Bldg. 107 and 106 breezeways which will be the flashing of the existing sloped glazing units at the existing connecting corridor into the existing brick masonry wall and sealing the brick veneer with a water repellant coating and the installation of a new gutter system to direct the storm water off the sloped glazing to the existing roof drains on the connecting corridor roof. The scope of work also includes the installation of a new roof drain, connected to the existing storm water piping, at the point of trapped water on the connecting corridor.  

270 Calendar Days to complete above task

B.	 Deduct Alternate #1:  All items in base bid excluding Bldg. 110 roof (Pool building).  Inclusive of all drawings and specs regarding Bldg. 110.  

210  Calendar Days to complete above task

C.	Deduct Alternate #2:  All items deduct alternate #1 and repairs to breezeways at Bldg. 106 & 107.  Inclusive of all drawings and specs regarding repairs to breezeways at Bldg. 106 & 107.

196 Calendar Days to complete above task


All other details and information shall be contained in the solicitation which shall be posted on www.fedbizopps.gov. The solicitation will be released on or around April 28, 2012. The bid submittal address, date and time will be included in the solicitation. This project requires bonding and all bid submissions shall be in hardcopies; faxed or e-mailed bids will not be accepted. All bidders shall be registered in www.ccr.gov, www.vetbiz.gov, and www.orca.bpn.gov prior to award.

<SUBJECT>Custodial/Janitorial Services
<SOLNBR>A12PS00395
<RESPDATE>032412
<ARCHDATE>03022013
<CONTACT>Stella Bellanger Contracting Officer 5055633130     ;

<a href="mailto:EC_helpdesk@NBC.GOV">Point of Contact above, or if none listed, contact the IDEAS EC HELP DESK for assistance</a>
<DESC>This acquisition is 100% set aside for Small Buy Indian Owned Business under the authority of 26 U.S.C. Economic enterprises that are not at least fifty one percent owned by a Native American or Alaskan Native, or Triballyl-owned may not offer quotes in response to this notice and any quotes submitted by other than Indian owned businesses shall not be considered.  Quotes shall certify that they are Indian owned.  Indian Economic Enterprises means (i) any business activity owned by an Indian or an Indian Tribe that is established for the purpose of profit provided that such Indian or Indian Tribe ownership shall constitute not less than 51 percent of the enterprise, and that the Indian or Indian Tribe shall receive a majority of the earnings from the contract, to include entities pursuant to the Native Claims Settlement Act, 43 USC 1601 and 43 USC 1626(e)(1) and (2); and (ii) the management and daily business operations of an eligible Indian economic enterprise must be controlled by one or more individuals who are members of an Indian Tribe.  The individuals must possess requisite management or technical capabilities directly related to the primary industry in which the firm conducts business. The enterprise must meet these requirements throughout these time periods: (1) At the time an offer is made in response to a written solicitation; (2) at the time of contract award; and (3) during the full term of the contract.  Indian Tribe means an Indian Tribe, band, nation, or other recognized group or community which is recognized as eligible for the special programs and services provided by the United States to Indians because of their status as Indians, including any Alaska Native village, urban, or corporation pursuant to the Alaska Native Claims Settlement Act (PL 92-203, 85 Stat. 688; 43 USC 1601).
The Statement of Work, Wage Determination for the Service Contract Act Compliance, and Clauses/Provisions are incorporated into the Solicitation.  In accordance with FAR 36.602-1, interested contractors shall submit in their Package a signed SF-1449 and the following upon which the selection criteria of award will be based in descending order as to the Best Value to the Government.  1) Specialized Experience/Technical Competence(is most important) 2) Past Performance is most important (provide references and work performed) 3) Capacity to accomplish work in the required time. 4) Knowledge of the locality of the project, and 5) Price.
All offerors shall submit proposals consisting of a separate (1) technical approach volume and (2) price volume.  The volumes shall be as follows:  Volume One: Technical Proposal and Volume Two: Price Proposal.  Each volume shall be separate and complete in itself so that evaluation of one may be accomplished independently of each other.  The technical proposal shall not contain price information, however, resource information such as data concerning labor hours and categories, materials, subcontracts, etc. must be contained in the technical proposal that the offeror's understanding of the detail and complexity of the requirements may be evaluated.
EVALUATION OF OFFERS/CONTRACT AWARD: The Bureau of Indian Affairs will award a contract to the responsible contractor whose offer conforming to this announcement will be most advantageous to the government, price and other factors considered.  The following evaluation factors will be used to evaluate technical offers:
SECTION M - EVALUATION FACTORS FOR AWARD:
(1) Technical Capability: Understanding of the Scope of Work and Soundness of Approach (25 Points) (2) Technical Capability: Completeness and Thoroughness in Compliance with All Requirements Documents Elements and with Other Solicitation Requirements. (25 Points) (3) Technical Capability: Management and Key Personnel (25 Points) (4)Technical Capability: Commitment To Meeting the Requirements of the Solicitation According to Schedule (25 Points) (5) Technical Capability: Capability, Responsibility, and Past Performance in Similar Programs. (25 Points).
Technical and past performance, when combined, are significantly more important than price.  Price shall be considered when the offers are judged as offering technically equivalent capabilities or if a price is so high as to diminish the value of an otherwise superior quotation.
NAICS Code: 561720
Payment and Performance at 100%
Price Range: $100,000.00 to $250,000.00
Location: The Southwestern Indian Polytechnic Institute, 9169 Coors Blvd. NW, Albuquerque, NM.
TO QUALIFY FOR THIS AWARD, THE CONTRACTOR MUST PROVIDE A PRICE PROPOSAL FOR THE BASE YEAR (MAY 1, 2012 THROUGH DECEMBER 31, 2012) PLUS ALL FOUR OPTION PERIODS.  
Contractors are required to visit the project site before submitting a proposal and may schedule an appointment by calling Karlisa Shomour at 505-346-2345, cell# 505-264-0716 or Bill Dyea at 505-922-6522 or email to karlisa.shomour@bie.edu and bill.dyea@bie.edu.

<SOLNBR>L12PS00229
<RESPDATE>050112

<DESC>BLM Invitation for Bids, L12PS00229- Wild Horse and Burro Horse Trapping- Solicitation number L12PS00229 applies and has been issued as an Request for Proposal (RFP) for the following requirement: The work consists of the capture, care and transportation of wild horses and/or burros from the States of Arizona, California, Colorado, Idaho, Montana, Nevada, New Mexico, Oregon, Utah and Wyoming. The method of capture will be with the use of bait traps as proposed by the contractor.  The Contractor shall furnish all  labor, supplies, transportation and equipment necessary to accomplish the required work. The work shall be accomplished in a safe and humane manner and be in accordance with the provisions of 43 CFR Part 4700 and the resultant contract specifications and provisions.  The period of performance is July 1, 2012 through June 30, 2013, with an option for four additional one-year periods.  Wild horses and burros will be the only livestock trapped, captured, cared for and transported under any resultant contract.  All temporary holding facilities shall accommodate wild horses and burros in a safe and humane condition.  This is not intended to be a complete list of the specifications.  The full requirement will be posted in solicitation L12PS00229, which will ONLY be available at http://www.fedconnect.net on or about March 15th, 2012. This requirement is 100% set aside for small businesses under NAICS 115210. Hard copies of the solicitation will not be provided.  Facsimile proposals will not be accepted. Vendors must be registered at http://www.ccr.gov to be considered for award. Size standard is $7 Million. Bids are due May 1, 2012, 2012 by 10:00 A.M. Denver Local Time. Send bids by U.S. Mail to: Department of the Interior; BLM, OC-662; Attention: Danny Lavergne; BLDG 50, DFC, PO Box 25047; Denver, CO 80225-0047. By express or hand delivery: Department of the Interior; BLM, OC-662; Attention: Danny Lavergne; Mail Room, Entrance S-2; BLDG 50, Denver Federal Center; Denver, CO 80225. Facsimile Bids will not be accepted. Award will be made to the offeror(s) providing the best value to the Government. Submit bids to the address indicated above in accordance with FAR 52.212-1.. The anticipated award date is June 4, 2012 for a Firm Fixed Unit Price Indefinite Delivery, Indefinite Quantity contract.

<SUBJECT>Residential Reentry Center (RRC) Services in the Omaha, Nebraska/Council Bluffs, Iowa area (Douglas, Sarpy, Cass, Washington, Dodge (Nebraska) and Mills, Shelby, Harrison, Pottawattamie (Iowa) counties)
<SOLNBR>RFP-200-1136-NC 
<RESPDATE>061711
<ARCHDATE>03022012
<CONTACT>Charlotte A. Henry, Contract Specialist, Phone 2023073070, Fax 202-307-2780, Email cahenry@bop.gov - Robert A Bland, Contract Specialist, Phone 2023073070, Fax 2023072780, Email rbland@bop.gov
<DESC><p style="text-align: center;">Pre-Solicitation Notice<br />RFP-200-1136-NC</p>
<p>The Federal Bureau of Prisons is seeking concerns having the ability for providing Residential Reentry Center (RRC) services in the Omaha, Nebraska/Council Bluffs, Iowa area (Douglas, Sarpy, Cass, Washington, Dodge (Nebraska) and Mills, Shelby, Harrison, Pottawattamie (Iowa) counties) for male and female Federal offenders held under the authority of United States Statutes.</p>
<p>Residential services include care, custody, control, accountability, and treatment, including subsistence. The services described shall be in accordance with the Federal Bureau of Prisons Statement of Work entitled, "Residential Reentry Center, August 2007; Revision 01, December 2007, CCB; Revision 02, December 2008, CCB; Revision 03, February 2010, CCB; Revision 04, May 2010, CCB, Modified by NCR RMT, January 2009."</p>
<p>This is an indefinite delivery, requirements type contract with firm-fixed unit prices. The services are estimated to be 85 % male and 15% female for the two-year Base Period and each of the three, one-year Option periods. The estimated number of inmate days is 73,100 (100 beds for each year) for the two-year Base Period; 36,500 (100 beds) for Option Year One, 36,600 (100 beds) for Option Year Two, and 36,500 (100 beds) for Option Year Three.</p>
<p>The solicitation will be available on or about <br />April 18, 2011, and will be distributed solely through the General Services Administration's Federal Business Opportunities website http://www.fbo.gov. Hard copies of the solicitation document will not be available. The site provides downloading instructions. All responsible sources may submit a proposal which will be considered by this agency. No collect calls will be accepted. No telephone requests or written requests for the solicitation will be accepted.</p>
<p>All future information about this acquisition, including solicitation amendments, will also be distributed solely through this site. Interested parties are responsible for monitoring this site to ensure that they have the most up-to-date information about this acquisition. The estimated closing date of RFP 200-1136-NC will be on or about <br />June 17, 2011.</p>
<p>Faith-Based and Community Organizations</p>
<p>Faith-Based and Community Organizations can submit offers/bids/quotations equally with other organizations for contracts for which they are eligible.</p>

<SOLNBR>R12PS60119

<DESC>The Bureau of Reclamation, Great Plains Regional Office, intends to solicit quotations for invasive species treatment services on Reclamation lands surrounding Canyon Ferry Reservoir located in Lewis and Clark County and Broadwater County in Montana.  The work required under the solicitation will consist of the furnishing of all personnel, equipment, tools, materials, incidental services and items and supervision necessary to satisfactorily conduct an existing and ongoing noxious weed control program through the performance of invasive species management.  The anticipated period of performance includes a nine-month base period and four 1-year option periods.
Due to the nature and location of the required services, the contractor shall have the authority under the Montana County Weed Control Act (Title 7, Chapter 22, Part 21) to process potential noxious weed complaints against Reclamation within the prescribed time frame (currently 10 days). 
Offerors are urged to inspect the sites where the services are to be performed and to satisfy themselves regarding all general and local conditions that may affect the cost of contract performance.  Failure by prospective offerors to inspect the site will not relieve the offerors from the responsibility of properly estimating the difficulty or cost of successfully performing the work in accordance with the Government's requirements.  Detailed information regarding the arrangement of site visits will be included in the solicitation.
Pursuant to Part 12 and Part 13 of the Federal Acquisition Regulations, Reclamation intends to issue a Request for Quotation (RFQ) on or around March 19, 2012.  Quotes will be due on or around April 6, 2012.  The RFQ will be issued on an unrestricted basis.  The North American Industry Classification System (NAICS) Code 561730 and the applicable Small Business Size Standard is $7.0 million.
The RFQ will be available for viewing through electronic commerce.  RFQ Number R12PS60119 will be issued via https://www.fbo.gov, at the link provided in this notice.  Interested vendors may also check Reclamation's website at http://ideasec.nbc.gov.  The RFQ and any subsequent amendments and/or notices will be available to vendors on these websites after March 19, 2012.
Vendors are reminded they must be registered in the Central Contractor Registration (CCR) and in the Online Representations and Certifications Application (ORCA) to be considered for award.  Registrations can be completed by going to www.ccr.gov and https://orca.bpn.gov/.  The vendor's Duns & Bradstreet number and banking information are required for registration.
For further information, contact Christine Mundt at cmundt@usbr.gov or at (406) 247-7805.

<DESC><span style="FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New Roman','serif'">THIS IS A PRESOLICITATION NOTICE ONLY AND NOT A SOLICITATION OR REQUEST FOR PROPOSAL(RFP) DOCUMENT. THE RFP/SOLICITATION PACKAGE WILL BE AVAILABLE AFTER THE CLOSING DATE OF THIS PRE-SOLICITATION NOTICE.&nbsp; PROPOSALS ARE NOT BEING SOLICITED OR ACCEPTED AT THIS TIME.<br /></span><span style="FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New Roman','serif'; COLOR: windowtext; FONT-SIZE: 12pt"><br />The Office of the Comptroller of the Currency intends to issue a Request for Proposal using <strong style="mso-bidi-font-weight: normal">FAR Part 12 - Acquisition of Commercial Items</strong> and <strong style="mso-bidi-font-weight: normal">FAR part 15 - Contracting by Negotiation</strong> to obtain probabilities of default data for US and foreign public companies and sovereigns that are accessed through a convenient to use, web-based graphic user interface.<span style="mso-spacerun: yes">&nbsp; </span>The offeror shall provide software or vendor services that will allow bulk data downloads by the OCC of current and historical values for the probabilities of default and related data.<span style="mso-spacerun: yes">&nbsp; </span><span style="mso-spacerun: yes">&nbsp;</span>The RFP solicitation CC12HQR0007 is scheduled to be available for review on FedBizOps the week of March 1, 2012 with an anticipated award date of July 1, 2012. <SUBJECT>Uniform Commission Examination Administration and Support Services
<SOLNBR>TCC-12-HQ-R-0008
<CONTACT>Luke J. Widich, Contracting Specialist, Phone 2028747498, Email Luke.Widich@occ.treas.gov
<DESC>&nbsp;
<p style="TEXT-ALIGN: justify"><span style="FONT-FAMILY: 'Arial','sans-serif'; FONT-SIZE: 11pt">DATE: March 2, 2012</span></p>
<p style="TEXT-ALIGN: justify"><span style="FONT-FAMILY: 'Arial','sans-serif'; FONT-SIZE: 11pt">&nbsp;</span></p>
<p style="TEXT-ALIGN: justify"><span style="FONT-FAMILY: 'Arial','sans-serif'; FONT-SIZE: 11pt">BY: Luke J. Widich, Contracting Specialist, Acquisition Management, Comptroller of the Currency </span></p>
<p style="TEXT-ALIGN: justify"><span style="FONT-FAMILY: 'Arial','sans-serif'; FONT-SIZE: 11pt">&nbsp;</span></p>
<p style="TEXT-ALIGN: justify"><span style="FONT-FAMILY: 'Arial','sans-serif'; FONT-SIZE: 11pt">SUBJECT: Pre-Solicitation Notice for&nbsp;Uniform Commission Examination Administration and Support Services</span><span style="FONT-FAMILY: 'Arial','sans-serif'; FONT-SIZE: 11pt">&nbsp;</span></p>
<p style="TEXT-ALIGN: justify"><span style="FONT-FAMILY: 'Arial','sans-serif'; FONT-SIZE: 11pt">&nbsp;</span></p>
<p style="TEXT-ALIGN: justify"><span style="FONT-FAMILY: 'Arial','sans-serif'; FONT-SIZE: 11pt">The Office of the Comptroller of the Currency (hereinafter "OCC") a bureau of the United States Department of the Treasury, is the primary regulator of all nationally chartered banking and thrift institutions. The OCC is responsible for promoting the safety and soundness of the country's national banking system and maintaining its competitiveness, efficiency, integrity and stability in the financial marketplace. The&nbsp;OCC has a requirement for the Uniform Commission Examination Administration and Support Services. The solicitation number TCC-12-HQ-R-0008 will be available on or about March 26, 2012, at Federal Business Opportunities (hereinafter "FBO") at <a href="http://www.fbo.gov/">www.fbo.gov</a>.&nbsp;</span><span style="FONT-FAMILY: 'Arial','sans-serif'; FONT-SIZE: 11pt">&nbsp;</span></p>
<p style="TEXT-ALIGN: justify"><span style="FONT-FAMILY: 'Arial','sans-serif'; FONT-SIZE: 11pt">Please note that all interested parties to this pre-solicitation notice and the subsequent solicitation TCC-12-HQ-R-0008 must have a Tax Identification Number (hereinafter "TIN") or Employer Identification Number (hereinafter "EIN") available at <a href="http://www.irs.gov/">www.irs.gov</a>, Data Universal Numbering System (hereinafter "DUNS") available at <a href="http://www.dnb.com/">www.dnb.com</a>, be registered with the Central Contractor Registration (hereinafter "CCR") available at <a href="http://www.ccr.gov/">www.ccr.gov</a>, and have a completed Representations and Certifications (hereinafter "Reps and Certs") available online at <a href="http://orca.bpn.gov/">http://orca.bpn.gov</a>. </span></p>
<p style="TEXT-ALIGN: justify"><span style="FONT-FAMILY: 'Arial','sans-serif'; FONT-SIZE: 11pt">&nbsp;</span></p>
<p style="TEXT-ALIGN: justify"><span style="FONT-FAMILY: 'Arial','sans-serif'; FONT-SIZE: 11pt">&nbsp;</span></p>
<p style="TEXT-ALIGN: justify"><span style="FONT-FAMILY: 'Arial','sans-serif'; FONT-SIZE: 11pt">Contracting Office Address: <span style="mso-tab-count: 1">&nbsp; </span>Acquisition Management</span></p>
<p style="TEXT-ALIGN: justify"><span style="FONT-FAMILY: 'Arial','sans-serif'; FONT-SIZE: 11pt"><span style="mso-tab-count: 4">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; </span>395 E St., SW</span></p>

<SUBJECT>Honeywell Joint Opportunity Contract
<SOLNBR>SPM4A2-12-R-0010
<RESPDATE>041812
<CONTACT>Dale H. Sherman, Contracting Officer, Phone 8042793622, Email Dale.Sherman@dla.mil - Martha F. Tuck, Division Chief, Phone 8042796061, Email Martha.Tuck@dla.mil
<DESC>&nbsp;
<p style="LINE-HEIGHT: normal; MARGIN: 0in 0in 0pt; mso-add-space: auto">Defense Logistics Agency (DLA) is issuing a solicitation for a multiple year, Requirements Contract for the procurement of items that are sole source to Honeywell International, Inc.<span style="mso-spacerun: yes">&nbsp; </span>The solicitation is unrestricted using Other Than Full and Open Competition as prescribed by FAR 6.302-1, Only One Responsible Source and No Other Supplies or Services Will Satisfy Agency Requirements.<span style="mso-spacerun: yes">&nbsp; </span>The ordering period will include a five (5) year base period and a four (4) year option period for a potential duration of nine (9) years.<span style="mso-spacerun: yes">&nbsp; </span>The contract type is Fixed Price with Prospective Price Redetermination consisting of three (3) year pricing periods.<span style="mso-spacerun: yes">&nbsp; </span>This acquisition will include consumable items managed by DLA and depot level reparable (DLR) items managed by the Military Services.<span style="mso-spacerun: yes">&nbsp; </span>The items are categorized in multiple Federal Supply Classes (FSC) and ordered by National Stock Number (NSN).<span style="mso-spacerun: yes">&nbsp; </span>An initial population of 549 NSNs will be solicited.<span style="mso-spacerun: yes">&nbsp; </span>Additional items, sole source to Honeywell, may be added to the resultant contract in phases throughout the contract duration.<span style="mso-spacerun: yes">&nbsp; </span>DLA currently does not have a competitive data package for any of the NSNs include in the solicitation.<span style="mso-spacerun: yes">&nbsp; </span>Alternate offerors must submit a complete technical data package for each NSN for approval in order to be considered.<span style="mso-spacerun: yes">&nbsp; </span>Any items found to be competitive after award of the contract or become competitive after award, will be removed from the contract.<span style="mso-spacerun: yes">&nbsp; </span>Items in the solicitation population are sole source to Honeywell CAGE codes 06848, 07187, 55284, 59364, 64547, 70210, 72914, 96774, 99193 and 9X173; however this list may be expanded after contract award.<span style="mso-spacerun: yes">&nbsp; </span>Shipments are to DLA depots within the Continental United States (CONUS).<span style="mso-spacerun: yes">&nbsp; </span>Consumable items are FOB destination with inspection/acceptance at origin or destination, dependent on item's criticality, and DLR items are FOB origin with inspection/acceptance at origin.<span style="mso-spacerun: yes">&nbsp; </span>The NSNs, part numbers, and annual estimated quantities for the initial population are available upon request.<span style="mso-spacerun: yes">&nbsp; </span>Any supplies to be furnished under this resulting contract will be ordered by issuance of a delivery order.<span style="mso-spacerun: yes">&nbsp; </span><span style="mso-bidi-font-size: 12.0pt; mso-bidi-font-family: 'Times New Roman'">Surplus dealers and small business dealers and distributors having existing stocks of surplus or newly manufactured material are invited to respond to this synopsis.<span style="mso-spacerun: yes">&nbsp; </span>The response should include a completed surplus certificate, DLAD 52.211-9000, Government Surplus Material, or adequate traceability documentation to show product is acceptable.<span style="mso-spacerun: yes">&nbsp; </span>In addition, respondents should identify quantity available and price.<span style="mso-spacerun: yes">&nbsp; </span>DLA will consider all such responses and may alter the acquisition strategy if purchase of existing surplus or newly-manufactured inventory is in the best interests of the government.<span style="mso-spacerun: yes">&nbsp; </span></span>A copy of the RFP will be available via the DLA Internet Bid Board System at <a href="https://www.dibbs.bsm.dla.mil/RFP"><span style="COLOR: windowtext; mso-bidi-font-size: 12.0pt">https://www.dibbs.bsm.dla.mil/RFP</span></a> on the same issue date cited in the RFP.<span style="mso-spacerun: yes">&nbsp; </span>Choose the RFP you wish to download.<span style="mso-spacerun: yes">&nbsp; </span>RFPs are in the portable document format (PDF).<span style="mso-spacerun: yes">&nbsp; </span>To download and view these documents, you will need the latest version of Adobe Acrobat Reader.<span style="mso-spacerun: yes">&nbsp; </span>This software is available free at <a href="http://www.adobe.com"><span style="COLOR: windowtext; mso-bidi-font-size: 12.0pt">http://www.adobe.com</span></a>.<span style="mso-spacerun: yes">&nbsp; </span>A paper copy of the RFP will not be available to requestors. <span style="mso-bidi-font-family: 'Times New Roman'; mso-ansi-language: EN">All responsible sources may submit a capability statement, proposal, or quotation, which shall be considered by the agency. </span>The solicitation issue date is estimated to be 19 March 2012.<span style="mso-spacerun: yes">&nbsp; </span>Point of contact is Ms. Dale Sherman, <a href="mailto:Dale.Sherman@dla.mil"><span style="mso-bidi-font-size: 12.0pt">Dale.Sherman@dla.mil</span></a>.</p>

<SOLNBR>SPM4A5-12-R-1195
<RESPDATE>041812
<CONTACT>Jessica Lowe, Phone 8042794391, Email Jessica.Lowe@dla.mil - Michelle W. Hardy, Acquisition Specialist, Phone (804)279-2457, Fax (804)279-5817, Email michelle.hardy@dla.mil
<DESC>Synopsis Data for SPM4A5-12-R-1195
<p>Control, Light Flash/ 63N Aircraft, Orion P-3</p>
<p>This solicitation will contain one NSN for Aircraft, Orion P-3, Control, Light Flash. A Request for Proposal (RFP) will be solicited and posted to DLA Internet Bid Board System (DIBBS) for award of a firm fixed price contract. The OEM and only approved source is Lockheed Martin Corporation, Cage 563J1 (98897), PN 927776-101. The NSN and quantity are as follows: NSN 66150-00-19-1539, quantity 11 each plus a 100% Option. The delivery schedule is 335 days DARO. FOB: Origin; Inspection/Acceptance: Origin. In accordance with 10 U. S. C. 2304 (c) (1), other than full and open competition applies.</p>
<p>The proposed contract action is for supplies or services for which the Government intends to solicit and negotiate with only one source under the authority of FAR 6.302. Interested persons may identify their interest and capability to respond to the requirement or submit proposals. This notice of intent is not a request for competitive proposals. However, all proposals received within forty-five days (thirty days if award is issued under an existing basic ordering agreement) after date of publication of this synopsis will be considered by the Government. A determination by the Government not to compete with this proposed contract based upon responses to this notice is solely within the discretion of the Government. Information received will normally be considered solely for the purpose of determining whether to conduct a competitive procurement.</p>
<p>Award will be made only if the offeror, the product/service or the manufacturer meets qualification requirement at time of award, in accordance with FAR clause 52.209-1 or 52.209-2. The solicitation identifies the office where additional information can be obtained concerning qualification requirements and is cited in each individual solicitation.</p>
<p>Based upon market research, the Government is not using the policies contained in Part 12, Acquisition of Commercial Items, in its solicitation for the described supplies or services. However, interested persons may identify to the contracting officer their interest and capability to satisfy the Government's requirement with a commercial item within 15 days of this notice.</p>
<p><br />The anticipated solicitation issue date will be 19 March 2012 and anticipated close date will be 18 April 2012. The anticipated award date is 23 May 2012. The buyer for this requirement is Jessica Lowe, tel (804) 279-4391, fax (804) 279-1530, email jessica.lowe@dla.mil.</p>

In addition, to the data required in subparagraph (c) (2) of clause L17C01 (52.217-9002), the offeror must furnish drawings and other data covering the design, materials, etc., of the exact product cited in the AID, sufficient to establish that the offeror's product is equal to the product cited in the AID.</p>

<DESC>DLA Disposition Services has a requirement for the removal, transportation, and disposal of hazardous waste at DLA Disposition Services Office Warner Robins and surrounding locations. The RFP is a firm-fixed, Indefinite Delivery Indefinate Quantity (IDIQ), 100% Small Business Set-Aside. This will be a single award contract. The NAICS code is 562211. The contract will be for an 18-month base period, and two 18-month option periods. FAR 52.217-5, Evaluation of Options, is included in the solicitation, as well as FAR 52.217-8, Option to Extend Services. Under FAR 52.217-8 the Government may require continued performance of any service, within the limits and at the rates specified in the contract, for a total extension not to exceed 6-months. Performance will be directed by the issuance of individual written task orders against the contract. In accordance with DFARS 252.204-7004, REQUIRED CENTRAL CONTRACTOR REGISTRATION, prior to contract award, the awardee must be registered in the DoD Central Contractor Register. RFP SP4500-12-R-0013 will be publicly posted on or around March 18, 2012. When posted, the full solicitation, and any amendments issued prior to closing, may be obtained at the fedbizopps website. Only electronic proposals will be accepted. All prospective contractors and subcontractors must be able to meet all Federal, State, and local laws and regulations governing the handling, disposal, and transportation of various types of hazardous and non-hazardous waste material and comply with environmental protection laws.

</p>
<ul style="MARGIN-TOP: 0in" type="disc">
<li style="mso-list: l0 level1 lfo1">Solicitation will be issued under FAR Part 15. </li>
<li style="mso-list: l0 level1 lfo1">The solicitation will be available in DIBBS at https://www.dibbs.bsm.dla.mil/ on its issue date of March 19, 2012. </li>
<li style="mso-list: l0 level1 lfo1">The proposed procurement contains an option to extend the contract period one or more times at the discretion of the government.<span style="mso-spacerun: yes">&nbsp; </span>The total duration (base plus option years) shall not exceed 5 years. </li>
<li style="mso-list: l0 level1 lfo1"><span style="mso-bidi-font-size: 12.0pt"><span style="mso-spacerun: yes">&nbsp;</span>Based upon market research, the Government is not using the policies contained in Part 12, Acquisition of Commercial Items, in its solicitation for the described supplies or services. However, interested persons may identify to the contracting officer their interest and capability to satisfy the Government's requirement with a commercial item within 15 days of this notice. </span></li>
<li style="mso-list: l0 level1 lfo1"><span style="mso-bidi-font-size: 12.0pt">While price may be a significant factor in the evaluation of offers, the final award decision will be based upon a combination of price, delivery, past performance and other evaluation factors as described in the solicitation.</span></li>
<li style="mso-list: l0 level1 lfo1">TYPE OF SET-ASIDE: None</li>
<li style="mso-list: l0 level1 lfo1">All responsible sources may submit an offer/quote which shall be considered.</li>

<p>Solicitation will be on https://www.dibbs.bsm.dla.mil/. Detailed system requirements and instructions for registration can be found on the DLA DIBBS home page accessed on https://www.dibbs.bsm.dla.mil/. A few highlights of the information that will be found include: 1. On the DLA Internet Bulletin Board System (DIBBS) home page, click the VENDOR REGISTRATION link to begin the registration process. 2. In order to register for access to secure portions of DLA DIBBS, the company you are representing must already be registered in the Central Contractor Registration (CCR) system. 3. A Commercial and Government Entity (CAGE) code registration will be processed immediately. A User ID will appear on the registration screen and a password will be sent separately to the email address of the Super User. If a CAGE is already registered on DLA DIBBS, the name and email address of Super User will be provided. The Super User should be contacted to set-up additional accounts, logons, and passwords for their CAGE. DIBBS Super User* If your CAGE has already been registered on DIBBS, the name and email address of the person designated as your Super User will be provided. * The representative who starts the DIBBS registration process has the option to accept their CCR registration POC as the DIBBS Super User, or they can designate themselves or another person to act as the Super User for the CAGE. * The Super User acts as the account administrator for a CAGE. They can add up to ninety-eight (98) additional users, provide user IDs and passwords, modify existing users, and control the login status of each user for their CAGEs through My Account (Account Maintenance).</p>
<p>The Defense appropriations and authorizations acts and other statutes (including what is commonly referred to as "The Berry Amendment") impose restriction on the DoD's acquisition of foreign products and services. Generally, Clothing and Textile items (as defined in DFARS clause 252.225-7012) and "specialty metals" (as defined in DFARS clause 252-225-7014), including the materials and components thereof (other than sensors, electronics, or other items added to, and not normally associated with clothing), must be grown, reprocessed, reused, melted or produced in the United States, its possessions or Puerto Rico, unless one of the DFARS 225.7002-2 exceptions applies.</p>

<ZIP>19111-5096
<CLASSCOD>65
<NAICS>339113
<OFFADD>700 Robbins Avenue Philadelphia PA 19111-5096
<SUBJECT>MP-1110-06_Gauze_Roll_Dressings
<SOLNBR>MP-1110-06_Gauze_Roll_Dressings
<CONTACT>MMESO MMESO, Medical Materiel Enterprise Standardization Office, Email MMESO@AMEDD.ARMY.MIL
<DESC><strong>This Pre-Solicitation Notice is for information purposes only. This is not a request for submission of proposals or qualifications. RESPONSES OR OTHER INQUIRIES ARE NOT APPROPRIATE AT THIS TIME.<br /></strong>The Defense Medical Materiel Program Office (DMMPO) intends to issue a Request for Incentive Agreement Quotations (RFIAQ) for the standardization of Gauze Roll Dressings <strong>on or about May 2012</strong>, but the actual issue date for this RFIAQ may be delayed up to forty-five (45) business days.<br /><br />The primary objective of this effort is to standardize the quality of care across the Military Treatment Facilities (MTFs) and operational assemblages based on the critical balance of clinical efficacy and value. The intent for this initiative is the standardization of a clinically preferred product(s) and source for institutional and operational medicine requirements at the lowest price. It is also intended for this initiative to result in the reduction of Stock Keeping Units (SKUs) and National Stock Numbers (NSN). As an enterprise-wide clinically driven program, vendors and products must meet specific technical requirements, plus products must meet or exceed specific clinical performance expectations as a primary consideration. Among vendors who meet the technical requirements and the products that meet or exceed the clinical acceptability, then clinically preferred, best value will determine selection. It is intended that the selected vendor(s) for this Standardization Action (SA) will support the enterprise goal of medical materiel standardization that combines operational and institutional requirements. <br /><br />Examples of items being solicited could include, but are not limited to, latex-free/safe, Sterile Crinkle Gauze roll dressings, standard-6 ply, in approximately 2-3" &amp; 3.5-4.5" widths, and Non-Sterile Crinkle Gauze roll dressings, standard-6 ply in 4.5" widths. The estimated value of the resultant Incentive Agreement (IA) will be approximately $896,180.38 annually. <br /><br />NOTE: This initiative will be part of the Medical/Surgical Prime Vendor program which is executed by the Defense Logistics Agency (DLA) Troop Support, Directorate of Medical Materiel and standardized products must be obtained through the Department of Defense (DoD) Prime Vendor (PV) Program. To participate in this Standardization Action (SA) your company must have a Distribution and Pricing Agreement (DAPA) and a separate commercial agreement with the current Med-Surg PV for each MMESO Area of Responsibility (AOR), i.e., Cardinal Health, and Owens &amp; Minor, or be in the process of obtaining a DAPA and a separate commercial agreement with Cardinal Health and Owens &amp; Minor. This requirement is pursuant to the DAPA clause by which DAPA holders agree to the standardization initiative and agree to allow PVs to distribute their products. The IA resulting from the solicitation is a supplement to the PV Program and is not a contract. For additional information regarding DLA Troop Support Medical's PV program, please access the DLA web site at https://www.medical.dla.mil. Vendor must update their DAPA numbers for this product line in the DAPA Management System with the country from which each line item is an end product, IAW the Trade Agreements Act. Vendors responding to the solicitation will be required to ensure that all DAPA line items/end products in the subject product line list the proper Trade Agreements Act country.<br /><br />Detailed information about the requirements and selection process will be provided in the RFIAQ. The purpose of this Pre-Solicitation Notice is to inform qualified entities interested in providing these services that the release of the RFIAQ is imminent. Upon issuance of the RFIAQ, all solicitation information will be available electronically on the Federal Business Opportunities website. <br />

<DESC>The contractor shall provide all materials, labor, equipment, tools, transportation, permits, licenses, supervision, expertise, and other incidentals necessary to successfully complete road maintenance services on the Ouachita and Ozark-St. Francis National Forests. Work includes tasks and subtasks related to road blading, cleaning of culverts and ditches, road brushing, overhead trimming, aggregate placement, and sign installation on national forest roads.
<p><br />This is a request for proposals which will result in award of firm-fixed price, performance-based, indefinite-delivery, indefinite-quantity contracts for a basic period of performance of July 1, 2012 through June 30, 2013, plus two one-year option periods. Submission of an offer for the basic contract period constitutes an offer to perform in the option period(s), if exercised. The government anticipates making award to multiple offerors as a result of the solicitation. This project is set-aside 100% for small businesses. Award will be made based on the best value to the government and can be made on initial offers.</p>

<DESC>The USDA Forest Service Southern Region 8 anticipates soliciting for Heavy Equipment Dozers, Excavators, Transports, and Tractor Plows for use on local, Regional, and Nationwide fire suppression and all-hazard incidents.  The Government anticipates awarding multiple Incident Blanket Purchase Agreements (I-BPA) using a total Small Business Set Aside under NAICS 115310. The agreements will be competitively awarded by Dispatch Centers within Region 8 of the Forest Service. The Contractor/Vendor is responsible for all labor (as required), equipment, operating supplies, materials, State and Federal taxes (including worker's compensation costs), insurance coverage, transportation costs, overhead and profit, and any costs/fees necessary to ensure equipment meets the specified standards.The solicitation and the specifications will be available electronically and will be posted to the FedBizOpps (FBO) website; http://www.fbo.gov	on or about March 19, 2012 and closing on May 7, 2012. Information of obtaining a Level 2 eAuthentication account is available on the web at http://www.fs.fed.us/business/incident/eauth.php. The solicitation will provide the definite date, time and locations of each meeting.

<SUBJECT>Landscape Architecture Services Green and White Mtn NF
<SOLNBR>AG-24H8-S-12-0013
<RESPDATE>040412
<CONTACT>Melissa A Conn, Phone 814-728-6241, Fax 814-726-1465, Email mconn@fs.fed.us
<DESC><p>The USDA Forest Service, Eastern Region, Northeast Acquisition Team, Warren, PA plans to award an Indefinite Delivery, Indefinite Quantity (IDIQ) contract for Landscape Architecture Services. Contract will include a base year and 4 options of 1 year each. Fixed price task orders issued under the basic contract will include a specific statement of work and be negotiated as individual projects. The cumulative total of all task orders issued under this contract cannot exceed $1,000,000 for the total 5 year period. The minimum guarantee for the 5 year period is $10,000 over the life of the contract. This work is a 100% Total Small Business Set Aside.</p>
<p>The types of Landscape Architectural Services include design of Forest sites and recreation amenities to include but not limited to Forest landscapes, planting plans, recreation services, utilities, site permitting, campgrounds, signage, or building projects. In a typical year, the work generally constitutes schematic layouts, site design, landscape architecture, environmental analysis, recreation planning, civil &amp; environmental, electrical, architectural, and mechanical design. Facilities include but are not limited to landscapes, vegetation rehabilitation, site work, boat launches, tent sites, signage, canoe access, rustic trails, Forest buildings, campgrounds, roads, parking lots, utilities and other recreation work.</p>
<p>The A/E firm shall furnish all services, materials, supplies, plant, labor, equipment, investigations, inspections, tests, studies, superintendence and travel as required. The projects may be located at various locations throughout the United States, however, the major portion of work will focus in NY, PA, NY, ME, NH, OH, WV, IN, IL, MI, MO, VT, WI, and MN (with emphasis in VT &amp; NH). In order to use local sources the government may recommend subconsultants located in close proximity to the actual work to work with the Prime A&amp;E.</p>
<p>There is a need for the design firm to be physically located within a 115-mile radius of Rutland, VT due to a need for same day travel to the sites. The Forest Service's Eastern Region Technical Services Team shall manage the technical contract duties and scheduling of this contract. The 115-mile radius is required for the prime contractor and could include the subcontract team, depending on the activity being subcontracted. The A/E firm will not receive travel reimbursement for same-day travel to/from Rutland, VT or project sites for the face-to-face meetings.</p>
<p>Firms will be evaluated on the following factors:</p>
<p><strong>1. Specialized Experience and technical competence in the type of work required. (42 Subtotal points)</strong></p>
<p>a.&nbsp; Firm's experience with A/E IDIQ or open-ended contracts - 2 contracts ( 6 points)</p>
<p>b.&nbsp; Firm's experience with Federal and State Government A/E contracts- 2 contracts ( 6 points)</p>
<p>c.&nbsp; Firm's direct experience with recreation design of federal, state and institutional facilities<br />-3 projects ( 6 points)</p>
<p>d.&nbsp; Firm's direct experience with timber/rustic details, heavy timber/log structures, recreational amenities, trails, campgrounds, and rural park design-3 projects ( 6 points)</p>
<p>e.&nbsp; Firm's direct experience in landscape architecture as the prime task manager- 3 projects ( 6 points)</p>
<p>f.&nbsp; Firm's direct experience developed recreation facilities design - 3 projects ( 6 points)</p>
<p>g.&nbsp; Demonstrated past project experience in utilizing recreation accessibility standards for campgrounds, trails, and outdoor activities using FSTAG and FSORAG codes. ( 6 points)</p>
<p><strong>2. Professional Qualifications necessary for satisfactory performance of services. (25 Subtotal points)</strong></p>
<p>a.&nbsp; Variety of professional staff registered in VT and NH with experience related to the types of projects in this requirement and the locations in this requirement.&nbsp; (5 points)</p>
<p>b.&nbsp; Knowledge of the National Forest systems with demonstrated knowledge of potential projects conditions, snow conditions, construction methods, sustainable materials, green suppliers, accessibility, USFS Built Environment Image Guide, LEED, etc. (5 points)</p>
<p>c.&nbsp; Cost Estimating knowledge in VT and NH ( 5 points)</p>
<p>d.&nbsp; Permitting knowledge with State and local Governments in VT and NH area for wastewater, storm water, pollution, ground disturbance, and facilities. (5 points)</p>
<p>e.&nbsp; Proven ability to work together as a team doing quality integrated design work. Demonstrate 3 examples. ( 5 points)</p>
<p><br /><strong>3. Location within 115 miles of Rutland, VT</strong> (20 points)</p>
<p><strong>4. Capacity to accomplish the work in the required time</strong> ( 9 points)<br />(assume 2-3 projects a year up to $200,000)</p>
<p>a.&nbsp; Demonstrate the firm's project quality control plan for the design process. ( 3 points)</p>
<p>b.&nbsp; Identify the firm's and design teams approach to saving Government money in the design process, the construction of design documents, and AE fees. ( 3 points)</p>
<p>c. Capacity to coordinate and perform multiple task orders simultaneously and to fast track the completion of urgent projects (3 points)</p>
<p><strong>5. Past Performance on projects including Cost Control, Quality of Work, Compliance with Performance Schedules, etc</strong>. (4 points)</p>
<p><br />Firms qualified and interested in providing the Landscape Architectural Services described in this synopsis are invited to submit Standard (SF) 330, Architect-Engineer and Related Services in one (1) original hardcopy and three (3) CD/DVD copies. There should be 3 separate CD/DVD's capable of being read utilizing windows XP or 7 operating systems. Each CD shall contain only one PDF file which represents the contractors entire submission. Parts 1 and 2 of the SF-330 must be completed and submitted for all contractors, subcontractors and proposed consultants. Please address the evaluation factors as part of your SF 330 Part 1, Section H submission if they are not addressed elsewhere on the forms. Fax or email submissions will not be accepted. The hardcopy submission should fit within an 8 &frac12; x 11 one inch thick three ring binder. The SF 330 can be obtained from http://www.gsa.gov/portal/forms. Interested parties&nbsp;shall submit their information to: USDA Forest Service, Allegheny National Forest, 4 Farm Colony Drive, Warren, PA 16365, attn: Melissa Conn by 4:30 pm ET on April 4, 2012.</p>
<p>Selection will be in accordance with the Brooks Act and Federal Acquisition Regulations Part 36. The Forest Service intends to offer a formal solicitation and enter into negotiations with the highest rated technical offer. If a mutually agreed to contract cannot be reached, then the Contracting Officer will formally terminate negotiations with the highest rated technical offer and proceed to negotiations with the second highest rated technical offeror. The intent is to have a contract awarded prior to June 1, 2012.</p>
<p>To be eligible for a contract award, a firm must be registered in both the Central Contractor Registration (CCR) database (http://www.ccr.gov) and the Online Representations and Certifications Application (http://orca.bpn.gov).</p>
<p>Questions may be directed to Melissa Conn, Contracting Officer at mconn@fs.fed.us or 814-728-6241.</p>

<DESC>*****CONTACT JANET APPLETON (ARCS) ONLY FOR QUESTIONS OR TO SUBMIT CAPABILITIES TOjanet.L.appleton@nasa.gov or fax 256-544-6560****NASA/MSFC has a requirement for services involving work for the Regional Visualizationand Monitoring System (SERVIR) nodes.
