<SUBJECT>Sources Sought for Fire Life Safety Consulting Support
<SOLNBR>DTRT57-12-SS-00002
<RESPDATE>031212
<CONTACT>Linda J. Byrne, Contracting Officer, Phone 6174946126, Email linda.byrne@dot.gov - Donald MacGee, Contract Specialist, Phone 6174942803, Email Donald.MacGee@dot.gov
<DESC><p>Fire Life Safety Consulting Support<br />Sources Sought DTRT57-12-SS-00002<br />Notice Type: Sources Sought<br />Posted Date: March 2, 2012<br />Response Date: March 12, 2012<br />Classification Code: R - Professional, administrative and management support services</p>
<p>NAICS Code: 541330 - Engineering Services</p>
<p>1.0 Description: The U.S. Department of Transportation (U.S. DOT), Research and Innovative Technology Administration, John A. Volpe National Transportation Systems Center (Volpe Center), Cambridge, MA, issues this sources sought notice to assist in determining the availability of capable small business concerns for the requirement herein. Currently, Solicitation No. DTRT57-11-R-20017 is issued on a full and open competition basis. Capable small business concerns who are interested shall submit responses to all of the questions listed below. Also, small businesses shall indicate whether they are certified 8(a), Hubzone, veteran-owned, service disabled veteran owned, disadvantaged or woman owned. This information will assist the Government in reviewing its acquisition strategy to determine whether there are capable small businesses to perform the requirement.</p>
<p>2.0 Background: The Volpe Center, in support of the Federal Aviation Administration (FAA) and other transportation-related sponsors, provides national Fire Life Safety (FLS) consulting and engineering support. Typical work activities include code compliance consultation, field inspections and surveys, engineering design support, engineering policy evaluations, performance based design assessments, design reviews, system inspections and testing, construction oversight, Resident Engineer support, engineering studies, project management support, risk assessments, small scale fire testing, materials assessments, egress analyses, training support, and computer model analyses. The majority of this support has historically been conducted in partnership with the FAA's Fire Life Safety Program (FLSP). The FLSP's main objective is to ensure that all FAA owned and/or operated Airport Traffic Control Towers (ATCTs) are in compliance with 29 Code of Federal Regulations (CFR) 1960.20 - The Alternate Standard for Fire Safety in Airport Traffic Control Towers. For FLS tasks, The Volpe Center is required to respond quickly to work located throughout the U.S.A., Puerto Rico and the Pacific Rim.</p>
<p>&nbsp;</p>
<p>3.0 Potential Functional Areas for Tasks to be Performed: <br />1.Codes/standards compliance evaluations and consultations <br />2.Fire protection systems design/engineering support <br />3.Fire modeling/design flow analysis<br />4.Fire tests, system inspections, and evaluations<br />5.Risk assessments/hazard analysis<br />6.Policy and code evaluations/equivalency determinations<br />7.Training program development and implementation<br />8.Field construction engineering support <br />9.Emergency preparedness planning 10.Subject matter experts/Ad hoc general fire protection engineering (FPE) consulting support<br />11.Special projects support<br />12.Program management and policy guidance support</p>
<p><br />4.0 Submission Instructions: All capability information submitted by respondents shall include: Contract number; Customer (Government agency or private industry); Contracting Officer's Technical Representative (COTR) name (or private industry point of contact (POC)), telephone number; contract value, type of contract, and period of performance. Responses must address each of the following requirements:<br />1.Describe your company's past experience working with FAA's or other similar facilities, in particular ATCTs and Air Route Traffic Control Centers, including experience working with and applying OSHA 1960.20 and FAA Standards of Care.<br />2.Describe your company's past experience working with Marine, Rail and Highway fire safety projects.<br />3.Describe your Program Managers and Senior Technical Staff available, including Geographical locations to respond cost effectively to: on time deliverables, quality control of deliverables, program consistency of design/engineering approaches, understanding of customer needs and meeting numerous engineering design packages simultaneously throughout the national airspace system while also providing on call support demands, construction management oversight, including Resident Engineer support, national training support, for a customer with a national program. Also, describe your capabilities to provide short turn around responses ( to conduct site visits and delivery reports) to "on call" type technical requirements at ATCTs, such as fire investigation, field quality inspections, witness of testing, etc. while also meeting deadlines for other program needs and ongoing tasks.<br />4.Describe your company's capabilities to provide licensed Fire Protection Engineers P.E. to support a national program. Disclose what states the licenses are valid for. <br />5.Demonstrate through a staffing matrix or list; the job titles, degrees, certifications, F.P.E. licenses, experience levels, National Fire Protection Association and other similar standards committee participation of your company's current fire protection staff. Disclose if they are full or part time employee's.<br />6.Identify the capabilities and qualifications of your staff's nationally recognized subject matter experts in the following areas: Seismic protection and water based systems, Class A and VESDA fire detection and alarm, gaseous agent suppression systems (marine and land based), fire risk analysis, performance based design alternatives, fire growth modeling, egress modeling, and steel and fire insulation materials performance testing.<br />7.Identify your company's experience and abilities to provide full time Resident Engineering support (8 to 10 weeks on site) during construction upgrade projects <br />8.Describe your company's quality assurance program to ensure technical deliverables and design approaches are applied consistently by the engineering staff.<br />9.Describe your past experience developing and applying performance-based design approaches.<br />10.Describe your CAD capabilities using both AutoCAD and Microstation and abilities to work multiple designs concurrently and geographic location of your CAD support.<br />11.Describe your experience developing and providing subject matter expert instructors for a comprehensive training program that provides your customers with the ability to inspect, test and maintain fire protection systems and equipment.<br />12.Describe your experience in providing simultaneous (at 8 to 10 construction sites) located throughout the United States providing field construction engineering support that includes submittal reviews, quality assurance inspections, systems acceptance and testing, and the preparation of OSHA 1960.20 certification recommendation letters.<br />13.Describe your experience supporting unique special projects using subject matter experts in areas such as sprinkler corrosion analyses, seismic bracing for sprinkler systems, explosive gas analysis/fuel spill risk mitigation, development of NFPA standards for facilities such as ATCTs, and design/construction of fire alarm training panels.<br />Information provided should be detailed in the area(s) above so the Government can assess the ability of the small business concern to provide the described minimum services. All of the information sought should be conveyed in no more than ten (10) pages. Page size is set at 8&frac12; X 11 inches; text font must be no smaller than 12 point; and text should be doubled spaced. Each response must reference the sources sought title. The NAICS Code for this acquisition is 541330 and the small business size standard is a maximum of $4.5 million in annual receipts for the concern and any affiliates. Interested parties must respond to this announcement in writing no later than March 12, 2012, 2:00 PM Eastern Time Telephone requests will not be honored. All responses must be submitted via e-mail to Contracting Officer Linda Byrne at linda.byrne@dot.gov. Electronic attachments to the e-mail should be submitted in Microsoft Office 2003 (or later) productivity application formats, or any format that can be imported by Microsoft Office.<br />5.0 THIS NOTICE IS NOT A REQUEST FOR PROPOSAL. This notice is for information and planning purposes only, and is a market research tool to determine the availability and adequacy of potential small business sources.</p>

<DESC>New Market Survey:  This MarketSurvey is issued for the purpose ofdetermining SmallBusiness capabilities. The Space and NavalWarfare Systems Center, Atlantic (SSC-LANT) is soliciting information frompotential sources to develop initiativesthat encompass research anddevelopment, investigation, analysis,test and evaluation, and reportingsupport for Counter Terrorismtechnology needs, intelligence-gathering technology, identityintelligence exploitation, and theoverall development of biometrictechnology that can be utilized andshared throughout the Government toaid in the Global War on Terror(GWOT). Biometric and othertechnological solutions, management,coordination, and execution of counterterrorism technologies shall beevaluated for both Military and LawEnforcement operationalenvironments.  The planned contractwill require the full range of biometriccapabilities, solutions, and emergingtechnologies.The market survey form is attachedand available on SSC Atlantics e-Commerce website https://e-commerce.sscno.nmci.navy.mil.  If youencounter issues regarding access tothe websit, please contact thewebmaster.We anticipate a multiple award,performance  based, IndefiniteDelivery, Indefinite Quantity, Cost PlusFixed Fee type contract for a base yearplus two one-year option periods. <AGENCY>United States Postal Service
<OFFICE>Supplies and Services Purchasing
<LOCATION>Topeka Purchasing Center (Spare Parts)

<SUBJECT>The United States Postal Service is seeking to pre-qualify suppliers to staff and operate its Central Repair Facility (CRF), located in Topeka, KS.
<SOLNBR>Central_Repair-Facility_2012
<RESPDATE>040512
<CONTACT>Steven A. Blasing, Purchasing & Supply Mgmt. Spec., Phone (785) 861-2854, Fax (785) 861-2862, Email steven.a.blasing@usps.gov - Charles T. Harrison, Purchasing & Supply Mgmt. Spec., Phone 785-861-2849, Fax 785-861-2862, Email charles.t.harrison2@usps.gov
<DESC>The United States Postal Service is seeking to pre-qualify suppliers to staff and operate its Central Repair Facility (CRF), located in Topeka, KS.
<p>The CRF is a depot repair facility for USPS mail processing, delivery, and bulk mail systems repairable parts. Examples: repairing printed circuit boards, electrical, electronic, mechanical and electro-mechanical assemblies to component level.</p>
<p>The CRF provides depot level maintenance for essential automation, mechanization, retail and bulk mail processing systems used in all mail processing and retail installations.</p>
<p>The following factors will be used to select pre-qualified suppliers. To be prequalified, the Purchase Team is seeking the following attributes:</p>
<p>A. Current and Past Performance: A firm must demonstrate a minimum of three (3) years experience in operating and managing a repair operation which includes, but is not limited to, repairing to the component level the following: printed circuit boards, electrical and electronic assemblies, and mechanical and electro-mechanical assemblies. Demonstrated repair experience must include surface mount technology (SMI) repairs, multi-layer printed circuit board repair, and Quality Assurance based on current industry standards.</p>
<p>B. Firms must demonstrate a minimum of three (3) years experience in development and maintenance of fourth echelon repair specifications. This experience must address Functional/Performance Automatic Test Equipment (ATE), such as desktop test systems using VXI bus technology and microprocessor emulation, and Semi-Automatic Test Equipment (SATE). This experience should address the documentation development, design and manufacture of test fixtures, and the ongoing support of these items.</p>
<p>C. Firm must have a minimum of three (3) years experience monitoring support Contracts, such as component parts purchases, maintenance service, custodial service, equipment calibration, and equipment leasing contracts. Supplier must demonstrate its experience and understanding in the preparation and monitoring of capital and expense budgets, provision of engineering support, planning and management of inventory in a piece-parts stockroom.</p>
<p>D. Firms must have a minimum of three (3) years experience developing and maintaining management information systems, supporting computer hardware and software, LAN support, and remote LAN and systems support for non-local operations.</p>
<p>E. Firms must demonstrate its ability to interface and work cooperatively with other organizations. Under this proposed contract, the Supplier will be required to interface with other USPS organizations, including the Maintenance Technical Support Center in Norman, Oklahoma; the Engineering organization and Maintenance Policies and Programs organization both located in Merrifield, Virginia; USPS Network Operations, located in Washington DC; the Asset Management organization in Topeka, Kansas; and the Critical Parts Center (CPC) in Indianapolis, Indiana.</p>
<p>F. Quality Systems: The supplier must provide documentation of the quality system(s) they use to ensure customer satisfaction.</p>
<p>G. Management Philosophy and Vision: The supplier must provide examples of how their management philosophy and vision have resulted in quantifiable results in customer satisfaction, examples of true partnering arrangements with clients and the company's mission statement. Also include their organization's policies and approach to environmental responsibility (sustainability) and initiatives to implement Green supply chains within its organization and for its customers.</p>
<p>H. Financial Capability: The supplier must provide adequate information to determine their financial capability and the availability of sufficient operating capital/resources to be able to perform the requirements of any resulting contract.</p>
<p>I. Supplier Diversity: It is the policy of the Postal Service to establish and maintain a strong, competitive supplier base that reflects the diversity of the American supplier community. The supplier must provide information regarding their company's supplier diversity and subcontracting opportunities programs. Sourcing opportunities &amp; market activity must be addressed along with the ability to provide a detailed subcontracting plan. The Spares Team will work closely with the CRF to develop and capture sub-contracting opportunities with each area of operation. Operations at the CRF have been self-contained; meaning service has been performed at the facilities. Spares Team will advance USPS efforts for sub-contracting opportunities.</p>
<p>Suppliers will be rated in each area using an adjectival rating system of Excellent, Very Good, Good, Poor, and Unacceptable. The pre-qualified listing will be maintained over the term of the contract and available should a determination be made to re-compete these services prior to the expiration of all available options under the award.</p>
<p>Supplier response package must be limited to no more than 100 total pages.</p>
<p>One (1) printed original of response packages and five (5) soft copies on CD ROM must be submitted not later than 4:00 PM, April 5, 2012 to:</p>
<p>U S Postal Service<br />Spares Purchasing Team<br />Attn: Steve Blasing<br />500 SW Gary Ormsby Drive<br />Topeka, KS 66624-9402</p>

<URL>https://www.fbo.gov/spg/USPS/SSP/TPCSP/Central_Repair-Facility_2012/listing.html

<POPADDRESS>7215 SW Topeka Blvd. 
Topeka, KS

<DESC>This is a SOURCES SOUGHT ANNOUNCEMENT. This purpose of this announcement is to conduct market research for developing a procurement strategy for a possible upcoming opportunity entitled, "Repair Bus Ducts at the Bull Shoals Powerhouse, Bull Shoals Lake, Marion County, Arkansas."  Information obtained from industry, will be used for preliminary planning purposes. No proposals are being requested or accepted with this synopsis. THIS IS NOT A SOLICITATION FOR PROPOSALS AND NO CONTRACT SHALL BE AWARDED FROM THIS SYNOPSIS. The purpose of this synopsis is to gain knowledge of interest, capabilities and qualifications of various members of industry and not to be construed as a commitment by the Government, implied or otherwise, to issue a solicitation or award a contract.   If the Government does issue a solicitation, it will be assigned a Procurement Identification Number such as W9127S-12-R-XXXX.  The Government must ensure there is adequate competition among the potential pool of responsible contractors. No reimbursement will be made for any costs associated with providing information in response to this synopsis or any follow up information requests. <br>The purpose of this notice is to measure the interest of Small Businesses (SB), 8(a), Small Disadvantage Business (SDB), Woman Owned Business, Service-Disabled Veteran Owned Small Business (SDVOSB), or HUBZone prime contractor business sources and their size classifications relative to the North American Industry Classification System (NAICS) code of 237990 "Other Heavy and Civil Engineering Construction" (Size Standard of $33.5 Million) for the subject opportunity.<br><br>The U.S. Army Corps of Engineers, Little Rock District, is conducting market research for development <br>of a procurement strategy for a possible upcoming opportunity entitled, "Repair Bus Ducts at the <br>Bull Shoals Powerhouse, Bull Shoals Lake, Marion County, Arkansas.  <br><br><br>Repair 15kV Transformer Feed Bus Duct Banks<br><br>Work on the Bull Shoals bus ducts and transformers shall include all of the labor, materials and oversight to paint, rehabilitate and/or replace fifteen (15) electrical bus ducts fabricated of steel sheets, each approximately 16 ft high by 2 ft wide and 2 ft deep, located at Bull Shoals Dam, Arkansas.  A summary of the scope of work is as follows.  Replace bus duct 4A in like kind from the transformer to the slab in its entirety Test for function and air leak test the new portion of duct 4A. Prepare interior and exterior of all bus ducts (1A, 1B, 1C, 2A, 2B, 2C, 3A, 3B, 3C, 4A, 4B, 4C, 5A, 5B, 5C) for paint and new seals; treat and remove all rust. Surface preparation of the rusted areas shall be per Society of Protective Coatings (SSPC) standard SSPC SP3 "Power Tool Cleaning" with the option of SSPC SP7 "Brush-off blast Cleaning"; The contractor shall replace all bus duct seals from the transformer to the slab.  All bare areas should be primed with SSPC Paint 40 Type II "Zinc-Rich Moisture Cure Polyurethane".  Apply two full topcoats of SSPC Paint 38 "Single Component Moisture Cure Weatherable Polyurethane Topcoat" to the interior and exterior of each bus duct. Test to verify all bus ducts are air tight.<br><br>Please provide a Statement of Capability (SOC) stating your skills, experience, and knowledge to perform the specified type of work.  <br>REQUIREMENTS: <br>Provide the following in response to this sources sought synopsis: <br>1.	Two (2) examples of same or similar past experience projects of repair and painting of electrical bus ducts. Examples should include the following information: <br>a. A description of the work;<br>b. Dollar amount of the work;<br>c. Location of the work<br>d. Contact information for the past experience project.<br><br>2.	 Provide your company's name, address and CAGE code and/or DUNS number<br><br>3.	A copy of current SSPC QP 1 and SSPC QP 2 Certifications. <br><br>Interested Firms shall respond to this Sources Sought Synopsis no later than 05 April 2012 by 10:00 AM. All interested firms must be registered in CCR http://www.ccr.gov/Contractors.aspx to be eligible for award of Government contracts. Please provide a DUNS number to verify CCR registration. Statement of Work: Paving and Striping parking lot G


GENERAL

The contractor shall provide all labor, materials, equipment, transportation and supervision to pave, stripe and install car stops in parking lot G.  Service shall be provided at CAVHCS, 215 Perry Hill Road, Montgomery Alabama, 36109. 

PURPOSE: To ensure a smooth surface for pedestrians from tripping.
 
SITE VISIT: 
Bidders are encouraged to visit the site to prior to bid submittal.  All bidders shall report the building 14.  The site visit shall be for the purpose of observing first hand any conditions relevant to the completion of this contract.  No consideration will be given to claims based on a lack of knowledge of the existing conditions, except where contract documents make definite provisions for adjustment in cost or extension due to existing conditions not readily foreseeable.  The site address is: 

CAVHCS 	215 Perry Hill Road	Montgomery Alabama, 36109

 
WARRANTY: Manufacture of material used to apply.

SCOPE OF WORK: 

(1)	Contractor to remove approximately 138 car stops for paving in parking lot G and replace after paving. Contractor to broom, tack, and overlay with 1.25 inches of plant mix asphalt, tapered at sidewalks and handicapped ramps. Contractor to restripe parking lot G to match existing parking spaces, stop bars and handicapped insignia.
DOWNTIME:  All work shall be performed on Saturday or Sunday to minimize impact on patients and visitors.

â€¢	Also they will have to be registered with and have a CCR number.
â€¢	Hold a General Contractors license in the state of Alabama

(2)	Contractor shall furnish barricades to parking lot during paving and painting.

<DESC>The Department of Veterans Affairs, is seeking interested firms that are classified under one or more of the following small business programs that can provide professional Architectural Engineering Design services under an IDIQ contract: (1) Service Disabled Veterans Owned Small Business (SDVOSB) (2) Veteran-Owned Small Business (VOSB) (3) Section 8(a), (4) HUB Zone, (5) Small Disadvantaged Business (SDB), (6) Woman-Owned Small Business (WOSB), (7) Small Business.  Services are primarily Architectural and Engineering in scope and may have related Mechanical/Electrical/Plumbing and Fire Protection Engineering. Scope of work may include the field verification of existing conditions, preparation of schematic designs, space plans, construction documents, specifications, cost estimates, review of shop drawings & sample submittals, site visits and preparation of punch lists etc. for final acceptance, and construction period services.   A/E Services shall be provided for one (1) year, with the option to extend for two (2) additional years. For any one project, a work order will be issued not to exceed $500,000, and the total cumulative contract amount for work orders shall not exceed a maximum of $1,900,000. The NAICS code is 541310 and the size standard is $4.5 million.  Area of consideration is restricted to 100 miles of Wm. S. Middleton VA Hospital, Madison, WI 53705.  

For a company to be determined capable of performing the services required they must demonstrate the capabilities listed below. 

A/E firms within the area of consideration are invited to submit a brief statement of capabilities (maximum of 5 pages). The statement of capabilities should include specific documentation of the following items:

1)	SDVOSB or VOSB CVE Verification 
2)	Provide a short narrative on company to include as a minimum:  a) number of years as an A/E firm; b) the number of architects and engineers at your firm.
3)	Provide a detailed description (including size, scope, and dollar value of the firm's experience with similar projects).  Provide what percentage of the design work was done by your firm on each project identified.
4)	Firm's capacity to manage multiple design and construction administration projects concurrently while adhering to tight schedules.  
5)	Name and address of your firm; DUNS Number and name and phone number of a point of contact if further information is needed.
6)	Firm's experience with the VA-Space and Equipment Planning System (VA-SEPS). VA-SEPS is a computerized space and equipment planning tool for health care projects developed collaboratively by Department of Defense and the Department of Veterans Affairs.
7)	Any additional information which will demonstrate that your firm will have the necessary in-house staff to complete at least 50% of the cost of contract performance incurred for personnel.

Responders are solely responsible for all expenses associated with responding to this request for information. Please forward the information via e-mail to john.meyers2@va.gov with the subject line "VA-69D-I-0412." By 4:30 pm on March 16, 2012. 

This is neither a request for SF 330s nor a Request for Proposals. Do not submit a SF 330 in response to this Sources Sought Notice. This is only for market research purposes. If a firm submits a SF 330 or a submission that is over 5 pages, the Government will review the first 5 pages of the submission.

The Government will make a determination whether or not to set the acquisition aside for SDVOSB, VOSB, 8(a), HUBZone, SDB, WOSB, or SB firms based on all market research conducted, particularly the responses received to this Sources Sought Notice and the evaluation of those responses.

<DESC>THIS IS A SMALL BUSINESS SOURCES SOUGHT NOTICE REPRESENTING A MARKET SURVEY AND IS NOT A REQUEST FOR PROPOSALS, PROPOSAL ABSTRACTS, QUOTATIONS OR INVITATION FOR BIDS
 
The Department of Veterans Affairs is conducting a MARKET RESEARCH SURVEY to obtain information regarding: (1) the availability and capability of qualified small business sources; (2) whether they are Service-Disabled Veteran-Owned, Veteran-Owned, Small Business, HUB Zone 8(a), Women-Owned, or small disadvantaged business concerns; and (3) their size classification relative to the North American Industry Classification System (NAICS) code for the proposed acquisition. Your responses to the information requested will assist the Government in determining the appropriate acquisition method, including whether a set-aside is possible. An organization that is not considered a small business under the applicable NAICS code should not submit a response to this notice. Small business concerns should be capable of furnishing all labor, supervision, and parts, to include all equipment necessary to perform all work require under the proposed contract.  
The NAICS code is 611710
DESCRIPTION OF THE REQUIREMENT:  

ONLINE NURSE COURSES FOR 700 USERS FOR THE NORTH FLORIDA/SOUTH GEORGIA VA MEDICAL CENTER LOCATED IN GAINESVILLE, FLORIDA 32608

The contractor shall provide:

Access to online nursing courses  approved for Florida licensure requirements and approved by American Nurses Credentialing Center's Commission on Accreditation (ANCC) which supports the nursing certifications and Magnet recognition.  Contractor must also provide Pearls Review Certification Preparation Materials to prepare RNs for various nursing certification exams. EFFECTIVE DATES 4-1-12 THRU 3-31-12


POTENTIAL SOURCES SHALL PROVIDE THE FOLLOWING INFORMATION IN THEIR RESPONSE:

1) Company name, address, phone number, primary contact(s), e-mail address, NAICS code(s), business size (i.e., small/large) and DUNS Number.
2) Provide a Statement of Capability that demonstrates the offeror's past performance in providing this type of service. Please include the following: (a) staff expertise including their availability, experience, and formal and other training; (b) current in-house capability and capacity to perform the work; (c) prior completed projects of similar nature; (d) corporate experience and management capability; and (e) examples of prior completed Government contracts, references, and other related information.
3) Submit Capability Statements by March 7, 2012 to: Network Contracting Activity 8, 300 East University Ave, 1st Floor, Suite 180, Gainesville, FL 32601 ATTN: Sarita Foxworth. Responses should be received no later than 12:00 PM EST. Submissions must be made via email to: Sarita.foxworth@va.gov or FAX: (352) 381-5747.

MARCH 7, 2012.

<SUBJECT>R--OASIS MEMBERSHIP RENEWAL  Sources Sought  
<SOLNBR>VA70112I0143

<DESC>Introduction:

This Request for Information (RFI) is for information and planning purposes only and shall not be construed as a solicitation or as an obligation on the part of the Department of Veterans Affairs (VA).  The purpose of this RFI is to identify qualified contractors who are able to meet VA's requirements and other market information readily available.  
The Veterans Health Administration (VHA) is seeking interested sources (contractors) for a near-future solicitation and procurement for a membership with OASIS.  At this time, no solicitation exists.  Therefore, DO NOT REQUEST A COPY OF THE SOLICITATION.  
2.  Background:   The Veterans Health Administration (VHA) represents a leading national healthcare system and has been actively engaged with OASIS collaborating on conceptual approaches, performance measures, other emerging tools and guidance to improve health care.   Oasis is one of only two key (Tier 1) standards development organization that VA participates in to create technical specifications that allow VA to securely exchange veteran healthcare information with DoD and other healthcare partners.
3.  Scope of Work:  The contractor shall provide the VHA a full membership in OASIS, including participation on member councils and workgroups.  This Request for Information (RFI) provides a description of the membership privileges that will be provided by OASIS.
3.   Period of Performance:  4/23/2012 to 4/22/2013.
 
4.  Type of Order:  Firm Fixed Price.  

5.  Place of Performance: Contractor's site. 
6.  Travel and Per Diem:  Not applicable. No travel is required for this contract.
7.  SPECIFIC MANDATORY TASKS AND PRICE/COST SCHEDULE: 
The contractor shall provide a full membership with the associated privileges as follows within the overall period of performance. Said privileges begin immediately upon inception of contract performance period.
7.1   Membership Privileges.
INVOLVE AN UNLIMITED NUMBER OF YOUR EMPLOYEES IN AN OASIS COMMITTEE AS MEMBERS OR OBSERVERS.  GUIDE STANDARDS EFFORTS BY CHAIRING COMMITTEES (SUBJECT TO VOTE).  SECURES YOUR PLACE IN THE INTERNATIONAL COMMUNITY THAT RECOGNIZES THE IMPORTANCE OF INTEROPERABILITY AND INTELLIGENT INFORMATION EXCHANGE.  BECOME PART OF THE SOLUTION AND ENSURE YOUR VIEWS ARE REPRESENTED IN THE DEVELOPMENT, CONVERGENCE, AND ADOPTION OF OPEN STANDARDS.  INFLUENCE STRATEGIC DIRECTION OF THE CONSORTIUM BY NOMINATING CANDIDATES FOR SERVING ON AND VOTING FOR OASIS BOARD OF DIRECTORS AND TECHNICAL ADVISORY BOARD.  ACCESS THE MEMBERS-ONLY WEBSITE CONTAINING INSIDER'S INFORMATION ABOUT EMERGING TECHNOLOGIES AND THE KEY PLAYERS BEHIND THEM.  RECEIVE DISCOUNTS FOR MAY INDUSTRY EVENTS, TRAINING CLASSES, BOOKS, ETC.  RAISE YOUR CREDIBILITY WITH INDUSTRY ANALYSTS BY INCLUSION IN BRIEFINGS CONCERNING COMMITTEE WORK IN WHICH YOU PARTICIPATE.  
 
Price/Cost Schedule:   For a one year membership.
Submittal Information:

Contractors having the skills and capabilities necessary to perform the stated requirements should submit a response of no more than 5 pages in length, single spaced, 12 point font minimum that addresses the above information.  The Government will not review any other data, attachments that are in excess to the 5 pages.  In response to the RFI, interested contractors shall submit the following information no later than March 7, 2012 1630 EST to Merrie Frost (via email only please) at merrie.frost@va.gov.   
 
All responses must include the following information: Company name, Cage code, CCR number, Dunn & Bradstreet number, company address, Point of contact name, phone number, fax number, and email. The subject line of the correspondence should clearly display the RFI number. Also please provide the following information in your response. 

A.	Past Experience - Provide the following information on a maximum of three similar projects completed within the last three years for which the responder was a prime or subcontractor.  

1.	The name, address, and value of each project
2.	The Prime Contract Type, Firm Fixed-Price, or Time and Material
3.	The name, telephone and address of the owner of each project
4.	A description of each project, including difficulties and successes
5.	Your company's role and services provided for each project.

<SUBJECT>A--Service Dog Project for Veterans with Post-Traumatic Stress Disorder   
<SOLNBR>VA24012I0095
<RESPDATE>030912
<ARCHDATE>05082012
<CONTACT>Paula Stankovic, Contract Officer
paula.stankovic@va.gov

<a href="mailto:paula.stankovic@va.gov">Contract Specialist</a>
<DESC>
This sources sought is issued solely for informational, planning purposes and market research in accordance with FAR Part 10. This sources sought is seeking interest from all concerns capable and interested in meeting the following requirements.  
Subject: Sources Sought for Service Dogs specifically trained to work with individuals diagnosed with Post Traumatic Stress Disorder (PTSD).  In accordance with 2010 Bill S.1390, sec 1084 the Department of Veterans Affairs will conduct a pilot program on the use of service dogs with treatment and or rehabilitation of veterans with physical or mental injuries or disabilities.  Due to the previous research within the VA the research team has chosen to focus on PTSD and subsequent mental health improvements which may result from provision of a service dog. Agencies shall be able to, at a minimum, meet the following capabilities/standards:  
"	Agency shall meet the requirements of a "service dog" as stated in Americans with Disabilities Act (ADA) Subpart A 36.104.
"	Agency shall show prior experience providing dogs specifically trained to work with individuals diagnosed with Post Traumatic Stress Disorder (PTSD). References will be required for all trainers.
"	Agency shall provide face to face, age appropriate education for family members residing in the home with the recipient and ensure all members understand the implications of living with a service dog.  
"	Agency shall provide dogs trained in specific tasks based on the individual needs of the veteran.
"	Agency shall provide to the VA a quarterly report on the placement of all dogs.  
"	Agency shall provide contact information for current insurance carrier.
"	Agency shall provide information on adverse events; including return of a service dog; reports of nipping or biting from a service dog; or a service dog illness which impedes or impairs the service dog's ability to satisfactorily perform duties.
"	Agency shall be willing to provide documented proof of safety checks that are completed to ensure the health and wellness of the service dog and individual to study representatives following placement.
"	Agency must be located within a 125 mile radius of the James A. Haley Veterans' Hospital, Tampa, FL to ensure proper monitoring procedures.
"	Agency shall be able to provide health insurance for each dog.  The insurance will cover the maximum percentage of the cost of treatments and provide coverage for hereditary and congenital conditions.  The insurance will also include the maximum percentage of accident, illness and injury with an annual deductable if applicable.  In addition, the insurance shall include two annual routine wellness check-ups.
"	Agency shall provide veterinary care program (VCP) for all service dogs placed in the home. This VCP shall include information related to the dog's weight, temperature, and a health assessment.  This will also include veterinarian visits for each dog prior to placement and again at stated intervals after placement.   
"	Agency employees entering veteran homes shall be required meet all Contractor Personnel Security and Suitability requirements inclusive of background investigations conducted by the federal government. 
"	Agency must comply with VA Acquisitions Regulations (VAAR) subpart 839.201: Information and information technology security requirements inclusive of 852.273-75.
"	Service dogs shall meet the following minimum standards for public access and shall include:
"	Documented minimum of 120 hours of schooling over six (6) months.
"	Thirty (30) hours (Documented) shall be devoted to outings that prepare the service dog for work in public places.
"	Documented obedience training (sit, stay, come, down, heel and off leash recall) in response to verbal and/or hand commands. 
"	Documented passing of the AKC good canine citizen's test.
"	Family certification for receipt and agreement of the dog-pairing. 
"	Documentation to indicate that home environment is appropriate for the housing of a service dog. 
"	Documentation shall be provided to prove that the dogs to be provided have the desired temperament to be a service dog candidate (e.g.  have manners which include non-aggressive behavior, no begging of food, no urination without command, no barking or growling, no sniffing of other dogs and people when they pass, no running off). Service dog identification cards shall be provided to the veteran upon successful completion of training with their service dog.
All responses will be used to determine the appropriate acquisition strategy for the future acquisition. No award will be made from this sources sought. A solicitation is not available; therefore, do not request a copy of a solicitation. The Department of Veterans Affairs at this time is not seeking proposals and will not accept unsolicited proposals.
The North American Industry Classification System (NAICS) code is 812910, and small business size standard is $7 million.  Responses should be typed and submitted by electronic mail no later than Friday, March 9, 2012 at 3:00 pm Eastern Standard Time.  Response can be submitted to Paula Stankovic, Contract Officer at paula.stankovic@va.gov.      Please provide the following information: Company's name, address, point of contact, telephone and fax numbers, business size/type (Large, Veteran -Owned, 8(a), HUBZone, SDB, JWOD, Women-Owned, etc), cage code, email address, web site (if applicable), experience, and an overview of you r company and ability to meet the requirements (10 page limit). Any information provided is voluntary.  Be advised that the government will not pay for any information or administrative cost incurred to this sources sought. All cost associated with this sources sought will be solely at the expense of the respondents. Additionally all submissions become government property and will not be returned. No basis for a claim against the government shall arise as a result from a response to this sources sought.

<SOLNBR>SPO700-99-D-0301
<RESPDATE>032012
<ARCHDATE>03212012
<CONTACT>John Lower, Contracting Officer, Phone (402) 232-8660, Email john.lower@offutt.af.mil
<DESC>This is a notice of the Government's intent to extend the period of performance and increase the contract dollar value for the current Weapons Systems Technology Information Analysis Center (WSTIAC) contract. The contract is scheduled to expire 30 June 2012. The intent is to extend the present performance period for the timeframe required to execute the Defense System Technical Area Tasks acquisition (approximately 18 months). The estimated value of the WSTIAC contract will increase by approximately $600M. The Government intends to negotiate with the incumbent contractor, Alion Science and Technology Corporation Laboratories, on a sole-source basis. This extension will permit the continuation of performance of the current WSTIAC contract while the requirement is recompeted. This is a non-commercial, Research &amp; Development, Cost-Plus-Fixed-Fee, Requirements contract that was awarded on a competitive basis. This is neither a Request for Proposal nor a solicitation of offers. Any information received from industry by close of business 20 March 2012, will be considered by the Government solely for the purpose of determining whether to conduct a competitive acquisition. A determination by the Government not to compete this requirement based on responses to this notice is solely within the Government's discretion.

<SUBJECT>Repair of Viper II Hatch Mount Inmarsat Antenna (HMIA)
<SOLNBR>F2VTJ52053AQ01
<RESPDATE>040212
<CONTACT>Justin R. Mauser, Contract Specialist, Phone 8138286875, Email justin.mauser@us.af.mil - Ramon Jimenez, Contract Specialist, Phone 813-828-4724, Email ramon.jimenez.7@us.af.mil
<DESC><p style="text-align: center;">Repair of Viper II Hatch Mount Inmarsat Antenna (HMIA)<br />Request for Information</p>
<p>This is not a Request for Proposal (RFP). It is not to be construed as a commitment by the Government to issue a solicitation or ultimately award a contract. Responses will not be considered as proposals, nor will any award be made as a result of this Request for Information (RFI). The Air Force will NOT be responsible for any costs incurred by interested parties in response to this RFI. This FedBizOpps notice is an announcement seeking market information for businesses capable of providing the product as described herein. The 6th Contracting Squadron (6 CONS) is currently conducting market research to determine qualified, experienced, and interested potential sources. The information requested by this RFI will be used within the Air Force to facilitate decision making and will not be disclosed outside of the agency. Such information will be evaluated solely for the purpose of determining whether or not to conduct this procurement on a competitive basis. A determination by the Government not to compete this proposed effort on a full and open competition basis, based upon responses to this notice, is solely within the discretion of the Government. Oral communications ARE NOT acceptable in response to this notice. Sources shall include in their information, a detailed capabilities statement stating their experience in providing the same or similar items described in this notice, a point of contact with phone and e-mail information, business status (Socio-Economic Factors: 8(a), HUBZone, Service-Disabled Veteran-Owned Business), business size based on NAICS 811213, and a positive statement of interest to submit a proposal.</p>
<p>The 6th Contracting Squadron (6 CONS) is seeking information regarding the evaluation, repair, and testing of two Viper II Hatch Mount Inmarsat Antennas (HMIA's), serial numbers 128 and 129, for JCSE/J5. These two Viper II HMIA's provide high-speed video, voice and data over Inmarsat satellites for Command and Control Communications when integrated with the JACC/CP. Please see the attached Performance Work Statement (PWS) for more information regarding this requirement. The following information is requested:</p>
<p>CLIN 0001 - Evaluation of Low Noise Amplifier (LNA) (Qty 2)<br />CLIN 0002 - Repair of Low Noise Amplifier (LNA) to include testing, repair, parts, quality assurance, a new release certificate (8130), and 12 months warranty (Qty 2)<br />CLIN 0003 - Shipping (Qty 1)</p>
<p>For the purpose of this RFI, the anticipated North American Industry Classification System (NAICS) Code is 811213, Communication Equipment Repair and Maintenance, and the small business size standard is $10 million. Interested organizations may submit their capabilities, and qualifications to perform the effort in writing to Mr. Justin Mauser at justin.mauser@us.af.mil not later than 08:00 AM EST on 02 April 2012.</p>

These services will be for the period of March 1, 2012 through March 31, 2012. The Government believes that Duke University Medical Center is the only hospital that will satisfy the agency requirement for inmates referred for inpatient and outpatient physician and facility care when care is not otherwise available from the contract provider. <SNOTE>
<DATE>0302
<YEAR>12
<AGENCY>Department of Commerce
<OFFICE>National Institute of Standards and Technology (NIST)
<LOCATION>Acquisition Management Division
<ZIP>20899-1640
<CLASSCOD>66
<NAICS>331491
<OFFADD>100 Bureau Drive, Building 301, Room B129, Mail Stop 1640 Gaithersburg MD 20899-1640
<SUBJECT>NOTICE OF INTENT TO SOLE SOURCE:  Vandium Sample Cans
<SOLNBR>NB610020-12-01531
<RESPDATE>031612
<CONTACT>Paula Wilkison, Contract Specialist, Phone 301-975-8448, Email paula.wilkison@nist.gov - Patrick Staines, Contracting Officer, Phone (301)975-6335, Email patrick.staines@nist.gov
<DESC>The Department of Commerce, National Institute of Standards and Technology (NIST), intends to negotiate a firm fixed price purchase order, on a sole source basis, with Metal Technology of Albany, Oregon, for the purchase of vanadium sample cans under other than full and open competition by the authority of FAR subpart 13.106(1)(b).
<p><br />The NIST Center for Neutron Research has a requirement for additional vanadium sample cans to be used in neutron scattering powder diffraction experiments.</p>
<p>Metal Technology is the only contractor who can provide the vanadium deep drawn tubes and has the ability to electro-weld to titanium required by the design of the required sample cans. The design of the required sample cans makes explicit use of the deep drawn character of the tubes because the smooth closed end enables making the maximum use of the available sample without increasing unwanted background scattering. This characteristic is critical to NIST's use because neutron scattering samples are typically small but expensive or time-intensive to produce. The vanadium tubes are electro-welded to titanium flanges and are required to be helium leak-tight to a tight tolerance. This tight leak tolerance is crucial as they will contain a potentially radioactive powder.</p>
<p>Metal Technology is the only contractor with both the capability to produce the deep drawn vanadium tubes plus the experience and capability to electro-weld to titanium in order to produce the reliability required in order to meet NIST's requirements. Therefore, Metal Technology is uniquely qualified to provide the required vanadium sample cans.</p>
<p>Delivery shall be FOB Destination, Gaithersburg, MD, and be completed in accordance with the Contractor's commercial schedule.</p>
<p>The North American Industry Classification System (NAICS) code for this acquisition is 331491, and the size standard is 500 employees.</p>
<p>No solicitation package will be issued. This notice of intent is not a request for competitive quotations; however, interested persons may identify their interest and capability to respond to this requirement. The Government will consider responses received by 12:00 p.m. (EST) on March 16, 2012. Inquiries will only be accepted via email to paula.wilkison@nist.gov. No telephone requests will be honored.</p>
<p>A determination by the Government not to compete the proposed acquisition based upon responses to this notice is solely within the discretion of the Government. Information received will normally be considered solely for the purpose of determining whether to conduct a competitive procurement in the future.</p>

<URL>https://www.fbo.gov/spg/DOC/NIST/AcAsD/NB610020-12-01531/listing.html

<SETASIDE>N/A

<ZIP>27713

<SUBJECT>Splunk Enterprise Software
<SOLNBR>DL2464073
<RESPDATE>030912
<ARCHDATE>03312013
<CONTACT>Deitra Lunney, Phone 919-541-0387, Fax 919-541-5117, Email lunney@niehs.nih.gov
<DESC>The National Institute of Environmental Health Sciences (NIEHS), Research Triangle Park, NC intends to negotiate on a sole source basis with Splunk, San Francisco, CA 94107, pursuant to 41 U.S.C.253(c)(1)--Only one responsible source and no other supplies or services will satisfy agency requirements. This procurement is for Splunk Enterprise Perpetual, 2GB/day (1 ea), Training, Enterprise Support for 1 year, and Installation/Integration at our site. Splunk is the only IT search log event and correlation management tool used to consolidate and log all entries into a single location. The log event and correlation tool is the only solution that can index and store log data in a unique manner to allow faster access to all data. It is not limited by log or event format. This is unique in that it is able to work across heterogeneous environments that are present at the NIEHS. It is the only solution that can allow retrieval of the logs based on keyword searches in a few seconds. This (IT Search) log event and correlation tool is the only solution able to alert the system administrator(s) to receive errors and alerts as they occur (via snmp, email, RSS, Custom Script). This log event and correlation tool is the only one that can maintain a history of every log sent to allow the system administrator to conduct after-the-fact investigations or use for historical analysis at any time based off of time. Lastly this is the only tool that is not a relational database and is able to store and compress the IT data in its original format and support up to 3,000 messages per second. Interested parties may identify their interest and capability. Respond to this requirement by submitting written capabilities/specifications to the Contracting Specialist at the address stated above. This notice of intent is not a request for competitive proposals; however, all responses received within 8 days from the date of publication of this synopsis will be considered by the Government. A determination by the Government not to compete this proposed contract action based upon responses to this notice is solely with the discretion of the Government. Information received will normally be considered for the purpose of determining whether to conduct a competitive procurement. If no affirmative responses are received within 8 days of this notice to determine whether a qualified source is more advantageous to the Government, the order will be issued to Splunk. The NAICS Code/Size is 511210/$25.0 Million. This procurement is to be processed using Simplified Acquisition Procedures in conjunction with FAR Part 12, Acquisition of Commercial Items. There is no solicitation package available. For any questions regarding this announcement, please contact Dee Lunney via email <a href="mailto:lunney@niehs.nih.gov">lunney@niehs.nih.gov</a>

<SUBJECT>Independent and objective support services in aeronautical and space systems engineering.
<SOLNBR>NEEJ0000-12-01948
<RESPDATE>040212
<CONTACT>Jay S Parsick, Contract Specialist, Phone 301-628-1409, Fax 301-713-4155, Email jay.parsick@noaa.gov - Thomas F Fout, Supervisory Contract Specialist, Phone 301-628-1410, Fax 301-713-4155, Email thomas.f.fout@noaa.gov
<DESC>The U.S. Department of Commerce, NOAA/NESDIS/ AGO/NCAD, Building: SSMC2, 1325 East West Highway, RM 11375, Silver Spring, Maryland 20910, intends to award on a sole source basis in accordance with FAR 6.302-1(a)(1)(2)(i)(c), based on only one responsible source, where no other supplies of services will satisfy agency requirements. The proposed source is the MITRE Corporation, McLean, VA., which is a Federally Funded Research and Development Center (FFRDC). This work leads to briefings and recommendations to NOAA senior leadership on observation system capabilities, budget issues, system utility and the best combination of observing systems in NOAA's portfolio. The work in this area is considered "cutting edge" across Federal Government and NOAA's model is now being implemented by USGS and the National Earth Observations (NEO) task force under the President's Office of Science, Technology and Policy. The Technology Planning and Integration Office (TIPO) has been designated to directly apply the Joint Polar Satellite System Office (JPSS) and Technology Planning and Integration Office (TIPO) analysis methodology and tools developed by MITRE to this high priority, federal level, Task Force. This assessment of critical observing systems, identified across 17 federal agencies, is due Jul 01, 2012. This analysis is a direct deliverable to OSTP and OMB for impact to the FY13 and FY14 President's Budget. Further information regarding the requirements of this program can be found at the following web site: http://www.tpio.nosc.noaa.gov/tpio/. The MITRE Corporation shall provide unbiased professional, non-personal independent and objective support services in aeronautical and space systems engineering to manage, plan, design, fabricate and operate the national polar orbiting operational environmental satellite systems for the Joint Polar Satellite System Office (JPSS) and Technology Planning and Integration Office (TIPO).
<p>The Government anticipates a cost plus fixed fee contract with a period of performance for three (3) months.</p>
<p>This notice is published for informational purposes only and is not a request for competitive quotations. However, offerors who believe they can meet this requirement are to submit in writing an affirmative response.</p>
<p>All responses must include a written narrative statement of capability, including detailed technical information demonstrating the company's ability to meet the above requirements. The response must be sufficient to permit agency analysis to establish a bona fide capability to meet the requirements. Failure to submit such documentation shall result in the Government proceeding as stated above. A determination by the Government not to open the requirement to competition based upon responses to this notice is solely within the discretion of the Government. Affirmative written responses must be received no later than 45 calendar days after publication of this synopsis. Proposal submissions must be submitted to the following person listed as the Government point of contact in this announcement. All questions must be submitted in writing to the attention of the Government Contract Specialist.</p>

<SUBJECT>Lake Clark National Park & Preserve Summer Season Housing
<SOLNBR>
<ARCHDATE>03022013
<CONTACT>

<a href="mailto:EC_helpdesk@NBC.GOV">Point of Contact above, or if none listed, contact the IDEAS EC HELP DESK for assistance</a>
<DESC>Contract No. P12PX22556TAS: 14 5049
This J&A is also available at https://ideasec.nbc.gov/j2ee/opportunities.jsp
In accordance with FAR 6.305, FAR 5.406, and FAR 13.501, this special notice publishes the Justification and Approvals for Other than Full and Open Competition. This is not a request for competitive proposals, bids, or quotes. The Government shall consider all responses received prior to the close date of this announcement. Written responses to this notice shall contain sufficient documentation to establish bona fide capability to fulfill the requirement. A solicitation is not available. Please email Contract Specialist, Christie VandenDries, at christie_vandendries@nps.gov with responses or questions regarding this requirement.
DESCRIPTION OF THE REQUIREMENTRental housing is needed for our summer field season. The following accommodations are needed in Port Alsworth from June 1, 2012 through September 30, 2012:Rental Housing4 Months of furnished seasonal housing to accommodate:-One or more shared bathrooms-One shared kitchen and utensils-Linen and laundry facilities-Renter will furnish fire extinguishers and smoke detectors in accordance with residential fire codes-A telephone will be available for local calls.  Non-local calls require a calling card.-Three bedrooms with a total of ten beds.-Electricity-Fuel
Period of Performance: June 1, 2012 through September 30, 2012
Expectations of renters:1. Housekeeping duties will be maintained by tenants.2. Maintenance will be accomplished by renters.3. Propane will be provided by the renters.4. No Smoking
Estimated contract value, including all options is $8,800.
SUPPORTING INFORMATION Alaska's Homestead Inn is the only lodging available in Port Alsworth that will satisfy the Park's needs. Lake Clark National Park and Preserve has a large staff of summer transients and researchers. The house accommodates 10 beds, two full bathrooms, a laundry facility, and full kitchen. Alaska's Homestead Inn provides all linens and kitchen supplies as well. While Port Alsworth has another lodge for housing, it cannot accommodate the amount of staff and beds required by the Park. There simply no other lodging available in Port Alsworth to meet the needs of the park and its staff.  Lodges are at full capacity all summer and the church bible camp housing is full as well.  Past rental from 2007 season has been sold to park employees and is not an option.  The park has rented this house prior to 2007 (under different ownership) and from 2008 through 2010.  
EFFORTS TO LOCATE OTHER SOURCESAlaska's Homestead Inn has provided these facilities for several previous seasons. A thorough internet search was conducted for additional sources. Searching real estate sites, VRBO sites, and hotel searches did not produce any additional capable sources. All actions have been taken by the Government to remove or overcome barriers to competition before any subsequent acquisition for required supplies or services.

<DESC><p>&nbsp;</p>
<p><strong style="mso-bidi-font-weight: normal"><span style="LINE-HEIGHT: 115%; FONT-SIZE: 10pt">Announcing GSA Opening Doors 2012-2013 Conferences and Host Cities</span></strong></p>
<p><span style="LINE-HEIGHT: 115%; FONT-SIZE: 10pt">The U.S. General Services Administration is pleased to announce its upcoming series of Opening Doors 2012-2013 small business conferences and host cities in the Pacific Rim Region:</span></p>
<p style="LINE-HEIGHT: 12pt; MARGIN: 0in 6pt 0pt 0in"><span><span style="FONT-FAMILY: 'Calibri', 'sans-serif'; COLOR: #f5876c; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; mso-ascii-theme-font: minor-latin; mso-hansi-theme-font: minor-latin; mso-bidi-font-family: Helvetica">HAWAII | June 19-20, 2012 [Honolulu]</span></span></p>
<p style="LINE-HEIGHT: 12pt; MARGIN: 0in 6pt 0pt 0in"><span style="FONT-FAMILY: 'Calibri', 'sans-serif'; COLOR: #333333; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; mso-ascii-theme-font: minor-latin; mso-hansi-theme-font: minor-latin; mso-bidi-font-family: Helvetica">&nbsp;</span></p>
<p style="LINE-HEIGHT: 12pt; MARGIN: 0in 6pt 0pt 0in"><strong><span style="FONT-FAMILY: 'Calibri', 'sans-serif'; COLOR: #6b809b; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; mso-ascii-theme-font: minor-latin; mso-hansi-theme-font: minor-latin; mso-bidi-font-family: Helvetica">NEVADA | September 5-6, 2012 [Henderson]</span></strong></p>
<p style="LINE-HEIGHT: 12pt; MARGIN: 0in 6pt 0pt 0in"><span style="FONT-FAMILY: 'Calibri', 'sans-serif'; COLOR: #333333; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; mso-ascii-theme-font: minor-latin; mso-hansi-theme-font: minor-latin; mso-bidi-font-family: Helvetica">&nbsp;</span></p>
<p style="LINE-HEIGHT: 12pt; MARGIN: 0in 6pt 0pt 0in"><strong><span style="FONT-FAMILY: 'Calibri', 'sans-serif'; COLOR: #8c9c7b; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; mso-ascii-theme-font: minor-latin; mso-hansi-theme-font: minor-latin; mso-bidi-font-family: Helvetica">CALIFORNIA | April 9-10, 2013 [Oakland]</span></strong></p>
<p style="LINE-HEIGHT: 12pt; MARGIN: 0in 6pt 0pt 0in"><span style="FONT-FAMILY: 'Calibri', 'sans-serif'; COLOR: #333333; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; mso-ascii-theme-font: minor-latin; mso-hansi-theme-font: minor-latin; mso-bidi-font-family: Helvetica">&nbsp;</span></p>
<p style="LINE-HEIGHT: 12pt; MARGIN: 0in 6pt 0pt 0in"><strong><span style="FONT-FAMILY: 'Calibri', 'sans-serif'; COLOR: #847059; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; mso-ascii-theme-font: minor-latin; mso-hansi-theme-font: minor-latin; mso-bidi-font-family: Helvetica">ARIZONA | September 5-6, 2013 [Phoenix]</span></strong></p>
<p style="LINE-HEIGHT: 12pt; MARGIN: 12pt 6pt 12pt 0in"><span style="COLOR: #333333; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; mso-fareast-font-family: 'Times New Roman'; mso-bidi-font-family: Helvetica">Opening Doors connects small businesses in all socioeconomic categories with government agencies and their prime contractors in the pursuit of contracting and subcontracting opportunities.</span></p>
<p style="LINE-HEIGHT: 12pt; MARGIN: 12pt 6pt 12pt 0in"><strong style="mso-bidi-font-weight: normal"><span style="COLOR: #333333; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; mso-fareast-font-family: 'Times New Roman'; mso-bidi-font-family: Helvetica">Connect at a single event in one venue with:</span></strong></p>
<p style="LINE-HEIGHT: 13.2pt; TEXT-INDENT: -0.25in; MARGIN: 0in 6pt 0pt 42pt; mso-list: l1 level1 lfo1; tab-stops: list .5in"><span style="COLOR: #333333; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; mso-bidi-font-family: Calibri; mso-bidi-theme-font: minor-latin"><span>&bull;1.<span style="FONT: 7pt 'Times New Roman'">&nbsp;&nbsp; </span></span></span><strong><span style="COLOR: #333333; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; mso-fareast-font-family: 'Times New Roman'; mso-bidi-font-family: Helvetica">Federal, state and local</span></strong><span style="COLOR: #333333; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; mso-fareast-font-family: 'Times New Roman'; mso-bidi-font-family: Helvetica"> government administrators, contracting officers, and project managers </span></p>
<p style="LINE-HEIGHT: 13.2pt; TEXT-INDENT: -0.25in; MARGIN: 0in 6pt 0pt 42pt; mso-list: l1 level1 lfo1; tab-stops: list .5in"><span style="COLOR: #333333; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; mso-bidi-font-family: Calibri; mso-bidi-theme-font: minor-latin"><span>&bull;2.<span style="FONT: 7pt 'Times New Roman'">&nbsp;&nbsp; </span></span></span><span style="COLOR: #333333; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; mso-fareast-font-family: 'Times New Roman'; mso-bidi-font-family: Helvetica">Small business advocates and program managers from <strong>multiple federal agencies</strong> <br style="mso-special-character: line-break" /><br style="mso-special-character: line-break" /></span></p>
<p style="LINE-HEIGHT: 13.2pt; MARGIN: 0in 6pt 0pt 0in"><span style="COLOR: #333333; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; mso-fareast-font-family: 'Times New Roman'; mso-bidi-font-family: Helvetica">The conference's new state-by-state focus for 2012-2013 allows us to tailor our program for targeted networking, certification, forecasting and training exposure.</span></p>
<p style="LINE-HEIGHT: 12pt; MARGIN: 0in 6pt 0pt"><strong><span style="COLOR: #333333; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; mso-fareast-font-family: 'Times New Roman'; mso-bidi-font-family: Helvetica">&nbsp;</span></strong></p>
<p style="TEXT-ALIGN: justify; LINE-HEIGHT: 12pt; MARGIN: 0in 6pt 0pt 0in"><strong><span style="COLOR: #333333; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; mso-fareast-font-family: 'Times New Roman'; mso-bidi-font-family: Helvetica">Each location boasts:</span></strong></p>
<p style="LINE-HEIGHT: 13.2pt; TEXT-INDENT: -0.25in; MARGIN: 1.5pt 6pt 1.5pt 0.5in; mso-add-space: auto; mso-list: l2 level1 lfo2"><span style="FONT-FAMILY: Symbol; COLOR: #333333; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; mso-fareast-font-family: Symbol; mso-bidi-font-family: Symbol"><span>&bull;&middot;<span style="FONT: 7pt 'Times New Roman'">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; </span></span></span><span style="COLOR: #333333; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; mso-fareast-font-family: 'Times New Roman'; mso-bidi-font-family: Helvetica">Pre-scheduled, one-on-one business matchmaking appointments between buyers and sellers </span></p>
<p style="LINE-HEIGHT: 13.2pt; TEXT-INDENT: -0.25in; MARGIN: 1.5pt 6pt 1.5pt 0.5in; mso-add-space: auto; mso-list: l2 level1 lfo2"><span style="FONT-FAMILY: Symbol; COLOR: #333333; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; mso-fareast-font-family: Symbol; mso-bidi-font-family: Symbol"><span>&bull;&middot;<span style="FONT: 7pt 'Times New Roman'">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; </span></span></span><span style="COLOR: #333333; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; mso-fareast-font-family: 'Times New Roman'; mso-bidi-font-family: Helvetica">A dozen workshops for small businesses at the beginner, intermediate and advanced degrees of experience with government contracts</span></p>
<p style="LINE-HEIGHT: 13.2pt; TEXT-INDENT: -0.25in; MARGIN: 1.5pt 6pt 1.5pt 0.5in; mso-add-space: auto; mso-list: l2 level1 lfo2"><span style="FONT-FAMILY: Symbol; COLOR: #333333; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; mso-fareast-font-family: Symbol; mso-bidi-font-family: Symbol"><span>&bull;&middot;<span style="FONT: 7pt 'Times New Roman'">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; </span></span></span><span style="COLOR: #333333; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; mso-fareast-font-family: 'Times New Roman'; mso-bidi-font-family: Helvetica">Dynamic keynotes from government and industry leaders</span></p>
<p style="LINE-HEIGHT: 13.2pt; TEXT-INDENT: -0.25in; MARGIN: 1.5pt 6pt 1.5pt 0.5in; mso-add-space: auto; mso-list: l2 level1 lfo2"><span style="FONT-FAMILY: Symbol; COLOR: #333333; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; mso-fareast-font-family: Symbol; mso-bidi-font-family: Symbol"><span>&bull;&middot;<span style="FONT: 7pt 'Times New Roman'">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; </span></span></span><span style="COLOR: #333333; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; mso-fareast-font-family: 'Times New Roman'; mso-bidi-font-family: Helvetica">Large business and government roundtables highlighting contracting and subcontracting opportunities</span></p>
<p style="LINE-HEIGHT: 13.2pt; TEXT-INDENT: -0.25in; MARGIN: 1.5pt 6pt 1.5pt 0.5in; mso-add-space: auto; mso-list: l2 level1 lfo2"><span style="FONT-FAMILY: Symbol; COLOR: #333333; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; mso-fareast-font-family: Symbol; mso-bidi-font-family: Symbol"><span>&bull;&middot;<span style="FONT: 7pt 'Times New Roman'">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; </span></span></span><span style="COLOR: #333333; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; mso-fareast-font-family: 'Times New Roman'; mso-bidi-font-family: Helvetica">More than 70 exhibits from federal, state and local government agencies, their prime contractors and other potential buyers </span></p>
<p style="LINE-HEIGHT: 12pt; MARGIN: 0in 6pt 0pt 0in"><strong><span style="COLOR: #333333; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; mso-fareast-font-family: 'Times New Roman'; mso-bidi-font-family: Helvetica">&nbsp;</span></strong></p>
<p style="LINE-HEIGHT: 12pt; MARGIN: 0in 6pt 0pt 0in"><strong><span style="COLOR: #333333; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; mso-fareast-font-family: 'Times New Roman'; mso-bidi-font-family: Helvetica">Who should attend/exhibit:</span></strong></p>
<p style="LINE-HEIGHT: 12pt; TEXT-INDENT: -0.25in; MARGIN: 0in 6pt 0pt 0.5in; mso-add-space: auto; mso-list: l0 level1 lfo3"><span style="FONT-FAMILY: Symbol; COLOR: #333333; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; mso-bidi-font-weight: bold; mso-fareast-font-family: Symbol; mso-bidi-font-family: Symbol"><span>&bull;&middot;<span style="FONT: 7pt 'Times New Roman'">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; </span></span></span><span style="COLOR: #333333; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; mso-bidi-font-weight: bold; mso-fareast-font-family: 'Times New Roman'; mso-bidi-font-family: Helvetica">Small businesses new to the government market</span></p>
<p style="LINE-HEIGHT: 12pt; TEXT-INDENT: -0.25in; MARGIN: 0in 6pt 0pt 0.5in; mso-add-space: auto; mso-list: l0 level1 lfo3"><span style="FONT-FAMILY: Symbol; COLOR: #333333; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; mso-bidi-font-weight: bold; mso-fareast-font-family: Symbol; mso-bidi-font-family: Symbol"><span>&bull;&middot;<span style="FONT: 7pt 'Times New Roman'">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; </span></span></span><span style="COLOR: #333333; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; mso-bidi-font-weight: bold; mso-fareast-font-family: 'Times New Roman'; mso-bidi-font-family: Helvetica">Small businesses familiar with the government market seeking subcontracting opportunities with prime contractors</span></p>
<p style="LINE-HEIGHT: 12pt; TEXT-INDENT: -0.25in; MARGIN: 0in 6pt 0pt 0.5in; mso-add-space: auto; mso-list: l0 level1 lfo3"><span style="FONT-FAMILY: Symbol; COLOR: #333333; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; mso-bidi-font-weight: bold; mso-fareast-font-family: Symbol; mso-bidi-font-family: Symbol"><span>&bull;&middot;<span style="FONT: 7pt 'Times New Roman'">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; </span></span></span><span style="COLOR: #333333; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; mso-bidi-font-weight: bold; mso-fareast-font-family: 'Times New Roman'; mso-bidi-font-family: Helvetica">Experienced prime contractors looking to form new </span><a href="http://www.gsa.gov/portal/content/200553"><span style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; mso-bidi-font-weight: bold; mso-fareast-font-family: 'Times New Roman'; mso-bidi-font-family: Helvetica">Contractor Team Arrangements</span></a><span style="COLOR: #333333; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; mso-bidi-font-weight: bold; mso-fareast-font-family: 'Times New Roman'; mso-bidi-font-family: Helvetica"> or to participate in GSA's </span><a href="http://www.gsa.gov/portal/content/105301"><span style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; mso-bidi-font-weight: bold; mso-fareast-font-family: 'Times New Roman'; mso-bidi-font-family: Helvetica">Mentor-Prot&eacute;g&eacute; Program</span></a></p>
<p style="LINE-HEIGHT: 12pt; TEXT-INDENT: -0.25in; MARGIN: 0in 6pt 0pt 0.5in; mso-add-space: auto; mso-list: l0 level1 lfo3"><span style="FONT-FAMILY: Symbol; COLOR: #333333; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; mso-bidi-font-weight: bold; mso-fareast-font-family: Symbol; mso-bidi-font-family: Symbol"><span>&bull;&middot;<span style="FONT: 7pt 'Times New Roman'">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; </span></span></span><a href="http://www.gsa.gov/portal/category/100611"><span style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; mso-bidi-font-weight: bold; mso-fareast-font-family: 'Times New Roman'; mso-bidi-font-family: Helvetica">GSA Schedule</span></a><span style="COLOR: #333333; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; mso-bidi-font-weight: bold; mso-fareast-font-family: 'Times New Roman'; mso-bidi-font-family: Helvetica"> contractors wanting to learn more about regional or state shifts in focus and how to follow the money to new business opportunities</span></p>
<p style="LINE-HEIGHT: 12pt; MARGIN: 0in 6pt 0pt 0in"><span style="COLOR: #333333; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; mso-bidi-font-weight: bold; mso-fareast-font-family: 'Times New Roman'; mso-bidi-font-family: Helvetica">&nbsp;</span></p>
<p style="LINE-HEIGHT: 12pt; MARGIN: 0in 6pt 0pt 0in"><span style="COLOR: #333333; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; mso-bidi-font-weight: bold; mso-fareast-font-family: 'Times New Roman'; mso-bidi-font-family: Helvetica">It's time to connect. <SNOTE>
<DATE>0302
<YEAR>12
<AGENCY>Department of the Navy
<OFFICE>Space and Naval Warfare Systems Command
<LOCATION>SPAWAR Systems Center Atlantic
<ZIP>29419
<OFFADD>P.O. Box 190022, North Charleston SC 29419-9022
<SUBJECT>RFI - Potable Water Distribution Systems
<SOLNBR>N65236_SNOTE_0003FC6E
<ARCHDATE>03302012
<CONTACT>

<a href="mailto:paula.somers@navy.mil">Contract Specialist</a>
<DESC>Request for Information (RFI) - Potable Water Distribution SystemsSubmissions are due nlt noon (EST) on March 30, 2012The Space and Naval Warfare Systems Center (SPAWARSYSCEN) Atlantic, AdvancedTechnology Branch (Code 52130) is seeking information on commercially-availablepotable water distribution systems.  Water distribution systems are mobilesystems and equipment used for the transport and distribution of potable ornonpotable water.  Examples include pumping systems, piping, and storagecontainers with spigots or other facilities for filling personal containers.The Department of Homeland Security (DHS) Authorized Equipment List (AEL) itemnumber for this equipment is 19GN-00-H2OD: System, Water Distribution.  Theprimary focus of this request is on water distribution systems used where cleanwater is not available (e.g., dispensers, storage tanks, and transporttrailers).  The target audience for this information is emergency managementagencies, public health departments, and public utilities.  All submittalsshould be suited to their specific needs.Review of this information is being performed for the DHS System Assessment andValidation for Emergency Responders (SAVER) Program, which aims to conductobjective comparative assessments and validation of commercial equipment andsystems and provide those results with the emergency responder community.  Formore information on the SAVER Program, visit https://www.rkb.us/saver.All information received will be treated as public knowledge and may be used inSAVER Program documentation; therefore, vendors should not submit proprietaryinformation in response to this RFI.SPECIFIC INFORMATION SOUGHT INCLUDES:1. Company information, including name, address, URL, revenue, and number ofemployees.   2. Whether the company is a manufacturer or distributor.   3. Apoint of contact for follow-up information, and the point of contacts phonenumber and e-mail address.     4. Product name and a brief description (75words or less) of each water distribution system.     5. Cost information suchas purchase price and General Services Administration (GSA) scheduleinformation.The submitted information will be evaluated for inclusion in SAVER projects.If a SAVER project on this type of equipment is executed, the equipmentselection will be based upon a number of factors, including responder surveysand focus group inputs.  Consequently, follow-up requests for feedback shouldnot be made through Federal Business Opportunities posting agency.  Vendors maybe contacted following submission for more detailed product information.Vendor provided information may be reformatted for publication in SAVER Programdocuments.SUBMITTALSRespondents are required to complete the attached product summary questionnaire(Potable Water Distribution Systems_RFI_pub.pdf) for each product and submitthe questionnaires FOLLOWING THE INSTRUCTIONS ON THE FIRST PAGE OF THEQUESTIONNAIRE.The technical point of contact is Darius Tavasoli at darius.tavasoli@navy.milor Brian Spell at brian.r.spell@navy.mil.The information received shall be reviewed to conduct objective, comparativeassessments and validation of available equipment and/or systems. A NOTEREGARDING THIS REQUEST FOR INFORMATION:  This RFI is for information gatheringand planning purposes only, and should not be construed as a Request forProposal (RFP) or solicitation of an offer.  The Government DOES NOT intend toaward a contract on the basis of this RFI or otherwise pay for the informationsolicited.   Submission of vendor information constitutes consent topublication of that information in SAVER Program documentation.The questionnaire and a Word document with the same information above areavailable on our e-commerce website https://e-Commerce.sscno.nmci.navy.mil.  Ifyou encounter issues regarding access to the website, please contact thee-Commerce webmaster.E-mail your non-technical, contract related questions to the ContractSpecialist at paula.somers@navy.mil.
<LINK>
<URL>https://www.fbo.gov/notices/fb73963ba6842d51f2f1e4def914849b
<DESC>Link To Document
<EMAIL>
<EMAIL>paula.somers@navy.mil
<DESC>Contract Specialist
<SETASIDE>N/A
</SNOTE>

<SUBJECT>X--US GOVERNMENT SEEKS SOURCES FOR LEASED RETAIL AND RELATED SPACE; zip codes 77004, 77005, 77006 or 77030
<SOLNBR>DACA63512USMC
<ARCHDATE>03022013
<CONTACT>Sarah J. Watts, 817-886-1288

<a href="mailto:sarah.j.watts@usace.army.mil">USACE District, Fort Worth</a>
<DESC>The US Army Corps of Engineers is seeking to lease approximately 1,200 gross square feet of existing Class A or B retail space, in the Houston, Texas area, specifically in or near the University of Houston or Rice University; or in or near zip codes 77004, 77005, 77006 or 77030. The ideal space would fit the following: building specifications in compliance with all federal, state, and local ordinances; force protection standards in compliance with Department of Defense's Unified Facility Criteria; outfitted with either designated or open parking. An initial five year lease is intended. Space must be ready for occupancy by 30 September 2012.<br>Expressions of interest should include the following:<br>- Building name and address<br>- Floor plan drawing<br>- Digital photo of street view of property<br>- Area (BOMA rentable square feet & BOMA usable square feet)<br>- Rental rate per square foot rentable space<br>- Common area factor(s) for available space, if applicable<br>Interested parties may contact: Sarah J. Watts at US Army Corps of Engineers, ATTN: CESWF-RE-A (Watts), 819 Taylor Street, Rm 2B03, Fort Worth, TX 76102-0300; 817-886-1288; or sarah.j.watts@usace.army.mil, no later than 30 March 2012. Note that this is a request for information only, not a solicitation for offers.

<SUBJECT>B--Notice of Intent to Awars a Sole Source Contract
<SOLNBR>W912EQ-12-S-0007
<ARCHDATE>05312012
<CONTACT>Jackie Primer, 1-901-544-3340

<a href="mailto:jackie.primer@mvm02.usace.army.mil">USACE District, Memphis</a>
<DESC>The U.S. Army Corps of Engineers intends to negotiate and award a sole source contract with McCray Drilling, LLC/Tri-State Testing citing FAR part 6 subpart 6.302-1.  To the best of the Government's knowledge, there are no other firms in the area that can satisfy the Government requirement. The work to be done under this contract consists of furnishing all personnel, equipment and supplies for Geotechnical boring and testing using a Geo-probe Dual Tube Soil Sampling Systems and providing laboratory testing in a certified laboratory in accordance with the Performance Work Statement.  Award of this contract will be in accordance with Federal Acquisition Regulations (FAR) Part 12, Acquisition of Commercial Items. THIS NOTICE IS NOT A REQUEST FOR COMPETITIVE PROPOSALS, however interested firms may submit a capability statement in response to the above requirement with cost/price information by March 5, 2012 @ 2:00 PM CST to Jackie Primer, Contract Specialist, Phone: (901) 544-3340, Fax: (901) 544-3710, Email: Jackie.primer@usace.army.mil. A determination by the Government not to open competition based responses to this notice is solely within the discretion of the Government.
