By submission of its offer, the offeror represents that it is not an inverted domestic corporation and is not a subsidiary of one. <br />( ) Sanctioned activities relating to Iran. <br />(1) Unless a waiver is granted or an exception applies as provided in paragraph (o)(2) of this provision, by submission of its offer, the offeror certifies that the offeror, or any person owned or controlled by the offeror, does not engage in any activities for which sanctions may be imposed under section 5 of the Iran Sanctions Act of 1996. <br />(2) The certification requirement of paragraph (o)(1) of this provision does not apply if- <br />(i) This solicitation includes a trade agreements certification (e.g., 52.212-3(g) or a comparable agency provision); and <br />(ii) The offeror has certified that all the offered products to be supplied are designated country end products. <br />(End of provision) <br />Alternate I (Apr 2002). As prescribed in 12.301(b)(2), add the following paragraph (c)(11) to the basic provision: <br />(11) (Complete if the offeror has represented itself as disadvantaged in paragraph (c)(4) or (c)(9) of this provision.) <br />[The offeror shall check the category in which its ownership falls]: <br />____ Black American. <br />____ Hispanic American. <br />____ Native American (American Indians, Eskimos, Aleuts, or Native Hawaiians). <br />____ Asian-Pacific American (persons with origins from Burma, Thailand, Malaysia, Indonesia, Singapore, Brunei, Japan, China, Taiwan, Laos, Cambodia (Kampuchea), Vietnam, Korea, The Philippines, U.S. Trust Territory of the Pacific Islands (Republic <br />of Palau), Republic of the Marshall Islands, Federated States of Micronesia, the Commonwealth of the Northern Mariana Islands, Guam, Samoa, Macao, Hong Kong, Fiji, Tonga, Kiribati, Tuvalu, or Nauru). <br />____ Subcontinent Asian (Asian-Indian) American (persons with origins from India, Pakistan, Bangladesh, Sri Lanka, Bhutan, the Maldives Islands, or Nepal). <br />____ Individual/concern, other than one of the preceding. <br />End of provision<br />14. 52.212-1 Instructions to Offerors -- Commercial Items (Jun 2008)<br />(a) North American Industry Classification System (NAICS) code and small business size standard. The NAICS code and small business size standard for this acquisition appear in Block 10 of the solicitation cover sheet (SF 1449). However, the small business size standard for a concern which submits an offer in its own name, but which proposes to furnish an item which it did not itself manufacture, is 500 employees.<br />(b) Submission of offers. Submit signed and dated offers to the office specified in this solicitation at or before the exact time specified in this solicitation. Offers may be submitted on the SF 1449, letterhead stationery, or as otherwise specified in the solicitation. As a minimum, offers must show --<br />(1) The solicitation number;<br />(2) The time specified in the solicitation for receipt of offers;<br />(3) The name, address, and telephone number of the offeror;<br />(4) A technical description of the items being offered in sufficient detail to evaluate compliance with the requirements in the solicitation. This may include product literature, or other documents, if necessary;<br />(5) Terms of any express warranty;<br />(6) Price and any discount terms;<br />(7) "Remit to" address, if different than mailing address;<br />(8) A completed copy of the representations and certifications at FAR 52.212-3 (see FAR 52.212-3(b) for those representations and certifications that the offeror shall complete electronically);<br />(9) Acknowledgment of Solicitation Amendments;<br />(10) Past performance information, when included as an evaluation factor, to include recent and relevant contracts for the same or similar items and other references (including contract numbers, points of contact with telephone numbers and other relevant information); and<br />(11) If the offer is not submitted on the SF 1449, include a statement specifying the extent of agreement with all terms, conditions, and provisions included in the solicitation. Offers that fail to furnish required representations or information, or reject the terms and conditions of the solicitation may be excluded from consideration.<br />(c) Period for acceptance of offers. The offeror agrees to hold the prices in its offer firm for 30 calendar days from the date specified for receipt of offers, unless another time period is specified in an addendum to the solicitation.<br />(d) Product samples. When required by the solicitation, product samples shall be submitted at or prior to the time specified for receipt of offers. Unless otherwise specified in this solicitation, these samples shall be submitted at no expense to the Government, and returned at the sender's request and expense, unless they are destroyed during preaward testing.<br />(e) Multiple offers. Offerors are encouraged to submit multiple offers presenting alternative terms and conditions or commercial items for satisfying the requirements of this solicitation. Each offer submitted will be evaluated separately.<br />(f) Late submissions, modifications, revisions, and withdrawals of offers. <br />(1) Offerors are responsible for submitting offers, and any modifications, revisions, or withdrawals, so as to reach the Government office designated in the solicitation by the time specified in the solicitation. If no time is specified in the solicitation, the time for receipt is 4:30 p.m., local time, for the designated Government office on the date that offers or revisions are due.<br />(2)<br />(i) Any offer, modification, revision, or withdrawal of an offer received at the Government office designated in the solicitation after the exact time specified for receipt of offers is "late" and will not be considered unless it is received before award is made, the Contracting Officer determines that accepting the late offer would not unduly delay the acquisition; and-<br />(A) If it was transmitted through an electronic commerce method authorized by the solicitation, it was received at the initial point of entry to the Government infrastructure not later than 5:00 p.m. one working day prior to the date specified for receipt of offers; or<br />(B) There is acceptable evidence to establish that it was received at the Government installation designated for receipt of offers and was under the Government's control prior to the time set for receipt of offers; or<br />(C) If this solicitation is a request for proposals, it was the only proposal received.<br />(ii) However, a late modification of an otherwise successful offer, that makes its terms more favorable to the Government, will be considered at any time it is received and may be accepted.<br />(3) Acceptable evidence to establish the time of receipt at the Government installation includes the time/date stamp of that installation on the offer wrapper, other documentary evidence of receipt maintained by the installation, or oral testimony or statements of Government personnel.<br />(4) If an emergency or unanticipated event interrupts normal Government processes so that offers cannot be received at the Government office designated for receipt of offers by the exact time specified in the solicitation, and urgent Government requirements preclude amendment of the solicitation or other notice of an extension of the closing date, the time specified for receipt of offers will be deemed to be extended to the same time of day specified in the solicitation on the first work day on which normal Government processes resume.<br />(5) Offers may be withdrawn by written notice received at any time before the exact time set for receipt of offers. Oral offers in response to oral solicitations may be withdrawn orally. If the solicitation authorizes facsimile offers, offers may be withdrawn via facsimile received at any time before the exact time set for receipt of offers, subject to the conditions specified in the solicitation concerning facsimile offers. An offer may be withdrawn in person by an offeror or its authorized representative if, before the exact time set for receipt of offers, the identity of the person requesting withdrawal is established and the person signs a receipt for the offer.<br />(g) Contract award (not applicable to Invitation for Bids). The Government intends to evaluate offers and award a contract without discussions with offerors. Therefore, the offeror's initial offer should contain the offeror's best terms from a price and technical standpoint. However, the Government reserves the right to conduct discussions if later determined by the Contracting Officer to be necessary. The Government may reject any or all offers if such action is in the public interest; accept other than the lowest offer; and waive informalities and minor irregularities in offers received.<br />(h) Multiple awards. The Government may accept any item or group of items of an offer, unless the offeror qualifies the offer by specific limitations. Unless otherwise provided in the Schedule, offers may not be submitted for quantities less than those specified. The Government reserves the right to make an award on any item for a quantity less than the quantity offered, at the unit prices offered, unless the offeror specifies otherwise in the offer.<br />(i) Availability of requirements documents cited in the solicitation.<br />(1)<br />(i) The GSA Index of Federal Specifications, Standards and Commercial Item Descriptions, FPMR Part 101-29, and copies of specifications, standards, and commercial item descriptions cited in this solicitation may be obtained for a fee by submitting a request to-<br />GSA Federal Supply Service Specifications Section <br />Suite 8100<br />470 L'Enfant Plaza, SW<br />Washington, DC 20407<br />Telephone (202) 619-8925)<br />Facsimile (202 619-8978).<br />(ii) If the General Services Administration, Department of Agriculture, or Department of Veterans Affairs issued this solicitation, a single copy of specifications, standards, and commercial item descriptions cited in this solicitation may be obtained free of charge by submitting a request to the addressee in paragraph (i)(1)(i) of this provision. Additional copies will be issued for a fee.<br />(2) Most unclassified Defense specifications and standards may be downloaded from the following ASSIST websites--<br />(i) ASSIST ( http://assist.daps.dla.mil ).<br />(ii) Quick Search (http://assist.daps.dla.mil/quicksearch/ ) <br />(iii) ASSISTdocs.com ( http://assistdocs.com ).<br />(3) Documents not available from ASSIST may be ordered from the Department of Defense Single Stock Point (DoDSSP) by-<br />(i) Using the ASSIST Shopping Wizard ( http://assist.daps.dla.mil/wizard );<br />(ii) Phoning the DoDSSP Customer Service Desk (215) 697-2179, Mon-Fri, 0730 to 1600 EST; or<br />(iii) Ordering from DoDSSP, Building 4 Section D, 700 Robbins Avenue, Philadelphia, PA 19111-5094, Telephone (215) 697/2197, Facsimile (215) 697-1462.<br />(4) Nongovernment (voluntary) standards must be obtained from the organization responsible for their preparation, publication, or maintenance.<br />(j) Data Universal Numbering System (DUNS) Number. (Applies to offers exceeding $3,000, and offers of $3,000 or less if the solicitation requires the Contractor to be registered in the Central Contractor Registration (CCR) database. The offeror shall enter, in the block with its name and address on the cover page of its offer, the annotation "DUNS" or "DUNS+4" followed by the DUNS or DUNS+4 number that identifies the offeror's name and address. The DUNS+4 is the DUNS number plus a 4-character suffix that may be assigned at the discretion of the offeror to establish additional CCR records for identifying alternative Electronic Funds Transfer (EFT) accounts (see FAR Subpart 32.11) for the same concern. If the offeror does not have a DUNS number, it should contact Dun and Bradstreet directly to obtain one. An offeror within the United States may contact Dun and Bradstreet by calling 1-866-705-5711 or via the Internet at http://fedgov.dnb.com/webform. An offeror located outside the United States must contact the local Dun and Bradstreet office for DUNS number. The offeror should indicate that it is an offeror for a Government contract when contacting the local Dun and Bradstreet office.<br />(k) Central Contractor Registration. Unless exempted by an addendum to this solicitation, by submission of an offer, the offeror acknowledges the requirement that a prospective awardee shall be registered in the CCR database prior to award, during performance and through final payment of any contract resulting from this solicitation. If the Offeror does not become registered in the CCR database in the time prescribed by the Contracting Officer, the Contracting Officer will proceed to award to the next otherwise successful registered Offeror. Offerors may obtain information on registration and annual confirmation requirements via the Internet at http://www.ccr.gov or by calling 1-888-227-2423 or 269-961-5757.<br />(l) Debriefing. If a post-award debriefing is given to requesting offerors, the Government shall disclose the following information, if applicable:<br />(1) The agency's evaluation of the significant weak or deficient factors in the debriefed offeror's offer.<br />(2) The overall evaluated cost or price and technical rating of the successful and debriefed offeror and past performance information on the debriefed offeror. <br />(3) The overall ranking of all offerors, when any ranking was developed by the agency during source selection.<br />(4) A summary of rationale for award;<br />(5) For acquisitions of commercial items, the make and model of the item to be delivered by the successful offeror.<br />(6) Reasonable responses to relevant questions posed by the debriefed offeror as to whether source-selection procedures set forth in the solicitation, applicable regulations, and other applicable authorities were followed by the agency.</p>
<p>15. 52.212-2 Evaluation-Commercial Items (Jan 1999) <br />(a) The Government will award a contract resulting from this solicitation to the responsible offeror whose offer/quote conforming to the solicitation will be most advantageous to the Government, price and other factors considered. The following factors shall be used to evaluate offers:<br />1. Past performance<br />The technical evaluation factors other than price, when combined, are approximately equal to price. Price will not be a numerically weighted factor in the evaluation of proposals. If the two or more highest rated technical proposals are considered to be essentially equal in terms of technical competence, price may become the determinative factor in making an award. <br />Ratings: All technical factors will be rated using an adjectival approach uitilizing the following adjectival ratings: Excellent, Good, Satisfactory, Marginal or Unsatisfactory. An Unsatisfactory proposal will not be considered for award. <br />2. PRICE <br />(a) Award, if made, will be made to the responsible offeror whose proposal, conforming to the solicitation, is determined to be the best value to the Government, technical, performance risk, price and other factors considered. In selecting the best overall offer, the Government will consider the value of each offer in terms of the evaluated technical quality offered for the price. The relative quality of offerors will be based upon their ability to meet or exceed the minimum performance requirements of this solicitation resulting in less risk of nonperformance, defective performance, and late performance under the resulting <br />Contract. The quality in technical offers will be compared with differences in the overall price to the Government.<br />(b) A written notice of award or acceptance of an offer, mailed or otherwise furnished to the successful offeror within the time for acceptance specified in the offer, shall result in a binding contract without further action by either party. Before the offer's specified expiration time, the Government may accept an offer (or part of an offer), whether or not there are negotiations after its receipt, unless a written notice of withdrawal is received before award.<br />(c) The Government reserves the right to award a contract on the basis of evaluation of the original submission without discussions or call for Final Proposal/Quote Revisions.</p>

<DESC><p>Please note the following questions have been addressed.<br /><br />Q1. Annex 6 (U.S. Firm Information Form) was not provided in the RFP. <br /><br />A1. Annex 6 may be found on pp 119-124 at the following link<br /><a href="http://www.ustda.gov/RFP/201251005A_BRA.pdf">http://www.ustda.gov/RFP/201251005A_BRA.pdf</a></p>
<p>Q2. Could you please provide Ecorodovias' CNPJ number? This is required for FedEx shipments being sent to Brazil from the United States.<br />&nbsp;<br />A2. CNPJ 08.873.873/0001-10</p>
<p>Q3. Page 13 of the RFP states that offerors shall include letters of commitment from the individuals proposed confirming their availability for contract performance. Please clarify whether "individuals" refers to each individual staff member proposed, or whether "individuals" refers to subcontractor firms and individuals.<br /><br />A3. "Individuals" means each individual staff member proposed to participate on the personnel team of the Offeror, including individuals that are members of the subcontractor firm being proposed by the Offeror.</p>
<p>Q4. Should the Letters of Commitment contain original signatures, or is it permissible to include scanned Letters of Commitment in the proposal? <br /><br />A4. The letters may be scanned.</p>
<p>Q5. The Definitional Mission Report in RFP Annex 3 provides personnel requirements on pages 44 - 48. Should offerors' proposals include key staff in these exact labor categories?<br /><br />A5. The Definitional Mission report provides a suggested team composition, but it is the responsibility of the Offeror to determine the best assignment of personnel in order to fulfill the requirements of the RFP. An Offeror may propose alternate team compostions that they feel will meet the needs of the RFP.</p>
<p>Q6. Should the U.S. Firm Information Form be completed by subcontractors, in addition to the Offeror?<br /><br />A6. Annex C of the U.S. Firm Information Form applies to subcontractors.</p>

VHA VISN 21 - 612 - Sacramento is taking this action in an effort to improve both vendor access and awareness of requests and the agency's ability to gather multiple, competed, real-time bids.All responsible Offerors that respond to this solicitation MUST submit the pricing portion of their bid using the online exchange located at www.FedBid.com. An Offeror may submit a series of pricing bids, which descend in price during the specified period of time for the aforementioned reverse auction. There is no cost to register, review procurement data or make a bid on www.FedBid.com.Offerors that are not currently registered to use www.FedBid.com should proceed to www.FedBid.com to complete their free registration. Offerors that require special considerations or assistance may contact the FedBid Helpdesk at 877-9FEDBID (877-933-3243) or via email at clientservices@fedbid.com. Offerors may not artificially manipulate the price of a transaction on www.FedBid.com by any means. It is unacceptable to place bad faith bids, to use decoys in the www.FedBid.com process or to collude with the intent or effect of hampering the competitive www.FedBid.com process.Should offerors require additional clarification, notify the point of contact or FedBid at 877-9FEDBID (877-933-3243) or clientservices@fedbid.com.Use of FedBid:   Buyers and Sellers agree to conduct this transaction through FedBid in compliance with the FedBid Terms of Use. Failure to comply with the below terms and conditions may result in offer being determined as non-responsive.<BR><BR>New Equipment ONLY; NO remanufactured or "gray market" items. All items must be covered by the manufacturer's warranty.<BR><BR>Bid MUST be good for 30 calendar days after close of Buy.<BR><BR>Partial shipments are permitted.<BR><BR>The selected Offeror must comply with the following commercial item terms and conditions. FAR 52.212-1, Instructions to Offerors - Commercial, applies to this acquisition. The selected Offeror must submit a completed copy of the provision at 52.212-3, Offeror Representations and Certifications - Commercial Items. FAR 52.212-4, Contract Terms and Conditions - Commercial Items, applies to this acquisition.<BR><BR>Vendor must comply with Section 508 of the Rehabilitation Act of 1973, as amended (29 U.S.C. 794d).<BR><BR>Vendor must be able to fill the requirement in its entirety.<BR><BR>If the hardware/software is inspected and deemed unacceptable the government will return the hardware/software and the vendor will pay for all associated shipping costs incurred to return the hardware/software.<BR><BR>Offeror must be registered in the Central Contractor Registration (CCR) database before an award can be made to them. If the offeror is not registered in the CCR, it may do so through the CCR website at http://www.ccr.gov.<BR><BR>Shipping must be free on board (FOB) destination CONUS (Continental U.S.), which means that the seller must deliver the goods on its conveyance at the destination specified by the buyer, and the seller is responsible for the cost of shipping and risk of loss prior to actual delivery at the specified destination.<BR><BR>Criteria: Vendor must clearly label all shipping documents/packing list withthe contract number and point of contact as described in the schedule of thecontract.<BR><BR>All items must be priced out separately and provided as as an attachment in addition to the LOT pricing required in the solicitation. Please submit all attachments through FedBid.<BR><BR>

<DESC>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;
<p style="mso-layout-grid-align: none"><strong style="mso-bidi-font-weight: normal"><span style="text-decoration: underline;"><span style="mso-bidi-font-size: 12.0pt">&nbsp; </span></span></strong></p>
<p style="mso-hyphenate: none"><span style="mso-bidi-font-size: 12.0pt">Request for Quotation (RFQ) Number SOL-OAA-12-000030</span></p>
<p style="mso-hyphenate: none"><span style="mso-bidi-font-size: 12.0pt"><span style="mso-tab-count: 2">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; </span>1 Toyota Land Cruiser 76 Series </span></p>
<p style="mso-hyphenate: none"><span style="mso-bidi-font-size: 12.0pt">&nbsp;</span></p>
<p><span style="mso-bidi-font-size: 12.0pt">Issue Date: <span style="mso-tab-count: 1">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; </span>March 01, 2012</span></p>
<p><span style="mso-bidi-font-size: 12.0pt">Closing Date:<span style="mso-tab-count: 1">&nbsp; </span>March 16, 2012</span></p>
<p><span style="mso-bidi-font-size: 12.0pt">Closing Time: 12:00 P.M. EST</span></p>
<p style="mso-hyphenate: none"><span style="mso-bidi-font-size: 12.0pt">&nbsp;</span></p>
<p style="mso-layout-grid-align: none"><span style="mso-bidi-font-size: 12.0pt">This is a combined synopsis/solicitation for commercial items prepared in accordance with the format in FAR Subpart 12.6 as supplemented with additional information included in this notice.<span style="mso-spacerun: yes">&nbsp; </span>This announcement constitutes the only solicitation; proposals are being requested and a written solicitation will not be issued. </span></p>
<p style="mso-layout-grid-align: none"><span style="mso-bidi-font-size: 12.0pt">&nbsp;</span></p>
<p style="mso-layout-grid-align: none"><a name="wp1088503"></a><span style="mso-bidi-font-size: 12.0pt">This solicitation is being issued as a small business set-aside.<span style="mso-spacerun: yes">&nbsp; </span>The North American Industry Classification System (NAICS) code for this acquisition is 336112.<span style="mso-spacerun: yes">&nbsp; </span><a name="wp1135905"></a>USAID intends to award a firm fixed price Purchase Order as a result of this RFQ. </span></p>
<p><span style="mso-bidi-font-size: 12.0pt">&nbsp;</span></p>
<p><span style="mso-bidi-font-size: 12.0pt">Issuance of this solicitation does not constitute an award commitment on the part of the Government, nor does it commit the Government to pay for costs incurred in the preparation and submission of a proposal.<span style="mso-spacerun: yes">&nbsp; </span></span></p>
<p><span style="mso-bidi-font-weight: bold; mso-bidi-font-size: 12.0pt">&nbsp;</span></p>
<p><span style="text-decoration: underline;"><span style="mso-bidi-font-size: 12.0pt; mso-fareast-font-family: Batang">Marking Requirements:</span></span><span style="mso-bidi-font-size: 12.0pt; mso-fareast-font-family: Batang"> M</span><span style="mso-bidi-font-size: 12.0pt">arking shall be in accordance with AIDAR 752.7009, Marking (JAN 1993), <a href="http://www.usaid.gov/policy/ads/300/aidar.pdf">http://www.usaid.gov/policy/ads/300/aidar.pdf</a>.<span style="mso-spacerun: yes">&nbsp; </span>Marking shall also comply with the USAID "Graphic Standards Manual" available at <a href="http://www.usaid.gov/branding">www.usaid.gov/branding</a>.</span></p>
<p><a name="wp1088507"></a><a name="wp1088508"></a><a name="wp1088509"></a><a name="wp1155673"></a><a name="wp1088499"></a><a name="wp1088796"></a><a name="wp1088797"></a><a name="wp1140995"></a><a name="wp1141005"></a><strong><span style="text-decoration: underline;"><span style="mso-bidi-font-size: 12.0pt"><span style="TEXT-DECORATION: none">&nbsp;</span></span></span></strong></p>
<p><strong><span style="text-decoration: underline;"><span style="mso-bidi-font-size: 12.0pt">I.<span style="mso-spacerun: yes">&nbsp;&nbsp; </span>Introduction</span></span></strong><span style="mso-bidi-font-size: 12.0pt">: USAID Office of Foreign Disaster Assistance (OFDA) has determined a need for an off-road 4 wheel drive vehicle with capacity to carry 5 people to support the ongoing humanitarian mission in Ethiopia.<span style="mso-spacerun: yes">&nbsp; </span>The Toyota Land Cruiser is a common vehicle in Ethiopia, known for its utility and the availability of spare parts.<span style="mso-spacerun: yes">&nbsp; </span>As the mission of the OFDA team in Ethiopia requires remote assessments in austere environments we require this specific model of Toyota Land Cruiser.<span style="mso-spacerun: yes">&nbsp;&nbsp; </span></span></p>
<p><strong><span style="mso-bidi-font-size: 12.0pt"><span style="mso-spacerun: yes">&nbsp;</span></span></strong></p>
<p><strong><span style="text-decoration: underline;"><span style="mso-bidi-font-size: 12.0pt">II. Objective:</span></span></strong><strong><span style="mso-bidi-font-size: 12.0pt"><span style="mso-spacerun: yes">&nbsp; </span></span></strong><span style="mso-bidi-font-weight: bold; mso-bidi-font-size: 12.0pt">OFDA has agreed to</span><span style="mso-bidi-font-size: 12.0pt"> the procurement of 1 specialized off road vehicles as outlined below and related shipping costs to the vendor.<span style="mso-spacerun: yes">&nbsp; </span>OFDA is responsible to support the Mission for the Emergency and Evacuation mobile radios and OFDA Logistics is responsible to monitor production schedule from the selected vendor.<span style="mso-spacerun: yes">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; </span></span></p>
<p><strong><span style="mso-bidi-font-size: 12.0pt">&nbsp;</span></strong></p>
<p><strong><span style="text-decoration: underline;"><span style="mso-bidi-font-size: 12.0pt">III. Scope</span></span></strong><strong><span style="mso-bidi-font-size: 12.0pt">:<span style="mso-spacerun: yes">&nbsp; </span></span></strong><span style="mso-bidi-font-weight: bold; mso-bidi-font-size: 12.0pt">Procure one Toyota Land Cruiser vehicle in accordance with the below specifications.<span style="mso-spacerun: yes">&nbsp; </span>To ensure </span><span style="mso-bidi-font-size: 12.0pt">the vehicle is inspected by OFDA Logistics and Communication Team.<span style="mso-spacerun: yes">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; </span></span></p>
<p style="mso-layout-grid-align: none"><span style="mso-bidi-font-size: 12.0pt; mso-fareast-font-family: Batang">&nbsp;</span></p>
<p style="mso-layout-grid-align: none"><span style="mso-bidi-font-size: 12.0pt; mso-fareast-font-family: Batang">&nbsp;</span></p>
<p style="mso-layout-grid-align: none"><strong style="mso-bidi-font-weight: normal"><span style="text-decoration: underline;"><span style="mso-bidi-font-size: 12.0pt">Instructions to Offerors:</span></span></strong></p>
<p style="mso-layout-grid-align: none"><span style="mso-bidi-font-size: 12.0pt">&nbsp;</span></p>
<p style="mso-layout-grid-align: none"><span style="mso-bidi-font-size: 12.0pt">The provision at FAR 52.212-1, Instructions to Offerors-Commercial, applies to this acquisition.</span></p>
<p style="mso-layout-grid-align: none"><span style="mso-bidi-font-size: 12.0pt">&nbsp;</span></p>
<p><strong style="mso-bidi-font-weight: normal"><span style="text-decoration: underline;"><span style="mso-bidi-font-size: 12.0pt">Submitted quotations must include the following</span></span></strong><span style="mso-bidi-font-size: 12.0pt">:</span></p>
<p><span style="mso-bidi-font-size: 12.0pt">&nbsp;</span></p>
<p style="MARGIN-LEFT: 0.75in; TEXT-INDENT: -0.25in; mso-list: l0 level1 lfo1"><span style="mso-bidi-font-size: 12.0pt"><span>&bull;1.<span style="FONT: 7pt 'Times New Roman'">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; </span></span></span><span style="mso-bidi-font-size: 12.0pt">A complete signed Standard Form 1449. The Standard Form 1449 can be found at <a href="http://www.wingovcon.com/downloads/sf1449.pdf">http://www.wingovcon.com/downloads/sf1449.pdf</a>.</span></p>
<p style="MARGIN-LEFT: 0.75in"><span style="mso-bidi-font-size: 12.0pt">&nbsp;</span></p>
<p style="MARGIN-LEFT: 0.75in; TEXT-INDENT: -0.25in; mso-list: l0 level1 lfo1"><span style="mso-bidi-font-size: 12.0pt"><span>&bull;2.<span style="FONT: 7pt 'Times New Roman'">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; </span></span></span><span style="mso-bidi-font-size: 12.0pt">A statement regarding your organization's ability to satisfy the terms and conditions of the RFQ.</span></p>
<p style="MARGIN-LEFT: 0.5in"><span style="mso-bidi-font-size: 12.0pt">&nbsp;</span></p>
<p style="MARGIN-LEFT: 0.75in; TEXT-INDENT: -0.25in; mso-layout-grid-align: none; mso-list: l0 level1 lfo1"><span style="mso-bidi-font-size: 12.0pt"><span>&bull;3.<span style="FONT: 7pt 'Times New Roman'">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; </span></span></span><span style="mso-bidi-font-size: 12.0pt"><span style="mso-spacerun: yes">&nbsp;</span>Information (e.g., brochures, product literature, technical features, and warrant</span></p>
<p style="MARGIN-LEFT: 0.75in; mso-layout-grid-align: none"><span style="mso-bidi-font-size: 12.0pt">provisions) that demonstrates how the proposed product(s) meet or exceed the minimum specifications set forth in this RFQ.<span style="mso-spacerun: yes">&nbsp;&nbsp; </span>Note:<span style="mso-spacerun: yes">&nbsp; </span>Quotes that do not adequately describe the specifications of the proposed products may be determined non-responsive.</span></p>
<p style="MARGIN-LEFT: 0.5in"><span style="mso-bidi-font-size: 12.0pt">&nbsp;</span></p>
<p style="MARGIN-LEFT: 0.75in; TEXT-INDENT: -0.25in; mso-layout-grid-align: none; mso-list: l0 level1 lfo1"><span style="mso-bidi-font-size: 12.0pt"><span>&bull;4.<span style="FONT: 7pt 'Times New Roman'">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; </span></span></span><span style="mso-bidi-font-size: 12.0pt">A completed copy of the provision at FAR 52.212-3, Offeror Representations and</span></p>
<p style="MARGIN-LEFT: 0.75in; mso-layout-grid-align: none"><span style="mso-bidi-font-size: 12.0pt">Certifications-Commercial Items, with its offer.</span></p>
<p><strong><span style="text-decoration: underline;"><span style="mso-bidi-font-size: 12.0pt"><span style="TEXT-DECORATION: none">&nbsp;</span></span></span></strong></p>
<p style="mso-layout-grid-align: none"><span style="text-decoration: underline;"><span style="mso-bidi-font-size: 12.0pt">Source Selection</span></span></p>
<p style="mso-layout-grid-align: none"><span style="mso-bidi-font-size: 12.0pt">&nbsp;</span></p>
<p style="mso-layout-grid-align: none; mso-outline-level: 4"><span style="mso-bidi-font-size: 12.0pt">Pursuant to FAR <span style="mso-bidi-font-weight: bold">15.101-2, Lowest Price Technically Acceptable Source Selection Process, award </span>will be made to the offeror submitting the lowest evaluated price that meets or exceeds the technical acceptability standards.</span></p>
<p style="mso-layout-grid-align: none"><span style="mso-bidi-font-size: 12.0pt">&nbsp;</span></p>
<p style="mso-layout-grid-align: none"><span style="mso-bidi-font-size: 12.0pt">Technical capability may be evaluated by how well the proposed products meet the minimum required technical specifications set forth in this RFQ.<a name="wp1088510"></a><a name="wp1088512"></a><a name="wp1088514"></a><a name="wp1089229"></a><a name="wp1089230"></a><a name="wp1095862"></a><a name="wp1095863"></a><a name="wp1096422"></a></span></p>
<p style="mso-layout-grid-align: none"><span style="mso-bidi-font-size: 12.0pt">&nbsp;</span></p>
<p style="TEXT-INDENT: 0.5in; LINE-HEIGHT: 115%"><strong style="mso-bidi-font-weight: normal"><span style="FONT-SIZE: 11pt; LINE-HEIGHT: 115%; LETTER-SPACING: -0.15pt; mso-fareast-font-family: Calibri">Vendors</span></strong><span style="FONT-SIZE: 11pt; LINE-HEIGHT: 115%; LETTER-SPACING: -0.15pt; mso-fareast-font-family: Calibri"> must be registered in the Central Contractor Registration ("<span style="text-decoration: underline;">CCR</span>") database prior to award at </span><span style="FONT-SIZE: 11pt; LINE-HEIGHT: 115%; FONT-FAMILY: 'Calibri','sans-serif'; mso-fareast-font-family: Calibri; mso-bidi-font-family: 'Times New Roman'"><a href="http://www.ccr.gov/"><span style="FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New Roman','serif'; LETTER-SPACING: -0.15pt; TEXT-DECORATION: none; text-underline: none">www.ccr.gov</span></a></span><span style="FONT-SIZE: 11pt; LINE-HEIGHT: 115%; LETTER-SPACING: -0.15pt; mso-fareast-font-family: Calibri">.<span style="mso-spacerun: yes">&nbsp; </span>Vendors must present their representations and certifications, through the Online Representation and Certifications Application ("<span style="text-decoration: underline;">ORCA</span>") (http://orca.bpn.gov).<span style="mso-spacerun: yes">&nbsp; </span></span></p>
<p style="LINE-HEIGHT: 115%; mso-hyphenate: none"><span style="FONT-SIZE: 11pt; LINE-HEIGHT: 115%; LETTER-SPACING: -0.15pt; mso-fareast-font-family: Calibri">&nbsp;</span></p>
<p style="TEXT-INDENT: 0.5in; LINE-HEIGHT: 115%; mso-hyphenate: none"><strong style="mso-bidi-font-weight: normal"><span style="FONT-SIZE: 11pt; LINE-HEIGHT: 115%; LETTER-SPACING: -0.15pt; mso-fareast-font-family: Calibri">Authorized Geographic Code:</span></strong><span style="FONT-SIZE: 11pt; LINE-HEIGHT: 115%; LETTER-SPACING: -0.15pt; mso-fareast-font-family: Calibri"><span style="mso-spacerun: yes">&nbsp; </span>The Authorized Geographic Code for this procurement is 937 </span></p>
<p style="TEXT-INDENT: 0.5in; LINE-HEIGHT: 115%; mso-hyphenate: none"><span style="FONT-SIZE: 11pt; LINE-HEIGHT: 115%; LETTER-SPACING: -0.15pt; mso-fareast-font-family: Calibri">&nbsp;</span></p>
<p><a name="wp1125401"></a><a name="wp1088511"></a><span><span style="COLOR: black; mso-bidi-font-size: 12.0pt">Questions may be addressed to Callie M. Johnson at cmjohnson@usaid.gov </span></span><span><span style="mso-bidi-font-size: 12.0pt">no later than March 13, 2012.</span></span></p>

<p><span style="mso-bidi-font-size: 12.0pt">Quotations must be received no later than the closing date and time set forth above.<span style="mso-spacerun: yes">&nbsp; </span>Quotations must reference RFQ Number SOL-OAA-12-000030 and may be submitted electronically to <a href="mailto:cmjohnson@usaid.gov">cmjohnson@usaid.gov</a> , or by hard copy to the following addresses:<a name="wp1088518"></a></span></p>

<p><span style="FONT-SIZE: 11pt"><span style="mso-tab-count: 1">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; </span></span></p>
<p style="mso-layout-grid-align: none">SPECIFICATIONS</p>
<p style="MARGIN-RIGHT: -0.5in; TEXT-ALIGN: center" align="center"><strong><span style="mso-bidi-font-size: 12.0pt">&nbsp;</span></strong></p>
<p style="MARGIN-RIGHT: -0.5in; TEXT-ALIGN: center" align="center"><strong><span style="mso-bidi-font-size: 12.0pt">&nbsp;</span></strong></p>
<p style="MARGIN-RIGHT: -0.5in; TEXT-ALIGN: center" align="center"><strong><span style="mso-bidi-font-size: 12.0pt">Toyota Land Cruiser 76 Series</span></strong></p>
<p style="MARGIN-RIGHT: -0.5in; TEXT-ALIGN: center" align="center"><strong><span style="text-decoration: underline;"><span style="mso-bidi-font-size: 12.0pt"><span style="TEXT-DECORATION: none">&nbsp;</span></span></span></strong></p>
<p><span style="mso-bidi-font-size: 12.0pt">&nbsp;</span></p>
<p><strong style="mso-bidi-font-weight: normal"><span style="mso-bidi-font-size: 12.0pt">Quantity, Base Vehicle, Fuel, Transmission, and Drive:</span></strong><span style="mso-bidi-font-size: 12.0pt"> </span></p>
<table style="BORDER-RIGHT: medium none; BORDER-TOP: medium none; BORDER-LEFT: medium none; BORDER-BOTTOM: medium none; BORDER-COLLAPSE: collapse; mso-border-alt: solid windowtext .5pt; mso-yfti-tbllook: 480; mso-padding-alt: 0in 5.4pt 0in 5.4pt; mso-border-insideh: .5pt solid windowtext; mso-border-insidev: .5pt solid windowtext" border="1" cellspacing="0" cellpadding="0">
<tbody>
<tr style="height: 20.65pt; mso-yfti-irow: 0; mso-yfti-firstrow: yes; mso-yfti-lastrow: yes;">
<td style="padding-right: 5.4pt; padding-left: 5.4pt; padding-bottom: 0in; width: 29.4pt; padding-top: 0in; height: 20.65pt; mso-border-alt: solid windowtext .5pt; border: windowtext 1pt solid;" width="39" valign="top">
<p><strong style="mso-bidi-font-weight: normal"><span style="mso-bidi-font-size: 12.0pt"><span style="mso-spacerun: yes">&nbsp;</span>1</span></strong></p>
</td>
<td style="border-right: windowtext 1pt solid; padding-right: 5.4pt; border-top: windowtext 1pt solid; padding-left: 5.4pt; padding-bottom: 0in; border-left: medium none; width: 478.2pt; padding-top: 0in; border-bottom: windowtext 1pt solid; height: 20.65pt; mso-border-alt: solid windowtext .5pt; mso-border-left-alt: solid windowtext .5pt;" width="638" valign="top">
<p><strong style="mso-bidi-font-weight: normal"><span style="mso-bidi-font-size: 12.0pt">2012 model<span style="mso-spacerun: yes">&nbsp; </span>Toyota Land Cruiser, 76 series, HZJ76L/R-RKMRS 4 door - Turbo Diesel - Manual -<span style="mso-spacerun: yes">&nbsp; </span>Left Hand Drive</span></strong></p>
</td>
</tr>
</tbody>
</table>
<p><strong style="mso-bidi-font-weight: normal"><span style="mso-bidi-font-size: 12.0pt">&nbsp;</span></strong></p>
<p><strong style="mso-bidi-font-weight: normal"><span style="mso-bidi-font-size: 12.0pt">&nbsp;</span></strong></p>
<p><strong style="mso-bidi-font-weight: normal"><span style="mso-bidi-font-size: 12.0pt">Specify Drive: Right Hand Drive</span></strong></p>
<p><strong style="mso-bidi-font-weight: normal"><em style="mso-bidi-font-style: normal"><span style="mso-bidi-font-size: 12.0pt">&nbsp;</span></em></strong></p>
<p><strong style="mso-bidi-font-weight: normal"><span style="mso-bidi-font-size: 12.0pt">Specify Purpose of Vehicle: </span></strong><span style="mso-bidi-font-size: 12.0pt">To transport OFDA Field Team in remote areas where relief efforts are being conducted on behalf of the United States Government.</span></p>
<p><span style="mso-bidi-font-size: 12.0pt">&nbsp;</span></p>
<p><strong style="mso-bidi-font-weight: normal"><span style="mso-bidi-font-size: 12.0pt">Destination:</span></strong><span style="mso-bidi-font-size: 12.0pt"> Identify separate line item shipping methods via air, sea, and combination freight to:</span></p>
<p><span style="mso-bidi-font-size: 12.0pt">Door delivery - Addis Ababa, Ethiopia</span></p>
<p><em style="mso-bidi-font-style: normal"><span style="mso-bidi-font-size: 12.0pt">&nbsp;</span></em></p>
<p><em style="mso-bidi-font-style: normal"><span style="mso-bidi-font-size: 12.0pt">Note:<span style="mso-spacerun: yes">&nbsp; </span><span style="text-decoration: underline;">OFDA is permitted to send<span style="mso-spacerun: yes">&nbsp; </span>a representative during production for the installation of full radio communications package that consists of UHF,VHF, SATFON and CODAN</span>.<span style="mso-spacerun: yes">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; </span></span></em></p>
<h3><span style="FONT-WEIGHT: normal; FONT-SIZE: 12pt; mso-bidi-font-weight: bold">&nbsp;</span></h3>
<table style="BORDER-RIGHT: medium none; BORDER-TOP: medium none; BORDER-LEFT: medium none; BORDER-BOTTOM: medium none; BORDER-COLLAPSE: collapse; mso-border-alt: solid windowtext .5pt; mso-yfti-tbllook: 480; mso-padding-alt: 0in 5.4pt 0in 5.4pt; mso-border-insideh: .5pt solid windowtext; mso-border-insidev: .5pt solid windowtext" border="1" cellspacing="0" cellpadding="0">
<tbody>
<tr style="mso-yfti-irow: 0; mso-yfti-firstrow: yes; mso-yfti-lastrow: yes">
<td style="BORDER-RIGHT: windowtext 1pt solid; PADDING-RIGHT: 5.4pt; BORDER-TOP: windowtext 1pt solid; PADDING-LEFT: 5.4pt; PADDING-BOTTOM: 0in; BORDER-LEFT: windowtext 1pt solid; PADDING-TOP: 0in; BORDER-BOTTOM: windowtext 1pt solid; mso-border-alt: solid windowtext .5pt" valign="top">
<p><strong><span style="mso-bidi-font-size: 12.0pt">Nomenclature: </span></strong><span style="mso-bidi-font-size: 12.0pt">Toyota Land Cruiser 76 series, HZJ76L/R-RKMRS <span style="mso-spacerun: yes">&nbsp;</span>4 x 4, 10 seater</span></p>
<p style="MARGIN-LEFT: 1.5in; TEXT-INDENT: -1.5in"><strong><span style="mso-bidi-font-size: 12.0pt">&nbsp;</span></strong></p>
<p style="MARGIN-LEFT: 1.5in; TEXT-INDENT: -1.5in"><strong><span style="mso-bidi-font-size: 12.0pt">Engine: </span></strong><span style="mso-bidi-font-weight: bold; mso-bidi-font-size: 12.0pt">4.2L V6 Turbo Diesel<span style="mso-spacerun: yes">&nbsp; </span></span></p>
<p><span style="mso-bidi-font-size: 12.0pt">&nbsp;</span></p>
<p><strong><span style="mso-bidi-font-size: 12.0pt">Transmission: </span></strong><span style="mso-bidi-font-weight: bold; mso-bidi-font-size: 12.0pt">Manual </span><span style="mso-bidi-font-size: 12.0pt"><span style="mso-spacerun: yes">&nbsp;</span></span></p>
<p style="MARGIN-LEFT: 0.25in"><span style="mso-bidi-font-size: 12.0pt"><span style="mso-tab-count: 1">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; </span></span></p>
<p style="MARGIN: 0in -0.5in 0pt 42pt; TEXT-INDENT: -42pt"><strong style="mso-bidi-font-weight: normal"><span style="mso-bidi-font-size: 12.0pt">Color: </span></strong><span style="mso-bidi-font-size: 12.0pt">White </span></p>
<p><span style="mso-bidi-font-size: 12.0pt">&nbsp;</span></p>
</td>
<td style="BORDER-RIGHT: windowtext 1pt solid; PADDING-RIGHT: 5.4pt; BORDER-TOP: windowtext 1pt solid; PADDING-LEFT: 5.4pt; PADDING-BOTTOM: 0in; BORDER-LEFT: medium none; PADDING-TOP: 0in; BORDER-BOTTOM: windowtext 1pt solid; mso-border-alt: solid windowtext .5pt; mso-border-left-alt: solid windowtext .5pt" valign="top">

<p style="MARGIN-LEFT: 66pt; TEXT-INDENT: -66pt"><strong>Upholstery:<span style="mso-spacerun: yes">&nbsp; </span></strong><span style="mso-bidi-font-weight: bold">Standard upholstery applies for the make and model.<span style="mso-spacerun: yes">&nbsp; </span>No optional upholstery selections are authorized. </span></p>
<p style="MARGIN-LEFT: 1in; TEXT-INDENT: -1.5in"><span style="mso-bidi-font-size: 12.0pt"><span style="mso-tab-count: 1">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; </span></span></p>
<p style="MARGIN-LEFT: 1.5in; TEXT-INDENT: -1.5in"><strong><span style="mso-bidi-font-size: 12.0pt">Standard Features: Base Vehicle<span style="mso-spacerun: yes">&nbsp;&nbsp; </span></span></strong></p>
<p style="MARGIN-LEFT: 1.5in; TEXT-INDENT: -1.5in"><strong><span style="mso-bidi-font-size: 12.0pt">&nbsp;</span></strong></p>
<p style="MARGIN-LEFT: 1.5in; TEXT-INDENT: -1.5in"><span style="mso-bidi-font-weight: bold; mso-bidi-font-size: 12.0pt">Standard features apply to the year manufactured.<strong><span style="mso-tab-count: 1">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; </span></strong></span></p>
<p><span style="mso-bidi-font-size: 12.0pt">&nbsp;</span></p>
<h4><span style="mso-bidi-font-size: 12.0pt">Options and Accessories:<span style="mso-spacerun: yes">&nbsp; </span>Base Vehicle </span></h4>
<p><span style="mso-bidi-font-weight: bold">&nbsp;</span></p>
<p><span style="mso-bidi-font-weight: bold">Standard accessories apply to the 76 series model according to year manufactured.</span></p>
<p><span style="mso-bidi-font-size: 12.0pt">- AM/FM Radio/SW radio with CD player </span></p>
<p><em style="mso-bidi-font-style: normal"><span style="mso-bidi-font-weight: bold">Note:<span style="mso-spacerun: yes">&nbsp; </span>No options authorized unless approved by the Office of Security, Security Engineering Center.<span style="mso-spacerun: yes">&nbsp; </span>No LX version authorized </span></em></p>
<p><em style="mso-bidi-font-style: normal"><span style="mso-bidi-font-weight: bold">&nbsp;</span></em></p>
<p><strong style="mso-bidi-font-weight: normal"><span style="mso-bidi-font-size: 12.0pt">Armored Vehicle Vendor:</span></strong></p>
<p><strong style="mso-bidi-font-weight: normal"><span style="mso-bidi-font-size: 12.0pt">&nbsp;</span></strong></p>
<p><strong style="mso-bidi-font-weight: normal"><span style="mso-bidi-font-size: 12.0pt">Required Options and Accessories:</span></strong></p>
<p><strong style="mso-bidi-font-weight: normal"><span style="mso-bidi-font-size: 12.0pt">&nbsp;</span></strong></p>
<p><span style="mso-bidi-font-size: 12.0pt">- Dual heavy duty battery installation</span></p>
<p><span style="mso-bidi-font-size: 12.0pt">- High Altitude Compensator </span></p>
<p><span style="mso-bidi-font-size: 12.0pt">- Battery manual cutoff switches installed on negative terminal of each battery </span></p>
<p><span style="mso-bidi-font-size: 12.0pt">- One pieces steel rims (No Split Rim) </span></p>
<p><span style="mso-bidi-font-size: 12.0pt">- Off road rated tyres including 2 spare (one mounted rear door, one mounted on roof rack)</span></p>
<p><span style="mso-bidi-font-size: 12.0pt">- Fire extinguisher (mounted within occupied space)</span></p>
<p><span style="mso-bidi-font-size: 12.0pt">- First Aid kit</span></p>
<p><span style="mso-bidi-font-size: 12.0pt">- Skid Plate (3 mm steel) rear differential</span></p>
<p><span style="BACKGROUND: yellow; mso-bidi-font-size: 12.0pt; mso-highlight: yellow">-</span><span style="mso-bidi-font-size: 12.0pt"> Skid Plate protection to the underside of the front of the vehicle (3mm steel)</span></p>
<p><span style="mso-bidi-font-size: 12.0pt">- Steel mesh in tail pipe</span></p>
<p><span style="mso-bidi-font-size: 12.0pt">- Self-sealing fuel tank - Locking gas cap</span></p>
<p><span style="mso-bidi-font-size: 12.0pt">- Heavy Duty Brakes &amp; Brake fluid upgrade</span></p>
<p><span style="mso-bidi-font-size: 12.0pt">- Transmission Oil Cooler (Engine Transmission protection)</span></p>
<p><span style="mso-bidi-font-size: 12.0pt">- Spring and sway bar bushing upgrade</span></p>
<p><span style="mso-bidi-font-size: 12.0pt">- Undercoat/rust proofing</span></p>
<p><span style="mso-bidi-font-size: 12.0pt">- Airbag deactivation (or preferred, No airbags installed)</span></p>
<p><span style="mso-bidi-font-size: 12.0pt">- Upgrade Fuel tank 166L</span></p>
<p><span style="mso-bidi-font-size: 12.0pt">- Fresh air lock out</span></p>
<p><span style="mso-bidi-font-size: 12.0pt">- 3M Scotch Shield Film on rear OEM cargo/hatch door</span></p>
<p><span style="mso-bidi-font-size: 12.0pt">- Installation cost of government furnished communication equipment (UHF, VHF, SATFON, CODAN).</span></p>
<p><span style="mso-bidi-font-size: 12.0pt">- Heavy duty jack (manual hydraulic)</span></p>
<p><span style="mso-bidi-font-size: 12.0pt">- Hi-Lift jack with lockable mounting brackets (mounted horizontally (locking) to rear bumper)</span></p>
<p><span style="mso-bidi-font-size: 12.0pt">- Installed air compressor, under hood </span></p>
<p><span style="mso-bidi-font-size: 12.0pt">- Up Country Package w/snorkel</span></p>
<p><span style="mso-bidi-font-size: 12.0pt">- Bull Bar bumper with Codan antenna base</span></p>
<p><span style="mso-bidi-font-size: 12.0pt">- Fog Lights with covers</span></p>
<p><span style="mso-bidi-font-size: 12.0pt">- Rear heavy duty bumper with Pintle hook.<span style="mso-spacerun: yes">&nbsp; </span></span></p>
<p><span style="mso-bidi-font-size: 12.0pt">- Winch kit (with <strong style="mso-bidi-font-weight: normal">heavy-duty synthetic</strong> (non-metal) cable)</span></p>
<p><span style="mso-bidi-font-size: 12.0pt">- Recovery Strap Kit including: winch line dampener, snatch block, 6 ft tree trunk protector, 25 ft recovery strap, 2 D ring shackles, 2 pair of leather work gloves, carrying case</span></p>
<p><span style="mso-bidi-font-size: 12.0pt">- Basic vehicle tool kit (include tyre pressure gauge) </span></p>
<p><span style="mso-bidi-font-size: 12.0pt">- <strong style="mso-bidi-font-weight: normal">6 Months </strong>of Spare Parts Kit</span></p>
<p><span style="mso-bidi-font-size: 12.0pt">- <strong style="mso-bidi-font-weight: normal">4 Sets</strong> of keys for each vehicle</span></p>
<p><span style="mso-bidi-font-size: 12.0pt">- Roof Rack (must accommodate fuel containers and one spare tyre) </span></p>
<p><span style="mso-bidi-font-size: 12.0pt">- Two (2) 20 Liter (standard jerry can) DOT approved fuel containers with bracket that allows locking attachment to roof rack</span></p>
<p><span style="mso-bidi-font-size: 12.0pt"><span style="mso-tab-count: 2">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; </span></span></p>
<p><strong style="mso-bidi-font-weight: normal"><span style="text-decoration: underline;"><span style="mso-bidi-font-size: 12.0pt">V.<span style="mso-spacerun: yes">&nbsp; </span>Information Required on Vendors Quotations:</span></span></strong></p>
<p><strong style="mso-bidi-font-weight: normal"><span style="text-decoration: underline;"><span style="mso-bidi-font-size: 12.0pt"><span style="TEXT-DECORATION: none">&nbsp;</span></span></span></strong></p>
<p><span style="mso-bidi-font-size: 12.0pt">All vendors must submit their quotes on company letter head that contains the company's full name, address, telephone numbers, email addresses, and point of contact.<span style="mso-spacerun: yes">&nbsp; </span>The quote must also list the company's GSA contract number, Tax Identification Number (TIN), Data Universal Numbering System (DUN), and Small Business Filing Status if applicable.</span></p>
<p><span style="mso-bidi-font-size: 12.0pt">&nbsp;</span></p>
<p><span style="mso-bidi-font-size: 12.0pt">All charges must be separately listed as a single line item with all line items adding up to an over total cost, for example the cost for the base unit, the cost for upgrades, the cost for shipping base unit to vendor, the cost of the spare parts kit, and the cost for shipping the vehicle to <strong style="mso-bidi-font-weight: normal">Addis Ababa, Ethiopia</strong> must be separate line item charges. </span></p>
<p><span style="mso-bidi-font-size: 12.0pt">The quote must provide an armoring completion schedule in that includes: estimated timeline to acquire the base unit; estimated timeline of vehicle during production; and estimated timeline to ship to designation.</span></p>
<p style="MARGIN-LEFT: 0.5in">&nbsp;</p>
<p>The contractor shall provide OFDA Logistics with a weekly update of the status of this procurement until the order is completed.</p>
<p style="MARGIN: 0in 0in 0pt"><span style="FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New Roman','serif'">&nbsp;</span></p>
<p style="MARGIN: 0in 0in 0pt"><span style="FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New Roman','serif'">OFDA Logistics, (202) 712-0234 office, (202) 216-3399 fax</span></p>
<p style="MARGIN: 0in 0in 0pt"><span style="FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New Roman','serif'">&nbsp;</span></p>
<p style="MARGIN: 0in 0in 0pt"><span style="FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New Roman','serif'">The contractor is responsible for any and all storage (if any) in the execution of this task order.</span></p>

<p style="MARGIN: 0in 0in 0pt"><span style="FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New Roman','serif'">Offerors are advised that FAR 52.212-4, Contract Terms and Conditions - Commercial Items, applies to this acquisition.</span></p>

<DESC>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;
<p style="mso-layout-grid-align: none"><strong style="mso-bidi-font-weight: normal"><span style="text-decoration: underline;"><span style="mso-bidi-font-size: 12.0pt">&nbsp; </span></span></strong></p>
<p style="mso-hyphenate: none"><span style="mso-bidi-font-size: 12.0pt">Request for Quotation (RFQ) Number SOL-OAA-12-000030</span></p>
<p style="mso-hyphenate: none"><span style="mso-bidi-font-size: 12.0pt"><span style="mso-tab-count: 2">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; </span>1 Toyota Land Cruiser 76 Series </span></p>
<p style="mso-hyphenate: none"><span style="mso-bidi-font-size: 12.0pt">&nbsp;</span></p>
<p><span style="mso-bidi-font-size: 12.0pt">Issue Date: <span style="mso-tab-count: 1">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; </span>March 01, 2012</span></p>
<p><span style="mso-bidi-font-size: 12.0pt">Closing Date:<span style="mso-tab-count: 1">&nbsp; </span>March 16, 2012</span></p>
<p><span style="mso-bidi-font-size: 12.0pt">Closing Time: 12:00 P.M. EST</span></p>
<p style="mso-hyphenate: none"><span style="mso-bidi-font-size: 12.0pt">&nbsp;</span></p>
<p style="mso-layout-grid-align: none"><span style="mso-bidi-font-size: 12.0pt">This is a combined synopsis/solicitation for commercial items prepared in accordance with the format in FAR Subpart 12.6 as supplemented with additional information included in this notice.<span style="mso-spacerun: yes">&nbsp; </span>This announcement constitutes the only solicitation; proposals are being requested and a written solicitation will not be issued. </span></p>
<p style="mso-layout-grid-align: none"><span style="mso-bidi-font-size: 12.0pt">&nbsp;</span></p>
<p style="mso-layout-grid-align: none"><a name="wp1088503"></a><span style="mso-bidi-font-size: 12.0pt">This solicitation is being issued as a small business set-aside.<span style="mso-spacerun: yes">&nbsp; </span>The North American Industry Classification System (NAICS) code for this acquisition is 336112.<span style="mso-spacerun: yes">&nbsp; </span><a name="wp1135905"></a>USAID intends to award a firm fixed price Purchase Order as a result of this RFQ. </span></p>
<p><span style="mso-bidi-font-size: 12.0pt">&nbsp;</span></p>
<p><span style="mso-bidi-font-size: 12.0pt">Issuance of this solicitation does not constitute an award commitment on the part of the Government, nor does it commit the Government to pay for costs incurred in the preparation and submission of a proposal.<span style="mso-spacerun: yes">&nbsp; </span></span></p>
<p><span style="mso-bidi-font-weight: bold; mso-bidi-font-size: 12.0pt">&nbsp;</span></p>
<p><span style="text-decoration: underline;"><span style="mso-bidi-font-size: 12.0pt; mso-fareast-font-family: Batang">Marking Requirements:</span></span><span style="mso-bidi-font-size: 12.0pt; mso-fareast-font-family: Batang"> M</span><span style="mso-bidi-font-size: 12.0pt">arking shall be in accordance with AIDAR 752.7009, Marking (JAN 1993), <a href="http://www.usaid.gov/policy/ads/300/aidar.pdf">http://www.usaid.gov/policy/ads/300/aidar.pdf</a>.<span style="mso-spacerun: yes">&nbsp; </span>Marking shall also comply with the USAID "Graphic Standards Manual" available at <a href="http://www.usaid.gov/branding">www.usaid.gov/branding</a>.</span></p>
<p><a name="wp1088507"></a><a name="wp1088508"></a><a name="wp1088509"></a><a name="wp1155673"></a><a name="wp1088499"></a><a name="wp1088796"></a><a name="wp1088797"></a><a name="wp1140995"></a><a name="wp1141005"></a><strong><span style="text-decoration: underline;"><span style="mso-bidi-font-size: 12.0pt"><span style="TEXT-DECORATION: none">&nbsp;</span></span></span></strong></p>
<p><strong><span style="text-decoration: underline;"><span style="mso-bidi-font-size: 12.0pt">I.<span style="mso-spacerun: yes">&nbsp;&nbsp; </span>Introduction</span></span></strong><span style="mso-bidi-font-size: 12.0pt">: USAID Office of Foreign Disaster Assistance (OFDA) has determined a need for an off-road 4 wheel drive vehicle with capacity to carry 5 people to support the ongoing humanitarian mission in Ethiopia.<span style="mso-spacerun: yes">&nbsp; </span>The Toyota Land Cruiser is a common vehicle in Ethiopia, known for its utility and the availability of spare parts.<span style="mso-spacerun: yes">&nbsp; </span>As the mission of the OFDA team in Ethiopia requires remote assessments in austere environments we require this specific model of Toyota Land Cruiser.<span style="mso-spacerun: yes">&nbsp;&nbsp; </span></span></p>
<p><strong><span style="mso-bidi-font-size: 12.0pt"><span style="mso-spacerun: yes">&nbsp;</span></span></strong></p>
<p><strong><span style="text-decoration: underline;"><span style="mso-bidi-font-size: 12.0pt">II. Objective:</span></span></strong><strong><span style="mso-bidi-font-size: 12.0pt"><span style="mso-spacerun: yes">&nbsp; </span></span></strong><span style="mso-bidi-font-weight: bold; mso-bidi-font-size: 12.0pt">OFDA has agreed to</span><span style="mso-bidi-font-size: 12.0pt"> the procurement of 1 specialized off road vehicles as outlined below and related shipping costs to the vendor.<span style="mso-spacerun: yes">&nbsp; </span>OFDA is responsible to support the Mission for the Emergency and Evacuation mobile radios and OFDA Logistics is responsible to monitor production schedule from the selected vendor.<span style="mso-spacerun: yes">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; </span></span></p>
<p><strong><span style="mso-bidi-font-size: 12.0pt">&nbsp;</span></strong></p>
<p><strong><span style="text-decoration: underline;"><span style="mso-bidi-font-size: 12.0pt">III. Scope</span></span></strong><strong><span style="mso-bidi-font-size: 12.0pt">:<span style="mso-spacerun: yes">&nbsp; </span></span></strong><span style="mso-bidi-font-weight: bold; mso-bidi-font-size: 12.0pt">Procure one Toyota Land Cruiser vehicle in accordance with the below specifications.<span style="mso-spacerun: yes">&nbsp; </span>To ensure </span><span style="mso-bidi-font-size: 12.0pt">the vehicle is inspected by OFDA Logistics and Communication Team.<span style="mso-spacerun: yes">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; </span></span></p>
<p style="mso-layout-grid-align: none"><span style="mso-bidi-font-size: 12.0pt; mso-fareast-font-family: Batang">&nbsp;</span></p>
<p style="mso-layout-grid-align: none"><span style="mso-bidi-font-size: 12.0pt; mso-fareast-font-family: Batang">&nbsp;</span></p>
<p style="mso-layout-grid-align: none"><strong style="mso-bidi-font-weight: normal"><span style="text-decoration: underline;"><span style="mso-bidi-font-size: 12.0pt">Instructions to Offerors:</span></span></strong></p>
<p style="mso-layout-grid-align: none"><span style="mso-bidi-font-size: 12.0pt">&nbsp;</span></p>
<p style="mso-layout-grid-align: none"><span style="mso-bidi-font-size: 12.0pt">The provision at FAR 52.212-1, Instructions to Offerors-Commercial, applies to this acquisition.</span></p>
<p style="mso-layout-grid-align: none"><span style="mso-bidi-font-size: 12.0pt">&nbsp;</span></p>
<p><strong style="mso-bidi-font-weight: normal"><span style="text-decoration: underline;"><span style="mso-bidi-font-size: 12.0pt">Submitted quotations must include the following</span></span></strong><span style="mso-bidi-font-size: 12.0pt">:</span></p>
<p><span style="mso-bidi-font-size: 12.0pt">&nbsp;</span></p>
<p style="MARGIN-LEFT: 0.75in; TEXT-INDENT: -0.25in; mso-list: l0 level1 lfo1"><span style="mso-bidi-font-size: 12.0pt"><span>&bull;1.<span style="FONT: 7pt 'Times New Roman'">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; </span></span></span><span style="mso-bidi-font-size: 12.0pt">A complete signed Standard Form 1449. The Standard Form 1449 can be found at <a href="http://www.wingovcon.com/downloads/sf1449.pdf">http://www.wingovcon.com/downloads/sf1449.pdf</a>.</span></p>
<p style="MARGIN-LEFT: 0.75in"><span style="mso-bidi-font-size: 12.0pt">&nbsp;</span></p>
<p style="MARGIN-LEFT: 0.75in; TEXT-INDENT: -0.25in; mso-list: l0 level1 lfo1"><span style="mso-bidi-font-size: 12.0pt"><span>&bull;2.<span style="FONT: 7pt 'Times New Roman'">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; </span></span></span><span style="mso-bidi-font-size: 12.0pt">A statement regarding your organization's ability to satisfy the terms and conditions of the RFQ.</span></p>
<p style="MARGIN-LEFT: 0.5in"><span style="mso-bidi-font-size: 12.0pt">&nbsp;</span></p>
<p style="MARGIN-LEFT: 0.75in; TEXT-INDENT: -0.25in; mso-layout-grid-align: none; mso-list: l0 level1 lfo1"><span style="mso-bidi-font-size: 12.0pt"><span>&bull;3.<span style="FONT: 7pt 'Times New Roman'">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; </span></span></span><span style="mso-bidi-font-size: 12.0pt"><span style="mso-spacerun: yes">&nbsp;</span>Information (e.g., brochures, product literature, technical features, and warrant</span></p>
<p style="MARGIN-LEFT: 0.75in; mso-layout-grid-align: none"><span style="mso-bidi-font-size: 12.0pt">provisions) that demonstrates how the proposed product(s) meet or exceed the minimum specifications set forth in this RFQ.<span style="mso-spacerun: yes">&nbsp;&nbsp; </span>Note:<span style="mso-spacerun: yes">&nbsp; </span>Quotes that do not adequately describe the specifications of the proposed products may be determined non-responsive.</span></p>
<p style="MARGIN-LEFT: 0.5in"><span style="mso-bidi-font-size: 12.0pt">&nbsp;</span></p>
<p style="MARGIN-LEFT: 0.75in; TEXT-INDENT: -0.25in; mso-layout-grid-align: none; mso-list: l0 level1 lfo1"><span style="mso-bidi-font-size: 12.0pt"><span>&bull;4.<span style="FONT: 7pt 'Times New Roman'">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; </span></span></span><span style="mso-bidi-font-size: 12.0pt">A completed copy of the provision at FAR 52.212-3, Offeror Representations and</span></p>
<p style="MARGIN-LEFT: 0.75in; mso-layout-grid-align: none"><span style="mso-bidi-font-size: 12.0pt">Certifications-Commercial Items, with its offer.</span></p>
<p><strong><span style="text-decoration: underline;"><span style="mso-bidi-font-size: 12.0pt"><span style="TEXT-DECORATION: none">&nbsp;</span></span></span></strong></p>
<p style="mso-layout-grid-align: none"><span style="text-decoration: underline;"><span style="mso-bidi-font-size: 12.0pt">Source Selection</span></span></p>
<p style="mso-layout-grid-align: none"><span style="mso-bidi-font-size: 12.0pt">&nbsp;</span></p>
<p style="mso-layout-grid-align: none; mso-outline-level: 4"><span style="mso-bidi-font-size: 12.0pt">Pursuant to FAR <span style="mso-bidi-font-weight: bold">15.101-2, Lowest Price Technically Acceptable Source Selection Process, award </span>will be made to the offeror submitting the lowest evaluated price that meets or exceeds the technical acceptability standards.</span></p>
<p style="mso-layout-grid-align: none"><span style="mso-bidi-font-size: 12.0pt">&nbsp;</span></p>
<p style="mso-layout-grid-align: none"><span style="mso-bidi-font-size: 12.0pt">Technical capability may be evaluated by how well the proposed products meet the minimum required technical specifications set forth in this RFQ.<a name="wp1088510"></a><a name="wp1088512"></a><a name="wp1088514"></a><a name="wp1089229"></a><a name="wp1089230"></a><a name="wp1095862"></a><a name="wp1095863"></a><a name="wp1096422"></a></span></p>
<p style="mso-layout-grid-align: none"><span style="mso-bidi-font-size: 12.0pt">&nbsp;</span></p>
<p style="TEXT-INDENT: 0.5in; LINE-HEIGHT: 115%"><strong style="mso-bidi-font-weight: normal"><span style="FONT-SIZE: 11pt; LINE-HEIGHT: 115%; LETTER-SPACING: -0.15pt; mso-fareast-font-family: Calibri">Vendors</span></strong><span style="FONT-SIZE: 11pt; LINE-HEIGHT: 115%; LETTER-SPACING: -0.15pt; mso-fareast-font-family: Calibri"> must be registered in the Central Contractor Registration ("<span style="text-decoration: underline;">CCR</span>") database prior to award at </span><span style="FONT-SIZE: 11pt; LINE-HEIGHT: 115%; FONT-FAMILY: 'Calibri','sans-serif'; mso-fareast-font-family: Calibri; mso-bidi-font-family: 'Times New Roman'"><a href="http://www.ccr.gov/"><span style="FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New Roman','serif'; LETTER-SPACING: -0.15pt; TEXT-DECORATION: none; text-underline: none">www.ccr.gov</span></a></span><span style="FONT-SIZE: 11pt; LINE-HEIGHT: 115%; LETTER-SPACING: -0.15pt; mso-fareast-font-family: Calibri">.<span style="mso-spacerun: yes">&nbsp; </span>Vendors must present their representations and certifications, through the Online Representation and Certifications Application ("<span style="text-decoration: underline;">ORCA</span>") (http://orca.bpn.gov).<span style="mso-spacerun: yes">&nbsp; </span></span></p>
<p style="LINE-HEIGHT: 115%; mso-hyphenate: none"><span style="FONT-SIZE: 11pt; LINE-HEIGHT: 115%; LETTER-SPACING: -0.15pt; mso-fareast-font-family: Calibri">&nbsp;</span></p>
<p style="TEXT-INDENT: 0.5in; LINE-HEIGHT: 115%; mso-hyphenate: none"><strong style="mso-bidi-font-weight: normal"><span style="FONT-SIZE: 11pt; LINE-HEIGHT: 115%; LETTER-SPACING: -0.15pt; mso-fareast-font-family: Calibri">Authorized Geographic Code:</span></strong><span style="FONT-SIZE: 11pt; LINE-HEIGHT: 115%; LETTER-SPACING: -0.15pt; mso-fareast-font-family: Calibri"><span style="mso-spacerun: yes">&nbsp; </span>The Authorized Geographic Code for this procurement is 937 </span></p>
<p style="TEXT-INDENT: 0.5in; LINE-HEIGHT: 115%; mso-hyphenate: none"><span style="FONT-SIZE: 11pt; LINE-HEIGHT: 115%; LETTER-SPACING: -0.15pt; mso-fareast-font-family: Calibri">&nbsp;</span></p>
<p><a name="wp1125401"></a><a name="wp1088511"></a><span><span style="COLOR: black; mso-bidi-font-size: 12.0pt">Questions may be addressed to Callie M. Johnson at cmjohnson@usaid.gov </span></span><span><span style="mso-bidi-font-size: 12.0pt">no later than March 13, 2012.</span></span></p>
<p><span style="mso-bidi-font-size: 12.0pt">&nbsp;</span></p>
<p><span style="mso-bidi-font-size: 12.0pt">Quotations must be received no later than the closing date and time set forth above.<span style="mso-spacerun: yes">&nbsp; </span>Quotations must reference RFQ Number SOL-OAA-12-000030 and may be submitted electronically to <a href="mailto:cmjohnson@usaid.gov">cmjohnson@usaid.gov</a> , or by hard copy to the following addresses:<a name="wp1088518"></a></span></p>
<p style="TEXT-INDENT: 0.5in"><a name="wp1088520"></a><span style="FONT-SIZE: 12pt; FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New Roman','serif'">&nbsp;</span></p>
<p><span style="FONT-SIZE: 12pt; FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New Roman','serif'">U.S. Agency for International Development<span style="mso-tab-count: 2">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; </span>U.S. Agency for International Development</span></p>
<p><span style="FONT-SIZE: 12pt; FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New Roman','serif'">M/OAA/DCHA/AFP<span style="mso-tab-count: 5">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; </span>M/OAA/DCHA/AFP<strong style="mso-bidi-font-weight: normal"><span style="mso-tab-count: 1"> </span></strong></span></p>

<p style="mso-layout-grid-align: none">SPECIFICATIONS</p>
<p style="MARGIN-RIGHT: -0.5in; TEXT-ALIGN: center" align="center"><strong><span style="mso-bidi-font-size: 12.0pt">&nbsp;</span></strong></p>
<p style="MARGIN-RIGHT: -0.5in; TEXT-ALIGN: center" align="center"><strong><span style="mso-bidi-font-size: 12.0pt">&nbsp;</span></strong></p>
<p style="MARGIN-RIGHT: -0.5in; TEXT-ALIGN: center" align="center"><strong><span style="mso-bidi-font-size: 12.0pt">Toyota Land Cruiser 76 Series</span></strong></p>
<p style="MARGIN-RIGHT: -0.5in; TEXT-ALIGN: center" align="center"><strong><span style="text-decoration: underline;"><span style="mso-bidi-font-size: 12.0pt"><span style="TEXT-DECORATION: none">&nbsp;</span></span></span></strong></p>
<p><span style="mso-bidi-font-size: 12.0pt">&nbsp;</span></p>
<p><strong style="mso-bidi-font-weight: normal"><span style="mso-bidi-font-size: 12.0pt">Quantity, Base Vehicle, Fuel, Transmission, and Drive:</span></strong><span style="mso-bidi-font-size: 12.0pt"> </span></p>
<table style="BORDER-RIGHT: medium none; BORDER-TOP: medium none; BORDER-LEFT: medium none; BORDER-BOTTOM: medium none; BORDER-COLLAPSE: collapse; mso-border-alt: solid windowtext .5pt; mso-yfti-tbllook: 480; mso-padding-alt: 0in 5.4pt 0in 5.4pt; mso-border-insideh: .5pt solid windowtext; mso-border-insidev: .5pt solid windowtext" border="1" cellspacing="0" cellpadding="0">

</td>
<td style="border-right: windowtext 1pt solid; padding-right: 5.4pt; border-top: windowtext 1pt solid; padding-left: 5.4pt; padding-bottom: 0in; border-left: medium none; width: 478.2pt; padding-top: 0in; border-bottom: windowtext 1pt solid; height: 20.65pt; mso-border-alt: solid windowtext .5pt; mso-border-left-alt: solid windowtext .5pt;" width="638" valign="top">
<p><strong style="mso-bidi-font-weight: normal"><span style="mso-bidi-font-size: 12.0pt">2012 model<span style="mso-spacerun: yes">&nbsp; </span>Toyota Land Cruiser, 76 series, HZJ76L/R-RKMRS 4 door - Turbo Diesel - Manual -<span style="mso-spacerun: yes">&nbsp; </span>Left Hand Drive</span></strong></p>

<p><strong style="mso-bidi-font-weight: normal"><span style="mso-bidi-font-size: 12.0pt">&nbsp;</span></strong></p>
<p><strong style="mso-bidi-font-weight: normal"><span style="mso-bidi-font-size: 12.0pt">&nbsp;</span></strong></p>
<p><strong style="mso-bidi-font-weight: normal"><span style="mso-bidi-font-size: 12.0pt">Specify Drive:&nbsp;Left Hand Drive</span></strong></p>
<p><strong style="mso-bidi-font-weight: normal"><em style="mso-bidi-font-style: normal"><span style="mso-bidi-font-size: 12.0pt">&nbsp;</span></em></strong></p>
<p><strong style="mso-bidi-font-weight: normal"><span style="mso-bidi-font-size: 12.0pt">Specify Purpose of Vehicle: </span></strong><span style="mso-bidi-font-size: 12.0pt">To transport OFDA Field Team in remote areas where relief efforts are being conducted on behalf of the United States Government.</span></p>
<p><span style="mso-bidi-font-size: 12.0pt">&nbsp;</span></p>
<p><strong style="mso-bidi-font-weight: normal"><span style="mso-bidi-font-size: 12.0pt">Destination:</span></strong><span style="mso-bidi-font-size: 12.0pt"> Identify separate line item shipping methods via air, sea, and combination freight to:</span></p>
<p><span style="mso-bidi-font-size: 12.0pt">Door delivery - Addis Ababa, Ethiopia</span></p>
<p><em style="mso-bidi-font-style: normal"><span style="mso-bidi-font-size: 12.0pt">&nbsp;</span></em></p>
<p><em style="mso-bidi-font-style: normal"><span style="mso-bidi-font-size: 12.0pt">Note:<span style="mso-spacerun: yes">&nbsp; </span><span style="text-decoration: underline;">OFDA is permitted to send<span style="mso-spacerun: yes">&nbsp; </span>a representative during production for the installation of full radio communications package that consists of UHF,VHF, SATFON and CODAN</span>.<span style="mso-spacerun: yes">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; </span></span></em></p>
<h3><span style="FONT-WEIGHT: normal; FONT-SIZE: 12pt; mso-bidi-font-weight: bold">&nbsp;</span></h3>
<table style="BORDER-RIGHT: medium none; BORDER-TOP: medium none; BORDER-LEFT: medium none; BORDER-BOTTOM: medium none; BORDER-COLLAPSE: collapse; mso-border-alt: solid windowtext .5pt; mso-yfti-tbllook: 480; mso-padding-alt: 0in 5.4pt 0in 5.4pt; mso-border-insideh: .5pt solid windowtext; mso-border-insidev: .5pt solid windowtext" border="1" cellspacing="0" cellpadding="0">

<p><strong><span style="mso-bidi-font-size: 12.0pt">Nomenclature: </span></strong><span style="mso-bidi-font-size: 12.0pt">Toyota Land Cruiser 76 series, HZJ76L/R-RKMRS <span style="mso-spacerun: yes">&nbsp;</span>4 x 4, 10 seater</span></p>
<p style="MARGIN-LEFT: 1.5in; TEXT-INDENT: -1.5in"><strong><span style="mso-bidi-font-size: 12.0pt">&nbsp;</span></strong></p>
<p style="MARGIN-LEFT: 1.5in; TEXT-INDENT: -1.5in"><strong><span style="mso-bidi-font-size: 12.0pt">Engine: </span></strong><span style="mso-bidi-font-weight: bold; mso-bidi-font-size: 12.0pt">4.2L V6 Turbo Diesel<span style="mso-spacerun: yes">&nbsp; </span></span></p>
<p><span style="mso-bidi-font-size: 12.0pt">&nbsp;</span></p>
