<p style="MARGIN-LEFT: 66pt; TEXT-INDENT: -66pt"><strong>Upholstery:<span style="mso-spacerun: yes">&nbsp; </span></strong><span style="mso-bidi-font-weight: bold">Standard upholstery applies for the make and model.<span style="mso-spacerun: yes">&nbsp; </span>No optional upholstery selections are authorized. </span></p>
<p style="MARGIN-LEFT: 1in; TEXT-INDENT: -1.5in"><span style="mso-bidi-font-size: 12.0pt"><span style="mso-tab-count: 1">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; </span></span></p>
<p style="MARGIN-LEFT: 1.5in; TEXT-INDENT: -1.5in"><strong><span style="mso-bidi-font-size: 12.0pt">Standard Features: Base Vehicle<span style="mso-spacerun: yes">&nbsp;&nbsp; </span></span></strong></p>
<p style="MARGIN-LEFT: 1.5in; TEXT-INDENT: -1.5in"><strong><span style="mso-bidi-font-size: 12.0pt">&nbsp;</span></strong></p>
<p style="MARGIN-LEFT: 1.5in; TEXT-INDENT: -1.5in"><span style="mso-bidi-font-weight: bold; mso-bidi-font-size: 12.0pt">Standard features apply to the year manufactured.<strong><span style="mso-tab-count: 1">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; </span></strong></span></p>
<p><span style="mso-bidi-font-size: 12.0pt">&nbsp;</span></p>
<h4><span style="mso-bidi-font-size: 12.0pt">Options and Accessories:<span style="mso-spacerun: yes">&nbsp; </span>Base Vehicle </span></h4>
<p><span style="mso-bidi-font-weight: bold">&nbsp;</span></p>
<p><span style="mso-bidi-font-weight: bold">Standard accessories apply to the 76 series model according to year manufactured.</span></p>
<p><span style="mso-bidi-font-size: 12.0pt">- AM/FM Radio/SW radio with CD player </span></p>
<p><em style="mso-bidi-font-style: normal"><span style="mso-bidi-font-weight: bold">Note:<span style="mso-spacerun: yes">&nbsp; </span>No options authorized unless approved by the Office of Security, Security Engineering Center.<span style="mso-spacerun: yes">&nbsp; </span>No LX version authorized </span></em></p>
<p><em style="mso-bidi-font-style: normal"><span style="mso-bidi-font-weight: bold">&nbsp;</span></em></p>
<p><strong style="mso-bidi-font-weight: normal"><span style="mso-bidi-font-size: 12.0pt">Armored Vehicle Vendor:</span></strong></p>
<p><strong style="mso-bidi-font-weight: normal"><span style="mso-bidi-font-size: 12.0pt">&nbsp;</span></strong></p>
<p><strong style="mso-bidi-font-weight: normal"><span style="mso-bidi-font-size: 12.0pt">Required Options and Accessories:</span></strong></p>
<p><strong style="mso-bidi-font-weight: normal"><span style="mso-bidi-font-size: 12.0pt">&nbsp;</span></strong></p>
<p><span style="mso-bidi-font-size: 12.0pt">- Dual heavy duty battery installation</span></p>
<p><span style="mso-bidi-font-size: 12.0pt">- High Altitude Compensator </span></p>
<p><span style="mso-bidi-font-size: 12.0pt">- Battery manual cutoff switches installed on negative terminal of each battery </span></p>
<p><span style="mso-bidi-font-size: 12.0pt">- One pieces steel rims (No Split Rim) </span></p>
<p><span style="mso-bidi-font-size: 12.0pt">- Off road rated tyres including 2 spare (one mounted rear door, one mounted on roof rack)</span></p>
<p><span style="mso-bidi-font-size: 12.0pt">- Fire extinguisher (mounted within occupied space)</span></p>
<p><span style="mso-bidi-font-size: 12.0pt">- First Aid kit</span></p>
<p><span style="mso-bidi-font-size: 12.0pt">- Skid Plate (3 mm steel) rear differential</span></p>
<p><span style="BACKGROUND: yellow; mso-bidi-font-size: 12.0pt; mso-highlight: yellow">-</span><span style="mso-bidi-font-size: 12.0pt"> Skid Plate protection to the underside of the front of the vehicle (3mm steel)</span></p>
<p><span style="mso-bidi-font-size: 12.0pt">- Steel mesh in tail pipe</span></p>
<p><span style="mso-bidi-font-size: 12.0pt">- Self-sealing fuel tank - Locking gas cap</span></p>
<p><span style="mso-bidi-font-size: 12.0pt">- Heavy Duty Brakes &amp; Brake fluid upgrade</span></p>
<p><span style="mso-bidi-font-size: 12.0pt">- Transmission Oil Cooler (Engine Transmission protection)</span></p>
<p><span style="mso-bidi-font-size: 12.0pt">- Spring and sway bar bushing upgrade</span></p>
<p><span style="mso-bidi-font-size: 12.0pt">- Undercoat/rust proofing</span></p>
<p><span style="mso-bidi-font-size: 12.0pt">- Airbag deactivation (or preferred, No airbags installed)</span></p>
<p><span style="mso-bidi-font-size: 12.0pt">- Upgrade Fuel tank 166L</span></p>
<p><span style="mso-bidi-font-size: 12.0pt">- Fresh air lock out</span></p>
<p><span style="mso-bidi-font-size: 12.0pt">- 3M Scotch Shield Film on rear OEM cargo/hatch door</span></p>
<p><span style="mso-bidi-font-size: 12.0pt">- Installation cost of government furnished communication equipment (UHF, VHF, SATFON, CODAN).</span></p>
<p><span style="mso-bidi-font-size: 12.0pt">- Heavy duty jack (manual hydraulic)</span></p>
<p><span style="mso-bidi-font-size: 12.0pt">- Hi-Lift jack with lockable mounting brackets (mounted horizontally (locking) to rear bumper)</span></p>
<p><span style="mso-bidi-font-size: 12.0pt">- Installed air compressor, under hood </span></p>
<p><span style="mso-bidi-font-size: 12.0pt">- Up Country Package w/snorkel</span></p>
<p><span style="mso-bidi-font-size: 12.0pt">- Bull Bar bumper with Codan antenna base</span></p>
<p><span style="mso-bidi-font-size: 12.0pt">- Fog Lights with covers</span></p>
<p><span style="mso-bidi-font-size: 12.0pt">- Rear heavy duty bumper with Pintle hook.<span style="mso-spacerun: yes">&nbsp; </span></span></p>
<p><span style="mso-bidi-font-size: 12.0pt">- Winch kit (with <strong style="mso-bidi-font-weight: normal">heavy-duty synthetic</strong> (non-metal) cable)</span></p>
<p><span style="mso-bidi-font-size: 12.0pt">- Recovery Strap Kit including: winch line dampener, snatch block, 6 ft tree trunk protector, 25 ft recovery strap, 2 D ring shackles, 2 pair of leather work gloves, carrying case</span></p>
<p><span style="mso-bidi-font-size: 12.0pt">- Basic vehicle tool kit (include tyre pressure gauge) </span></p>
<p><span style="mso-bidi-font-size: 12.0pt">- <strong style="mso-bidi-font-weight: normal">6 Months </strong>of Spare Parts Kit</span></p>
<p><span style="mso-bidi-font-size: 12.0pt">- <strong style="mso-bidi-font-weight: normal">4 Sets</strong> of keys for each vehicle</span></p>
<p><span style="mso-bidi-font-size: 12.0pt">- Roof Rack (must accommodate fuel containers and one spare tyre) </span></p>
<p><span style="mso-bidi-font-size: 12.0pt">- Two (2) 20 Liter (standard jerry can) DOT approved fuel containers with bracket that allows locking attachment to roof rack</span></p>
<p><span style="mso-bidi-font-size: 12.0pt"><span style="mso-tab-count: 2">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; </span></span></p>
<p><strong style="mso-bidi-font-weight: normal"><span style="text-decoration: underline;"><span style="mso-bidi-font-size: 12.0pt">V.<span style="mso-spacerun: yes">&nbsp; </span>Information Required on Vendors Quotations:</span></span></strong></p>
<p><strong style="mso-bidi-font-weight: normal"><span style="text-decoration: underline;"><span style="mso-bidi-font-size: 12.0pt"><span style="TEXT-DECORATION: none">&nbsp;</span></span></span></strong></p>
<p><span style="mso-bidi-font-size: 12.0pt">All vendors must submit their quotes on company letter head that contains the company's full name, address, telephone numbers, email addresses, and point of contact.<span style="mso-spacerun: yes">&nbsp; </span>The quote must also list the company's GSA contract number, Tax Identification Number (TIN), Data Universal Numbering System (DUN), and Small Business Filing Status if applicable.</span></p>
<p><span style="mso-bidi-font-size: 12.0pt">&nbsp;</span></p>
<p><span style="mso-bidi-font-size: 12.0pt">All charges must be separately listed as a single line item with all line items adding up to an over total cost, for example the cost for the base unit, the cost for upgrades, the cost for shipping base unit to vendor, the cost of the spare parts kit, and the cost for shipping the vehicle to <strong style="mso-bidi-font-weight: normal">Addis Ababa, Ethiopia</strong> must be separate line item charges. </span></p>
<p><span style="mso-bidi-font-size: 12.0pt">The quote must provide an armoring completion schedule in that includes: estimated timeline to acquire the base unit; estimated timeline of vehicle during production; and estimated timeline to ship to designation.</span></p>
<p style="MARGIN-LEFT: 0.5in">&nbsp;</p>
<p>The contractor shall provide OFDA Logistics with a weekly update of the status of this procurement until the order is completed.</p>

<p style="MARGIN: 0in 0in 0pt"><span style="FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New Roman','serif'">The contractor is responsible for any and all storage (if any) in the execution of this task order.</span></p>

<SUBJECT>Built Up Roofing IDIQ
<SOLNBR>FA8201-12-R-0016
<NTYPE>PRESOL
<CONTACT>Ashton R. Jones, Phone 801775-2216, Email ashton.jones@hill.af.mil - Lei Yang, A1C, Phone 801-586-3347, Email lei.yang@hill.af.mil
<DESC><strong>This project set-aside has been ammended from a Hubzone Set-aside to a total small business set-aside effective 2 March 2012. Seed project funding still not approved. Expect solicitation release within 60 days from 2 March 2012. If funding is not approved will move to another option for competition. 60 days is an estimate and is not a firm time frame.<br />----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------<br /><br />This project has been deferred and a solicitation should&nbsp;be prepared and posted to FBO by this office within 60 days of this date (8 Feb 2012) <br /></strong>--------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------<br /><br />Hill AFB anticipates the formation of an Indefinite Delivery Indefinite Quantity (IDIQ) contract with a 5 year continuous ordering period for the repair, installation, and alteration of built up bituminous roofing. To include but not limited to built-up roofing systems (minimum of 20yr manufacturer warranty is mandatory), lightning protection systems (master lightning protection license required), abatement for roofing containing asbestos, metal roofing repairs, flashing, and other roofing repairs on an as needed basis.<br /><br />Davis Bacon Act will apply to this acquisition and current wage rates found on WDOL applicable to each trade will apply.<br /><br />&nbsp;This IDIQ is anticipated to be a&nbsp;total small business&nbsp;set-aside per the SBA and is expected to be solicited at the end of April/beginning of May. Anticipated ceiling amount for the 5yr IDIQ will be between $5-10M. This requirement will have a "seed" project sent out with the requirement specific statement of work (SOW) and will be posted as a request for proposals (RFP). This will require a technical volume to be submitted with the pricing and is expected to be evaluated as lowest price technically acceptable (LPTA) with Past Performance. The RFP will also include the generalized IDIQ SOW for review by all interested contractors. <br /><br />This contract will be to perform built-up roofing repairs, mainly by replacement, at Hill AFB, Little Mountain Complex, and the Utah Test and Training Range (UTTR), UT. Contractor shall be responsible for providing all materials, labor, management, licensing, certifications, supervision, equipment, transportation, and vehicles for each task order placed on this IDIQ. Manufacturer and National Roofing Contractors Association (NRCA) roof detail work shall be adhered to by the contractor. Built up roofing (BUR) manufacturer certification is a qualification to propose for this contract.<br /><br />Submittal #1 shall be executed and included with the proposal to the Air Force. Prior to proposing on the solicitation (or included in the proposal) the contractor shall provide proof that they are certified by the manufacturer. Failure to provide the required certification will result in a non-responsive proposal and will not be considered for award.<br /><br />Small business contractors will need to show the ability of completing multiple projects during "roofing season" to be considered for award. Risk assessment has flagged multiple projects as an area of concern. Capabilities statement will be asked for at the time of solicitation.<br /><br />FAR Clause 52.232-18 entitled "Availability of Funds" applies to the seed project. Site visit will be coordinated for proposing on the seed project. No date or time is currently available for this site visit (expected one week after issuing solicitation). The contractor shall also need to submit bonding capability documents that meet the aggregate and project amounts, backed by a bonding surety with an A.M. Best company rating of "A". Bonding will be required per task order and will not be a blanket bonding policy.<br /><br />All text above is subject to change once the requirement is firm and the seed project is known. This is only a brief overview of the requirement and how it will be competed. Please direct any questions or concerns to SSgt Ashton Jones or A1C Lei Yang.

<SUBJECT>PDMSS
<SOLNBR>FA8201-12-R-PDMSS
<NTYPE>PRESOL
<CONTACT>Hideo Mera, Contract Administrator, Phone 801-777-4626, Email Hideo.Mera@hill.af.mil - Kristin Ware, SrA, Phone 8015862186, Email Kristin.ware@hill.af.mil
<DESC>Update 2 Mar 2012<br /><br />This is the solicitation for the PDMSS requirement at Hill AFB. This is a sole source.<br /><br /><br /><br />____________________________________________________________________________<br />UPDATE 21 NOV 2011<br /><br />The roster sheet is posted. We are now deciding our stratefy<br /><br />UPDATE 18 NOV 2011<br /><br />Updated Industry Day slides have been posted.<br /><br />UPDATE 15 NOV 2011<br /><br />The slides and PWS have been posted <br /><br />UPDATE 14 NOV 201<br /><br />The government will be having an Industry day on 21 Nov 2011 at the Hill AFB Aerospace Museum conference room from 0800-1200. Please fill out the attached registration form. Industry day slides will be posted soon.<br /><br /><br />UPDATE 9 NOV 2011<br /><br />The government is still working on the strategy for this requirement. We would like input from any outside sources to include large businesses for this requirement. The government is considering a sole source to Robins-Gioia.
<p>The government also has set a TENTATIVE date for an industry day on the morning of 21 November 2011. Please email Hideo Mera, hideo.mera@hill.af.mil, if you are interested or expect to attend the Industry Day here at Hill AFB. Slides will be posted prior to the industry day. The primary discussion will be whether there are other capable companies with the ability to fully support this requirement without any transition delays that would affect the overall mission of the customer.</p>
<br />UPDATE 7 N0V 2011<br /><br />Jaguar and Depot Resource and Forecasting Tool (DRAFT) may be proprietary to Robins-Gioia. Interested vendors are requested to respond to this requirement and it's ability or inability to support this contract with other commercial software or ability to acquire software licensing from Robins-Gioia.<br /><br />Depot Resource and Forecasting Tool (DRAFT) was developed for the Air Force, it was developed and is maintained in the Control and Analysis Tool (CAT II). CAT II is an R-G proprietary database and development environment. The primary users of DRAFT are work loaders and master schedulers. The output is used by the Work Support group to communicate personnel requirements to the Squadrons and eventually up to AMXG. DRAFT is critical to outyear forecasting in AMXG for facilities and manpower.<br /><br />Jaguar is an algorithm used as the scheduling engine for G097 (PDMSS). G097 is the USAF standard project management information system that facilitates planning, tracking, scheduling, execution and performance measurement activities for programmed/un-programmed depot maintenance workload at all ALCs.<br /><br />This requirement is critical to 309 MXW mission success and mitigation of all potential risks is necessary. All input is desired at this time to develop the most effective/efficient acquisition strategy.<br /><br />___________________________________________________________________________<br /><br />HIll AFB is contemplating a contract for Programmed Depot Maintenance Scheduling System (PDMSS) web, Maintenance Work Request (MWR), Depot Resource and Forcasting Tool (DRAFT), Cost Production Performance Module (CPPM), Aircraft Enterprose System (AES), and Facility Equipment Maintenance (FEM).<br /><br />&nbsp;The contractor is responsible for maintaining, developing and implementing enhancements, providing program management oversight and technical expertise for OO-ALC&rsquo;s Programmed Depot Maintenance Scheduling System (PDMSS) Web, Maintenance Work Request (MWR) system, Depot Resource and Forecasting Tool (DRAFT), Cost Production Performance Module (CPPM), Aircraft Enterprise System (AES) and Facility Equipment Maintenance (FEM). <br /><br />Contractor will provide direct program management oversight for daily operations; provide technical programming, development, trouble shooting for system development, requirements, and software life-cycle management for OO-ALC. Contractor will have trained and experienced personnel in LEAN, Six Sigma, Critical Chain Program Management (CCPM), Critical Path and Theory of Constraints (TOC). The contractor will provide on-site program management consultant services regarding the use of G097&rsquo;s scheduling engine (Jaguar), PDMSS Web, MWR, DRAFT, CPPM, AES and FEM. <br /><br />Please review the draft PWS, all questions and comments will be welcomed.<br /><br />Contract type: 5 year FFP contract<br /><br />Period of performance: Basic year with four (4) option years, option 5 may be exercised in accordance with FAR clause 52.217-8, option to Extend Services, as necessary<br /><br />Basic: 12 months <br />Option 1: 12 months <br />Option 2: 12 months <br />Option 3: 12 months <br />Option 4: 12 months <br />Option 5: NTE 6 months <br /><br />CLIN: <br />0001-0501 - Technical Requirement <br />0002-0502 - Travel Cost <br />0003-0503 - Data <br /><br />Offerors will be given 30 days to submit a proposal, starting from date of issue of solicitation. Anticipated RFP release date is 15 Nov 2011. <br /><br />Anticipated performance start date 6 February 2012. A 30 day transition period starting 6 January 2012 will be required for all offerors except the incumbent.<br /><br />The incumbent contractor is Robbins Gioia<br />Contract # FA8201-09-F-A001

<SUBJECT>Resource Area Manager - McConnell AFB-
<SOLNBR>FA4621-12-T-0004

<RESPDATE>031912
<CONTACT>Kurt Ertel, Contract Administrator, Phone 3167594537, Email kurt.ertel.2@us.af.mil
<DESC>Resource Area Manager <br />Solicitation FA4621-12-T-0004
<p>Synopsis Description Section:</p>
<p>The 22d Contracting Squadron (22 CONS) of the 22d Air Refueling Wing announces the projected solicitation for a Resource Area Manager (will include SOW with Solicitation) at McConnell AFB, Kansas 67221.</p>
<p>Anticipated workload consists of a full range of services relating to the management of the Airman and Family Readiness Center, see statement of work for full job description upon release of solicitation package. This requirement is anticipated to receive quotes from at least two women owned small businesses, therefore it will be set-aside 100% for an&nbsp;economically disadvantaged&nbsp;woman owned small business. The NAICS code for this requirement is 541513, computer system facilities management services. The Small Business Size Standard is $25,000,000.00.</p>
<p>The Government contemplates issuing a Request for Quote with a 100% small business set-aside. All responsible sources may submit a quote which shall be considered by the agency. Responses to the Request for Quote (RFQ) will be evaluated using Lowest Price Technically Acceptable (LPTA) evaluation factors. The Government shall issue an award to a single small business using a Firm Fixed Price (FFP), contract on or about 25 March 2012 with a period of performance from&nbsp;25 March 2012 to&nbsp;30 Septemebr 2012.&nbsp;We anticipate posting the solicitation 5 days after posting of this notice. This requirement shall be procured pursuant to the regulatory direction of FAR Part 12, Acquisition of Commercial Items.</p>
<p>The closing date and time for submission of offers shall be contained in the solicitation package. The entire solicitation package, including the Standard Form 1449 and continuation pages and the Statement of Work, shall be made available only on the Federal Business Opportunities (FedBizOpps) Web Site at http://www.fedbizopps.gov/. Requests for copies of the solicitation package, or any cumulative parts thereof, by any other means shall not be honored. Potential offerors are responsible for monitoring the FedBizOpps website for the release of the solicitation package, which should be on or about 7&nbsp;March 2012 for downloading their own copy of the solicitation package and for downloading their own copy of each associative amendment, if any.</p>
<p>All firms wishing to submit a quote subsequent to the solicitation described herein MUST be registered in the Central Contractor Registration (CCR) database as well as the Online Representations and Certifications Application (ORCA) database or risk their otherwise-timely quote being considered non-responsive regardless of its completeness, timeliness or other salient considerations. Information on CCR and ORCA registrations can be obtained at their respective web sites: http://www.ccr.gov and http://orca.bpn.gov.</p>
<p>Response to this announcement is not required. The government will not pay for any information submitted in response to this announcement. The solicitation subsequent to this announcement may be cancelled. After solicitation and prior to award the possibility exists to reject all offers when cancellation is clearly in the public interest. This announcement does not obligate the Government to pay for any bid/quote preparation costs.</p>
<p>Per AFFARS 5352.201-9101 (10 AUG 2005) the following applies:</p>
<p>(a) An ombudsman has been appointed to hear and facilitate the resolution of concerns from offerors, potential offerors, and others for this acquisition. When requested, the ombudsman will maintain strict confidentiality as to the source of the concern. The existence of the ombudsman does not affect the authority of the program manager, contracting officer, or source selection official. Further, the ombudsman does not participate in the evaluation of quotes, the source selection process, or the adjudication of protests or formal contract disputes. The ombudsman may refer the party to another official who can resolve the concern.</p>
<p>(b) Before consulting with an ombudsman, interested parties must first address their concerns, issues, disagreements, and/or recommendations to the contracting officer for resolution. Consulting an ombudsman does not alter or postpone the timelines for any other processes (e.g., agency level bid protests, GAO bid protests, requests for debriefings, employee-employer actions, contests of OMBC A-76 competition performance decisions).</p>
<p>(c) If resolution cannot be made by the contracting officer, concerned parties may contact the Center/MAJCOM ombudsmen, Mr. Gregory Oneal, HQ AMC/A7K, 507 Symington Drive, Scott AFB IL 62225-5022, (618) 229-0267, fax (618) 256-6668, email: gregory.oneal@us.af.mil. Concerns, issues, disagreements, and recommendations that cannot be resolved at the MAJCOM/DRU level, may be brought by the concerned party for further consideration to the Air Force ombudsman, Associate Deputy Assistant Secretary (ADAS) (Contracting), SAF/AQC, 1060 Air Force Pentagon, Washington DC 20330-1060, phone number (703) 588-7004, facsimile number (703) 588-1067.</p>
<p>(d) The ombudsman has no authority to render a decision that binds the agency.</p>
<p>(e) Do not contact the ombudsman to request copies of the solicitation, verify offer due date, or clarify technical requirements. Such inquiries shall be directed to the Contracting Officer, 2Lt. Jason Hatcher email: jason.hatcher.1@us.af.mil.</p>

<DESC>MODIFICATION: This Sources Sought announcement is for information and planning purposes only; it is not to be construed as a commitment by the Government. A contract may not be awarded as a result of this sources sought announcement. The 408th Contract Support Brigade, Army Contracting Center-Qatar (ACC-QA) at Camp As Sayliyah intends to procure Administrative Management Services as Coordinator of Foreign National (FN) Screeners under FULL AND OPEN competitive procedures. SET ASIDE-N/A. <br><br>Coordinator must possess administrative skills to support organizational unit whose mission is to obtain and analyze background information on Foreign National (FN) prospective employees and current contractor employees working at Camp As Sayliyah. Coordinator must serve as a back-up screener/analyst to the Senior FN Screener. Coordinator must use, maintain and improve the existing Microsoft Access database program, and/or develop a new SharePoint database system.<br><br>Interested firms in NAICS code 541611 are encouraged to submit their capability packages. The capability packages for this sources sought market survey are NOT expected to be proposals, but rather statements regarding the company's existing experience. Capability packages must not exceed ten (10) pages and must be submitted electronically. All offeror questions must be submitted by 1200 Local Qatar Time on 8 MAR 12. <br><br>Interested entities are to outline their experiences in Administrative skills and Information Technology skills. Areas or tasks where an offeror does not have prior experience should be annotated as such.<br><br>Administrative skills include filing, scanning, responding to telephonic and in-person inquiries, printing reports from database, retrieving data from database system, tracking progress of case files, coordinating base access actions, serving as office manager<br><br>Information technology (IT) skills include building queries, pulling selected queries, fixing/troubleshooting database system. <br><br>In addition, the following must be answered and elaborated on as part of the package: <br>(1) Environment-Firm has the ability to secure its own off-base housing, vehicle and cell phone in Doha, Qatar.<br>(2) Expertise-Firm has hands-on experience in SharePoint and data basing.<br>(3) Financial Capability-Firm has the financial capability to withstand a monthly negative cash flow. (*see note below);<br>(4) Past Performance-Firm has the relevant past performance within the last three years. (Include contract numbers, contract type, dollar value of each procurement, point of contracts, and brief description of the work performed); <br>(5) Corporate Experience-Firm has work experience similar in nature to scope.<br><br>To assist us in maintaining a list of interested firms for this potential procurement, please provide your company's name, point of contact (POC), address, phone number, and email address under the above NAICS code to LTC Senodja F. <DESC><p><br />U.S. Customs and Border Protection (CBP) intends to solicit offers in response to Request for Proposal (RFP) HSBP1012R0017 for the Preventative Maintenance Program (PMP) for the Northeast Region. The region will consist of 23 fully-owned and direct lease operated facility locations/campuses, comprised of 35 buildings or facilities, throughout Michigan, New York, Vermont, and Maine.<br /><br />This requirement will be procured as a total small business set aside.<br /><br />The requirement will include validation of all equipment at all locations in the region during the initial phase in period. The requirement will include the preventative maintenance (PM) of equipment at all facilities throughout the region. The requirement will also include an indefinite delivery / indefinite quantity (ID/IQ) portion from which major repair task orders for work beyond the scope of PM services for equipment can be issued.<br /><br />All work shall be performed in accordance with the performance work statement and request for proposal that will be provided at time of solicitation issuance. The awarded contract will consist of a 12 month base period (2 months for the initial phase-in period and 10 months for PM services) with four 12 month option periods. Total contract period, to include options, shall not exceed 60 months.<br /><br />The applicable North American Industry Classification System (NAICS) code is 561210. The Small Business size standard is $35.5 million.<br /><br />There will be one scheduled site visit for this requirement. Please see the attached RFP, and below, for further details regarding the site visit. Due to the number of locations covered under this contract it is not feasible to conduct a site visit at all locations. One location has been chosen for the site visit as detailed below.</p>
<p>Potential offerors planning to attend the site visit are required to submit company name, individual's name, phone number, and email address in advance for access to the facility. One form of government issued picture identification shall be required to be shown upon arrival. Please submit the aforementioned information to Matt Korn via matthew.korn@dhs.gov no later than <strong>1:00 PM EDT, March 8, 2012.</strong> An email will be sent to each attendee with the specific time for the site visit.</p>
<p>The date, location, and time for the site visit can be found below:</p>
<p>Tuesday, March 13, 2012<br />9:00 AM EDT</p>
<p>Selfridge Air National Guard Base (ANGB) &amp; Border Patrol Station Headquarters (BPSHQ)<br />41130 Castle Ave. <br />Harrison Township, MI 48045<br /><br />Please address any questions to Matthew Korn, Contract Specialist, via email at matthew.korn@dhs.gov no-later-than (NLT) <strong>March 16, 2012.</strong> Telephone inquires will not be accepted.</p>

To view the specifications, please go to www.FedBid.com and reference Buy No. 328348_01.
<BR><BR>GSA Schedule Bids Only:  Sellers bidding on this opportunity MUST have the items requested on an existing GSA Schedule. The Schedule must either be in the Seller's name or the Seller must be able to document its ability to act as an agent of a partner's Schedule. Sellers must not bid more than their applicable contract ceiling price, excluding the FedBid Fee, for contract-specific items. If FedBid receives notice that, due to inclusion of the FedBid Fee, the Selected Bid's line item pricing is higher than the Selected Seller's applicable published government contract pricing, the FedBid Fee will be reduced to ensure the Selected Bid's line item pricing does not exceed the Selected Seller's applicable contract pricing. Sellers may offer Open Market items only in accordance with the approved Terms and Conditions of their respective GSA Schedule AND upon approval from the soliciting Contracting Officer. Information regarding GSA Schedules can be found at www.GSA.gov.<BR><BR>This requirement is a [ Small Business ] set-aside and only qualified sellers may submit bids.The solicitation pricing on www.FedBid.com will start on the date this solicitation is posted and will end on 2012-03-02 13:00:00.0 Eastern Time or as otherwise displayed at www.FedBid.com.FOB Destination shall be Cheverly, MD 20781<BR><BR>The Federal Bureau of Investigation requires the following items, Brand Name or Equal, to the following:  <BR>LI 001, LTSP TERM 1720 - PXE BOOT DISKLESS THIN CLIENT WORKSTATION 2GB 1.6MHZ DDR II UPGRADE
OEM P/N:  E830 "CLIENTRON THIN CLIENT", 150, EA;<BR><BR><a href="https://marketplace.fedbid.com/fbweb/fbobuyDetails.do?token=%3D%3DwBKxmaVGYR9Ko5W3GhVcZwQAAAAAHeAAgAgTFCGg%2FFzzqQbJAAyVXBA0Or">Solicitation and Buy Attachments</a><BR><BR>***Question Submission: Interested offerors must submit any questions concerning the solicitation at the earliest time possible to enable the Buyer to respond. Questions must be submitted by using the 'Submit a Question' feature at www.fedbid.com. Questions not received within a reasonable time prior to close of the solicitation may not be considered.***<BR><BR>For this solicitation, Federal Bureau of Investigation intends to conduct an online competitive reverse auction to be facilitated by the third-party reverse auction provider, FedBid, Inc. FedBid has developed an online, anonymous, browser based application to conduct the reverse auction. A Seller may submit a series of pricing bids, which descend in price during the specified period of time for the aforementioned reverse auction. Federal Bureau of Investigation is taking this action in an effort to improve both seller access and awareness of requests and the agency's ability to gather multiple, completed, real-time bids.All responsible Sellers that respond to this solicitation MUST submit the pricing portion of their bid using the online exchange located at www.FedBid.com. There is no cost to register, review procurement data or make a bid on www.FedBid.com.Sellers that are not currently registered to use www.FedBid.com should proceed to www.FedBid.com to complete their free registration. Sellers that require special considerations or assistance may contact the FedBid Helpdesk at 877-9FEDBID (877-933-3243) or via email at clientservices@fedbid.com. Sellers may not artificially manipulate the price of a transaction on www.FedBid.com by any means. It is unacceptable to place bad faith bids, to use decoys in the www.FedBid.com process or to collude with the intent or effect of hampering the competitive www.FedBid.com process.Should Sellers require additional clarification, contact FedBid at 877-9FEDBID (877-933-3243) or clientservices@fedbid.com.<BR><BR>Use of FedBid:   Buyers and Sellers agree to conduct this transaction through FedBid in compliance with the FedBid Terms of Use. Failure to comply with the below terms and conditions may result in offer being determined as non-responsive.<BR><BR>New Equipment ONLY; NO remanufactured or "gray market" items. All items must be covered by the manufacturer's warranty.<BR><BR>Bid MUST be good for 60 calendar days after close of Buy.<BR><BR>Shipping must be free on board (FOB) destination CONUS (Continental U.S.), which means that the seller must deliver the goods on its conveyance at the destination specified by the buyer, and the seller is responsible for the cost of shipping and risk of loss prior to actual delivery at the specified destination.<BR><BR>Offeror must be registered in the Central Contractor Registration (CCR) database before an award can be made to them. <MOD>
<DATE>0302
<YEAR>12
<AGENCY>Department of Transportation
<OFFICE>Maritime Administration (MARAD)
<LOCATION>MAR-380
<ZIP>20590
<CLASSCOD>J
<NAICS>336611
<OFFADD>1200 New Jersey Ave., SE, W28-201 Washington DC 20590
<SUBJECT>Dry Docking and Hull Cleaning 
<SOLNBR>DTMA94Q20120010
<NTYPE>PRESOL
<RESPDATE>053112
<CONTACT>kathryn rato, Phone 4157442580, Email kathryn.rato@dot.gov - Debra Velmere, contracting officer, Phone 4157444140, Fax 4157442576, Email Debbie.velmere@dot.gov
<DESC><p style="MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0pt; LINE-HEIGHT: 16.8pt"><span style="FONT-SIZE: 8.5pt; FONT-FAMILY: 'Arial','sans-serif'; mso-fareast-font-family: 'Times New Roman'"><span style="mso-spacerun: yes">&nbsp;Due date for all ships, except the NEREUS, is extended&nbsp;May &nbsp;31, 2012</span></span></p>
<p><span style="FONT-SIZE: 12pt; FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New Roman','serif'">The U.S. Department of Transportation, Maritime Administration has a requirement to dry-dock vessels that depart the&nbsp; Suisun Bay Reserve Fleet, Benicia, CA that are destined for recycling outside the San Francisco Bay area. With this request, the Maritime Administration is soliciting price quotations for dry-docking services for up to nine<span style="COLOR: #c00000"> </span>obsolete vessels in up to two solicitation phases.&nbsp; Each phase is planned to proceed on the dates specified below: </span></p>
<p><span style="FONT-SIZE: 12pt; FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New Roman','serif'">&nbsp;</span></p>
<p style="MARGIN-LEFT: 0in; TEXT-INDENT: 0in; mso-list: l0 level1 lfo1"><span style="FONT-SIZE: 12pt; FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New Roman','serif'; mso-fareast-font-family: 'Times New Roman'"><span>&bull;(1)<span style="FONT: 7pt 'Times New Roman'">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; </span></span></span><span style="FONT-SIZE: 12pt; FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New Roman','serif'">The Government will identify the vessels included in each phase solicitation. The vessels will be selected from the list of obsolete vessels listed below. </span></p>
<p style="MARGIN-LEFT: 0in; TEXT-INDENT: 0in; mso-list: l0 level1 lfo1"><span style="FONT-SIZE: 12pt; FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New Roman','serif'; mso-fareast-font-family: 'Times New Roman'"><span>&bull;(2)<span style="FONT: 7pt 'Times New Roman'">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; </span></span></span><span style="FONT-SIZE: 12pt; FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New Roman','serif'">The Government anticipates identifying no more than three vessels per Phase, but reserves the right to increase or decrease that number slightly if circumstances warrant.&nbsp; Not all vessels may be selected for dry-docking during the two phases. </span></p>
<p style="MARGIN-LEFT: 0.25in; TEXT-INDENT: -0.25in; mso-list: l0 level1 lfo1"><span style="FONT-SIZE: 12pt; FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New Roman','serif'; mso-fareast-font-family: 'Times New Roman'"><span>&bull;(3)<span style="FONT: 7pt 'Times New Roman'">&nbsp;&nbsp; </span></span></span><span style="FONT-SIZE: 12pt; FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New Roman','serif'">Specific vessel technical data will be included in each phase solicitation.</span></p>
<p style="MARGIN-LEFT: 0.25in; TEXT-INDENT: -0.25in; mso-list: l0 level1 lfo1"><span style="FONT-SIZE: 12pt; FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New Roman','serif'; mso-fareast-font-family: 'Times New Roman'"><span>&bull;(4)<span style="FONT: 7pt 'Times New Roman'">&nbsp;&nbsp; </span></span></span><span style="FONT-SIZE: 12pt; FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New Roman','serif'">Vessel Visitation schedules will be included in each phase solicitation.</span></p>
<p style="MARGIN-LEFT: 0.25in; TEXT-INDENT: -0.25in; mso-list: l0 level1 lfo1"><span style="FONT-SIZE: 12pt; FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New Roman','serif'; mso-fareast-font-family: 'Times New Roman'"><span>&bull;(5)<span style="FONT: 7pt 'Times New Roman'">&nbsp;&nbsp; </span></span></span><span style="FONT-SIZE: 12pt; FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New Roman','serif'">The Period of Performance will be included in each phase solicitation. </span></p>
<p style="MARGIN-LEFT: 0.25in; TEXT-INDENT: -0.25in; mso-list: l0 level1 lfo1"><span style="FONT-SIZE: 12pt; FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New Roman','serif'; mso-fareast-font-family: 'Times New Roman'"><span>&bull;(6)<span style="FONT: 7pt 'Times New Roman'">&nbsp;&nbsp; </span></span></span><span style="FONT-SIZE: 12pt; FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New Roman','serif'">Vessel specific performance schedules will be requested in each phase solicitation.</span></p>
<p><span style="FONT-SIZE: 12pt; FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New Roman','serif'">&nbsp;</span></p>
<p><span style="FONT-SIZE: 12pt; FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New Roman','serif'">Award decisions will be made for each Phase using the award criteria set forth in the applicable Solicitation No. DTMA94Q20120010. </span></p>
<p><span style="FONT-SIZE: 12pt; FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New Roman','serif'">&nbsp;</span></p>
<p><span style="FONT-SIZE: 12pt; FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New Roman','serif'">Schedule for Submissions.</span></p>
<p><span style="FONT-SIZE: 12pt; FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New Roman','serif'">&nbsp;</span></p>
<p><span style="FONT-SIZE: 12pt; FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New Roman','serif'">Phase I&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; </span></p>
<p><span style="FONT-SIZE: 12pt; FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New Roman','serif'">Request for Prices&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; 1/20/2012</span></p>
<p><span style="FONT-SIZE: 12pt; FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New Roman','serif'">Prices Due&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; 2/3/2012</span></p>
<p><span style="FONT-SIZE: 12pt; FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New Roman','serif'">&nbsp;</span></p>
<p><span style="FONT-SIZE: 12pt; FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New Roman','serif'">Phase II</span></p>
<p><span style="FONT-SIZE: 12pt; FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New Roman','serif'">Request for Prices&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; 3/28/2012</span></p>
<p><span style="FONT-SIZE: 12pt; FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New Roman','serif'">Prices Due&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; 4/20/2012</span></p>
<p><span style="COLOR: #1f497d">&nbsp;</span></p>
<p><span style="FONT-SIZE: 12pt; FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New Roman','serif'">Schedule of Vessel for Phase I and II</span></p>
<p><span style="FONT-SIZE: 12pt; FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New Roman','serif'">&nbsp;</span></p>
<p><span style="FONT-SIZE: 12pt; FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New Roman','serif'">CIMARRON, NEREUS, NORHTERN LIGHT, SHOSHONE, MOUNT HOOD, MOUNT WASHINGTON, WILLAMETTE, WYMAN,WITCHITA</span></p>
<p><span style="FONT-SIZE: 12pt; COLOR: #1f497d; FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New Roman','serif'">&nbsp;</span></p>
<p style="MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0pt; LINE-HEIGHT: 16.8pt">&nbsp;&nbsp;<span style="FONT-SIZE: 8.5pt; FONT-FAMILY: 'Arial','sans-serif'; mso-fareast-font-family: 'Times New Roman'">The vessel is restricted to those facilities in the San Francisco Bay area with suitable dry-dock facilities that have the industrial capability and capacity to<span style="mso-spacerun: yes">&nbsp; </span>effectively accomplish underwater hull cleaning,. The restrictiveness of the San Francisco Bay is due to:<span style="mso-spacerun: yes">&nbsp; </span>the<span style="mso-spacerun: yes">&nbsp; </span>need for<span style="mso-spacerun: yes">&nbsp; </span>cleaning the vessels' under water hulls<span style="mso-spacerun: yes">&nbsp; </span>and of its exfoliating paint before leaving the SF Bay Area<span style="mso-spacerun: yes">&nbsp; </span>iaw CG Ballast Water Management Act.<span style="mso-spacerun: yes">&nbsp;&nbsp; </span>All work and disposal of hazardous materials shall be in compliance with the latest Federal State and local regulatory body requirements. The offeror shall provide all labor and material including tug service to remove the vessel from the fleet and deliver it to the offerors facility. The offeror shall schedule the delivery of the vessel so that the vessel shall be placed into the dry-dock immediately upon arrival at the offerors facility and shall not be berthed at a pier awaiting the availability of the dry-dock.</span></p>
<p style="MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0pt; LINE-HEIGHT: 16.8pt"><span style="FONT-SIZE: 8.5pt; FONT-FAMILY: 'Arial','sans-serif'; mso-fareast-font-family: 'Times New Roman'">&nbsp;</span><span style="FONT-SIZE: 8.5pt; FONT-FAMILY: 'Arial','sans-serif'; mso-fareast-font-family: 'Times New Roman'">The competitive solicitation along with technical data will be available by electronic posting and may be found at https://www.fbo.gov/ approximately on Dec 30, 2011. Solicitation No. DTMA94Q20120010, This is full and open acquisition unrestricted &nbsp;under the NAICS Code 336611. All responsible sources may submit a quotation which shall be considered by the MARAD.</span></p>
<p style="MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0pt; LINE-HEIGHT: 16.8pt">&nbsp;</p>
<p style="MARGIN-BOTTOM: 15pt; LINE-HEIGHT: 16.8pt"><span style="FONT-SIZE: 8.5pt; FONT-FAMILY: 'Arial','sans-serif'; mso-fareast-font-family: 'Times New Roman'">Firm fixed price contracts are contemplated from one RFQ. <span style="mso-spacerun: yes">&nbsp;</span></span><span style="FONT-SIZE: 8pt; FONT-FAMILY: 'Arial','sans-serif'; mso-fareast-font-family: 'Times New Roman'"><span style="mso-spacerun: yes">&nbsp;&nbsp;</span>Offerors shall p</span><span style="FONT-SIZE: 8.5pt; FONT-FAMILY: 'Arial','sans-serif'; mso-fareast-font-family: 'Times New Roman'">ropose docking schedule. </span><span style="FONT-SIZE: 9pt; FONT-FAMILY: 'Arial','sans-serif'; mso-fareast-font-family: 'Times New Roman'">OFFERS SHALL BE GOOD FOR 90 DAYS.</span><span style="FONT-SIZE: 8.5pt; FONT-FAMILY: 'Arial','sans-serif'; mso-fareast-font-family: 'Times New Roman'"><span style="mso-spacerun: yes">&nbsp; </span>Ship tour scheduled shall be announced.<span style="mso-spacerun: yes">&nbsp;&nbsp;</span></span><span style="FONT-SIZE: 8.5pt; FONT-FAMILY: 'Arial','sans-serif'; mso-fareast-font-family: 'Times New Roman'">&nbsp;</span><span style="FONT-SIZE: 8.5pt; FONT-FAMILY: 'Arial','sans-serif'; mso-fareast-font-family: 'Times New Roman'">Contractors are required to register or update their registration at the Central Contractor Registration website at www.ccr.gov in order to receive a contract award under this solicitation.<span style="mso-spacerun: yes">&nbsp; </span></span></p>
<p style="MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0pt; LINE-HEIGHT: 16.8pt"><span style="FONT-SIZE: 8.5pt; FONT-FAMILY: 'Arial','sans-serif'; mso-fareast-font-family: 'Times New Roman'">&nbsp;</span></p>

The Department of Transportation (DOT), Short-Term Lending Program (STLP) offers working capital financing in the form of lines of credit to finance accounts receivable for transportation related contracts. Maximum line of credit is $500,000 with interest at the prime rate. For further information, call (800) 532-1169. Internet address: http://osdbuweb.dot.gov. <SUBJECT>S--Martinsburg Waste Disposal  (Original Presolicitation Notice has Changed & is Replaced)  
<SOLNBR>VA24512R0128
<NTYPE>PRESOL
<RESPDATE>031912
<ARCHDATE>04032012

<DESC>Solicitation Number:
VA245-12-RQ-0128

Notice Type:
Presolicitation

Synopsis:

PRESOLICITATION NOTICE - COLLECTION & DISPOSAL OF SOLID WASTE
SDVOSB SET ASIDE ONLY

Furnish all labor, tools, materials, equipment, and personnel necessary for the collection and disposal of solid waste for the Department of Veterans Affairs Medical Center (VAMC), 510 Butler Ave, Martinsburg, WV 25405, in accordance with all terms and conditions of the proposed contract.  

General Description of the work

The Contractor shall be responsible for the collection and disposal of waste items to an authorized landfill waste site in accordance with the Department of Transportation, EPA and all local, state, and federal laws regulating the waste industry. Contractor shall assume full responsibility for compliance with all Federal, State, County and City laws, rules and regulations governing collection and disposal of waste materials. Disposal shall be performed in such a manner as not to create conditions detrimental to public health or to constitute a public nuisance. Contractor is responsible for obtaining all necessary permits, licenses, manifests and necessary documentation in order to comply with all federal state, and local laws, regulations and ordinances applicable to the transportation and handling of solid waste as performed under this contract.

WORK HOURS:  Normal hours of operation of the hospital are 8:00 am to 4:30 p.m., Monday through Friday, excluding weekends and official federal holidays which are as follows:  New Year's Day Martin Luther King Jr Birthday, Washington's Birthday, Memorial Day, Independence Day, Labor Day,  Columbus Day, Veterans Day, Thanksgiving Day, and Christmas Day

INSPECTION:  The right is reserved to thoroughly inspect and investigate the establishment, vehicles and supplies and other qualifications of any offeror and to reject any offer, irrespective of price, which shall be administratively determined lacking in any of the essentials necessary to assure acceptable standards of performance. If any equipment is added or replaced after inspection, subsequent to award of contract, it shall be inspected and approved by the COTR before being placed in use under this contract.

DRIVERS:  The right is reserved to inspect the drivers' licenses and driving records and other qualifications of employees as to capabilities of performing the duties necessary to assure acceptable standards of performance subsequent to award of contract.  

EVIDENCE OF INSURANCE COVERAGE:  Before award of a contract, the contractor shall furnish to the Contracting Officer, a Certificate of Insurance which shall contain an endorsement to the effect that cancellation of, or any material change in the policies which adversely affect the interests of the Government in such insurance shall not be effective unless a 30 day written notice of cancellation or change is furnished to the Contracting Officer.

LICENSES AND PERMITS:  Contractor shall provide licenses and permits without cost to the Government for vehicles, operators and labor to remove bulk/container.
TYPES OF WASTE COVERED:  The following listing specifies the most common types of waste disposed of under the terms of this contract; the Government reserves the right to identify other types of waste to be disposed of under the terms of the contract.
"	General
"	Wet Garbage
"	Construction debris, including stone, brick, plaster, wood, metal, etc.
"	Scrap metal, plastic, wood, etc.
"	Scrap furnishings and equipment
"	Mattresses and bedding
"	Grounds care debris, including grass clippings, branches, leaves, etc.
"	Glass and glassware
"	Dry sludge

RECYCLABLE MATERIALS:
"	Plastics

TYPES OF WASTE NOT COVERED:  The following listing specifies the most common types of waste not covered by the terms of this contract.
"	Regulated medical waste
"	Radioactive waste
"	Hazardous waste, including hazardous chemical waste
"	Sewage and other materials which may be legally discharged to a sewer 


The contract is for a period of 12 Months plus Four Option Years. The NAICS code is 562111 and the size standard is $12.5 million.  All documents will be available on or about March 7, 2012. The due date for receipt of the quotes is tentatively scheduled for March 19, 2012. Inquiries may be sent via e-mail to Crystal.Showell@va.gov. The fax # is (304) 264-3997. Any questions may be directed to Ms. Showell at (304) 263-0811 Ext 3052. 

Only SDVOSB/VOSB Firms currently verified in the Veterans Information Pages (VIP) at www.vetbiz.gov or SDVOSB/VOSB Firms currently listed, pending verification in VIP are eligible to submit bids/offers.

SDVOSB Firms that submit bids/offers on SDVOSB/VOSB set-asides that are not listed on VIP will be deemed nonresponsive (IFB) or technically unacceptable (RFP/RFQ).

Contracting Office Address:

510 Butler Ave Bldg 308B, Martinsburg, WV 25405

Crystal Showell
Contracting Officer

<DESC>This is a SOURCE SOUGHT for commercial items prepared IAW the format in FAR Subpart 12.6, as supplemented with additional information included in this notice. This announcement constitutes the only solicitation; quotes are being requested and a written solicitation will not be issued. <br><br>This solicitation W912SV-12-T-0015 is being issued as a Request for Information (RFI) to determine the availability and locations of possible vendors. The solicitation document and incorporated provisions and clauses are those in effect through Federal Acquisition Circular 2005-46. This solicitation is set aside for small business. The NAICS code that applies is 721110. Small Business Size Standard is $15 Million. This action will result in a FFP purchase order utilizing simplified commercial acquisition procedures under Full and Open competition. <br><br>This requirement is for Strong Bonds Event (which requires lodging, meals and meeting rooms). Qualified establishments shall be located within a 60 mile radius of the North Shore area of Massachusetts Establishments who do not provide proposal based on receipt and review of statement of work will be deemed non-responsive. Statement of Work is as follows: <br><br>STATEMENT OF WORK (SOW)<br><br>I. BACKGROUND<br><br>1. The contractor shall, except as specified in this Statement of Work (SOW) as government furnished property or services, provide all personnel, supervision, and any items and services necessary to provide, lodging for 27 - 29  July  2012 and catered meals and meeting rooms to the Massachusetts Army National Guard, for the Strong Bonds Event scheduled for 27-29 July 2012, as defined in this SOW. <br><br>II. SCOPE OF WORK<br><br>1. Contractor shall provide the following services: <br><br>III. Lodging for Strong Bonds authorized individuals designated by the Massachusetts Army National Guard Strong Bonds Program POC CH (CPT) Jeremy Pickens for 27-29 July 2012. Required number of rooms is 45. Room sizes required should be able to sleep up to 4 guest of the same family with limited number of connecting rooms. <br><br>IV. Rooms for the Strong Bonds Program Training. Rooms shall include tables (conference style) and chairs (cushioned) to accommodate number of persons estimated for each type of room required; required room sizes are as follows: <br><br>a. One (1) Ballroom style room, able to accommodate 150 people<br>b. One (1) room able to accommodate approximately 50 people<br>c. Two (2) rooms able to accommodate the following age groups: 0-4 (approx. 20 ), 5-7 (approx. 20). These rooms will be utilized for activities related to each group; specific numbers yet to be determined.<br><br>V. Meeting room facilities to include: <br><br>a. One 10 X 10 skirted screens for ballroom to include required electrical items<br><br>VI. Event will also require 2 six-foot long rectangular tables, with skirting (for registration and exhibit purposes); locations will be determined.<br><br>VII. Meals provided for in ballroom for 150 people (including estimated total of 75 persons under 18)<br><br>a. Breakfast food 2 days: Hot breakfast Buffet. Serving timeframe shall be from 7:45 a.m. to 09:00 a.m.<br><br>b. Lunch 2 days: Hot Buffet with 2 choices for an entree, vegetables, starches, salad, and assorted desserts. Specific menu, based on proposed choices, will be determined by event POC (CH (CPT) Jeremy Pickens.) Serving time is to be determined.<br>c. Dinner 2 nights: Hot Buffet with 2 choices for an entree, vegetables, starches, salad, and assorted desserts. Specific menu, based on proposed choices, will be determined by event POC (CH (CPT) Jeremy Pickens.) Serving time is to be determined.<br>d. Contractor will furnish all food items, cooked, and delivered to the areas identified by catering manager at designated times in accordance with this SOW.<br><br>e. Contractor shall provide full service catering to include setting up, plates, napkins, silverware, glasses/cups, clean up equipment to keep food hot/cold and removal of all trash.<br><br>f. Contractor shall have all food items delivered and available on site no later than 7:30 a.m. for breakfast, no later than 11:30 p.m. for lunch and no later 5:30 p.m. for Dinner.<br><br>g. Contractor shall provide water to be available all day and replenished (up to 8 hours) as necessary.<br><br>h. Contractor shall provide all condiments (sugar, cream, sweetener, etc).<br><br>Note: Children will eat meals with their families.<br><br>(END OF STATEMENT OF WORK)<br>________________________________________________________________________<br><br>The Government intends to award all requested services to a single vendor; however, establishments who are unable to provide for total lodging requirements are welcome to partner with another co-located establishment, in order to meet total rooms required requirement will still need to be awarded to a single vendor. The lodging requirement date is 27 & 28 July 2012; event dates are 28 & 29 July 2012. Quotations shall be submitted on attached Request for Quotation Form).<br><br>Contractors facilities must meet minimum standards for federal (FEMA-approved as found on website http://www.usfa.dhs.gov/applications/hotel/ ), state (Massachusetts) and local governments as well as industry standards for health, safety, and welfare occupants. Government officials will personally visit establishments being considered for contract. The following shall be used to evaluate offers: price or cost to the government, quality of facilities and services, and ability to meet the government requirements as stated in Statement of Work. The Government will make an award to the responsible offeror whose offer conforming to the solicitation is considered the best value. All other evaluation factors when combined, are approximately equal to price. <br> <br>APPLICABLE PROVISIONS AND CLAUSES:  The following clauses and provisions are incorporated by reference.  FAR clauses and provisions can be read in their full text at http://farsite.hill.af.mil/vffara.htm  and DFARS clauses and provisions can be read in their full text at http://farsite.hill.af.mil/VFDFARA.HTM .  The clauses are to remain in full force in any resultant contract. <br>FAR clauses<br>52.204-7		Central Contractor Registration<br>52.212-4		Contract terms and conditions-commercial items<br>52.212-5 DEV	Contract terms and conditions required to implement statutes or Executive Orders<br>52.219-28	Post-Award Small Business Program Representation<br>52.222-3		Convict Labor<br>52.222-21	Prohibition of Segregated Facilities<br>52.222-26	Equal Opportunity<br>52.222-36	Affirmative Action for Workers with Disabilities (applicable over $15,000)<br>52.222-41	Service Contract Act of 1965 (services only)<br>52.222-42	Statement of Equivalent Rates for Federal Hires (services only)<br>52.222-50	Combating Trafficking in Persons<br>52.223-18	Contractor Policy to Ban Text Messaging While Driving<br>52.225-13	Restrictions on Certain Foreign Purchases<br>52.232-33	Payment by Electronic Funds Transfer- Central Contractor Registration<br>52.233-3		Protest After Award<br>52.233-4		Applicable Law for Breach of Contract<br>52.252-2		Clauses Incorporated by Reference<br>52.252-6		Authorized Deviations in Clauses<br><br>DFAR clauses<br>252.203-7000	Requirements relating to Compensation of Former DoD officials<br>252.203-7002	Requirement to Inform Employees of Whistleblower Rights<br>252.204-7004	Alt.A Central Contractors Registration <br>252.211-7003	Item Identification and valuation<br>252.212-7001	Contract terms and conditions required to Implement Statutes or Executive Orders 				applicable to Defense Acquisition of Commercial items<br>252.232-7003	Electronic Submission of Payment Request and Receiving Reports<br>252.232-7010	Levies on Contract payments<br>252.237-7010	Prohibition on Interrogation of Detainees by Contractor Personnel<br>252.247-7023 	Alt.III  Transportation of Supplies by Sea<br><br>For information regarding this solicitation please contact  margaret.l.sullivan@us.army.mil or 508-233-6670.<br>

<SUBJECT>Z--Multiple Award Task Order contract (MATOC) for Construction Requirements
<SOLNBR>W912J312R0001
<NTYPE>PRESOL

<SOLNBR>NIHJT2012005
<NTYPE>SNOTE
<RESPDATE>032712
<CONTACT>Hing Pan Wong, Contracting Officer, Email CIO.CSS@nih.gov
<DESC>As a part of its market research/industry outreach, the National Institutes of Health Information Technology Acquisition and Assessment Center (NITAAC http://nitaac.nih.gov/nitaac/) is conducting ongoing market research for a new contracting vehicle, temporarily titled "Chief Information Officer - NEW (CIO-NEW)". NITAAC plans for the CIO-NEW contract to complement its soon to be awarded "Chief Information Officer Solutions and Partners 3 (CIO-SP3)" contract.  As of 29 February, NITAAC has finished the first phase of information collection, but NITAAC will continue to consider additional industry perspectives and comments on the CIO-NEW.  Your input will be used in defining the program.
<p>Vendors are encouraged but are not required to comment based on the question in the attached document titled FBO_Special_Notice_-_Vendor_Collaboration_2-6-2012.docx. Responses to the questions received so far are posted in the attached document titled FBO_Initial_Questions.docx.  Please submit any/all additional responses, questions or comments to CIO.CSS@nih.gov.  This notice will remain active until 27 March 2012.</p>

<SUBJECT>Structure Demolition and Restoration Project located in Mingo County, West Virginia
<SOLNBR>AG-3D47-S-12-0002
<NTYPE>PRESOL
<RESPDATE>032712
<CONTACT>Amy D Stonebraker, Contracting Officer, Phone 304-284-7557, Email amy.stonebraker@wv.usda.gov
<DESC>The project consists of the demolition of structures on one (1) property located in Mingo County in Southern West Virginia. The structures are to be removed in their entirety and the disturbed areas are to be regarded and seeded to provide positive drainage and vegetative cover.
<p><br />Major items of work for this project are as follows: Silt Fence, 50 linear feet; Seeding and Mulching, 0.2 acres; Mobilization and Demobilization, 1 Lump Sum; Rock Riprap, 643 tons; General Demolition Removal, 30 ton; Construction Debris Removal, 1 Lump Sum; Septic Tank Decommissioning, 1 Lump Sum; Water Well Decommissioning, 1 Lump Sum.</p>
<p>The estimated price range for this project is between $25,000 and $100,000. A bid guarantee is required for this project and shall be 20 percent of the bid price.&nbsp;&nbsp;The required performance time is 35 calendar days. The Invitation for Bid (IFB) will be issued on, or about February 27, 2012.</p>
<p style="text-align: left;"><strong><br />***Amendment No. 2- REVISED SITE SHOWING INFORMATION***<br /><br />A SITE SHOWING WILL BE HELD ON Tuesday, March 13, 2012 at 10:00 a.m. (local time).&nbsp; <br /><br />Interested Bidders should meet at the Intersection of State Route 52 and State Route 65 toward Matewan between Delbarton and Varney, WV at Dottie's Diner (Formerly Angie's Diner) in Mingo County.</strong></p>
<p><br />Amendment No. 1-&nbsp;Adds FAR Clause 52.228-13, Alternative Payment Protections, to the solicitation. See the attachment for Amendment No. 1. ALL OTHER INFORMATION REMAINS UNCHANGED.</p>
<p><br />This procurement is a TOTAL SMALL BUSINESS SET-ASIDE. The NAICS code for this procurement is 238910. The small business size standard is $14 million in average annual receipts for the previous 3 years.</p>
<p>Interested offerors may register at www.fbo.gov to receive notification when the solicitation and any amendments are issued and available for downloading. All responsible sources may submit a bid which shall be considered by the agency.</p>
<p>PLEASE NOTE: <br />Contractors must be registered in the Central Contractor's Registration database at www.ccr.gov in order to receive a Federal award. The CCR Customer Assistance Center can be contacted toll free at : 1-888-227-2423. The first step to registering is to obtain a Data Universal Numbering System (DUNS) number, which is a unique nine-character identification number provided by the commercial company Dunn and Bradstreet (D&amp;B). To request a DUNS number call D&amp;B at the toll free number 1-866-705-5711 or register on-line at http://www.dnb.com/ccr/register.html. Obtaining a DUNS number through this process is free of charge. It is recommended that contractors begin this process as soon as possible since it can take several days to complete. Failure to register by close of business on the third day after notification of possible award by the Contracting Officer may cause rejection of your bid as non-responsive.</p>
<p>Contractors are also required to register Online Representations and Certifications Application (ORCA) at https://orca.bpn.gov/. You must first register at CCR to obtain your MPIN which is required for ORCA registration. Failure to register by close of business on the third day after notification of possible award by the Contracting Officer may cause rejection of your bid as non-responsive.</p>
<p>PLEASE NOTE: The General Services Administration provides the notification service as a convenience and does not guarantee that notifications will be received by all persons. Therefore, we recommend that you monitor the FedBizOpps website for all information relevant to desired acquisitions.</p>

<MOD>
<DATE>0929
<YEAR>09
<AGENCY>Environmental Protection Agency
<OFFICE>Office of Acquisition Management
<LOCATION>EPA/Headquarters
<ZIP>20460
<CLASSCOD>68
<OFFADD>Environmental Protection Agency, Emergency Response Service Center, 1200 Pennsylvania Ave., Nw, Washington, DC 20460
<SUBJECT>68--PRESOLICITATION NOTICE
<SOLNBR>RFQ-DC-09-00337
<NTYPE>PRESOL
<RESPDATE>093009
<ARCHDATE>10312009
<CONTACT>Point of Contact, Manuela Meyer, Purchasing Agent, Phone (202) 564-4488

<a href="mailto:Meyer.Manuela@epamail.epa.gov">U.S. Environmental Protection Agency</a>
<DESC>NAICS Code: 541380   PRE-SOLICITATION NOTICE ONLY. The United States Environmental Protection Agency (EPA) has the responsibility of enhancing national capabilities for decontamination and disposal as a result of terrorist events and environmental sampling and analysis of all environmentalmatrices in response to nationally significant incidents (NSI). Consequently, the USEPA Office of Acquisition Management (OAM) intends to establish Basic Ordering Agreements (BOAs) in accordance with FAR Part 16.703 with vendors who are capable of analyzing environmental sample matrices contaminated by toxic industrial chemicals (TICs), chemical warfare agents (CWAs), biological agents, and radiochemical agents as a result of acts of terrorism or an environmental emergency.  A BOA is not a contract, as referenced in FAR Part 16.703; it is a written instrument of understanding, negotiated between an agency, contracting activity, or contracting office and a contractor, that contains: (1) terms and clauses applying to future contracts (orders) between the parties during its term, (2) a description, as specific as practicable, of supplies or services to be provided, and (3) methods for pricing, issuing, and delivering future orders under the BOA. Additionally, a BOA does not imply any agreement by the government to place future contracts or orders with the contractor or to be used in any manner to restrict competition. The anticipated issue date is on or about September 30, 2009 for this requirement.  A copy of this request for quote (RFQ) # RFQ-DC-09-00337 will be available at the following three Government Points of Entries (GPE): http://www.epa.gov/oam/srpod/index.htm, http://www.fedbid.com/, and https://www.fbo.gov/.
Contracting Office Address:Mail Code 3805R1200 Pennsylvania Avenue NWWashington, D.C. 20460
Points of Contact:

Manuela Meyermeyer.manuela@epa.gov

<SOLNBR>RFQ-DC-09-00337
<NTYPE>PRESOL
<RESPDATE>103009
<ARCHDATE>11302009
<CONTACT>Point of Contact, Manuela Meyer, Purchasing Agent, Phone (202) 564-4488

<a href="mailto:Meyer.Manuela@epamail.epa.gov">U.S. Environmental Protection Agency</a>
<DESC>NAICS Code: 541380   The United States Environmental Protection Agency (EPA) has the responsibility of enhancing national capabilities for decontamination and disposal as a result of terrorist events and environmental sampling and analysis of all environmental matrices in response tonationally significant incidents (NSI). To protect the nation from the potential threats posed by terrorism or environmental emergencies, the EPA implemented the Environmental Response Laboratory Network (ERLN). The ERLN is one of five laboratory response networks under the Integrated Consortium of Laboratory Networks (ICLN). The mission of the ERLN is to provide known laboratory capabilities, capacities, and quality data in a scalable, systematic, and coordinated response to environmental emergencies providing preparedness, response, remediation and recovery analytical support. Consequently, the USEPA Office of Acquisition Management (OAM) intends to establish Basic Ordering Agreements (BOAs) in accordance with FAR Part 16.703 with vendors who are capable of analyzing environmental sample matrices contaminated by toxic industrial chemicals (TICs), chemical warfare agents (CWAs), biological agents, and radiochemical agents as a result of acts of terrorism or an environmental emergency. A BOA is not a contract, as referenced in FAR Part 16.703; it is a written instrument of understanding, negotiated between an agency, contracting activity, or contracting office and a contractor, that contains: (1) terms and clauses applying to future contracts (orders) between the parties during its term, (2) a description, as specific as practicable, of supplies or services to be provided, and (3) methods for pricing, issuing, and delivering future orders under the BOA. Additionally, a BOA does not imply any agreement by the government to place future contracts or orders with the contractor or to be used in any manner to restrict competition. 
Potential vendors' viability will be evaluated on the following six factors: Accredited Quality System, Plans and Procedures, Sample Management System, Facilities for Sample Handling and Storage, Data Management and Exchange, and Integrated Consortium of Laboratory Networks (ICLN). The ERLN review team will review these documents and calculate a score for the application based on criteria established by the EPA. This score is used to determine if the laboratory is eligible for ERLN and, as applicable, Water Laboratory Alliance (WLA) membership.

This requirement will be posted for 90 days with an anticipated closing date of December 30, 2009 at 3:00 pm EST. A copy of this request for quote (RFQ) #RFQ-DC-09-00337 including attachments will be available at the following locations: http://www.epa.gov/oam/srpod/index.htm, and https://www.fbo.gov/.

The mission of the ERLN is to provide known laboratory capabilities, capacities, and quality data in a scalable, systematic, and coordinated response to environmental emergencies providing preparedness, response, remediation and recovery analytical support. Consequently, the USEPA Office of Acquisition Management (OAM) intends to establish Basic Ordering Agreements (BOAs) in accordance with FAR Part 16.703 with vendors who are capable of analyzing environmental sample matrices contaminated by toxic industrial chemicals (TICs), chemical warfare agents (CWAs), biological agents, and radiochemical agents as a result of acts of terrorism or an environmental emergency. This score is used to determine if the laboratory is eligible for ERLN and, as applicable, Water Laboratory Alliance (WLA) membership.

<DESC>NAICS Code: 541380   The purpose of this amendment to the synopsis is to change the closing date from December 30, 2009 to January 5, 2010. Please read below.  All other terms and conditions remain the same.
The United States Environmental Protection Agency (EPA) has the responsibility of enhancing national capabilities for decontamination and disposal as a result of terrorist events and environmental sampling and analysis of all environmental matrices in response to nationally significant incidents (NSI). To protect the nation from the potential threats posed by terrorism or environmental emergencies, the EPA implemented the Environmental Response Laboratory Network (ERLN). The ERLN is one of five laboratory response networks under the Integrated Consortium of Laboratory Networks (ICLN). The mission of the ERLN is to provide known laboratory capabilities, capacities, and quality data in a scalable, systematic, and coordinated response to environmental emergencies providing preparedness, response, remediation and recovery analytical support. Consequently, the USEPA Office of Acquisition Management (OAM) intends to establish Basic Ordering Agreements (BOAs) in accordance with FAR Part 16.703 with vendors who are capable of analyzing environmental sample matrices contaminated by toxic industrial chemicals (TICs), chemical warfare agents (CWAs), biological agents, and radiochemical agents as a result of acts of terrorism or an environmental emergency. Additionally, a BOA does not imply any agreement by the government to place future contracts or orders with the contractor or to be used in any manner to restrict competition. 
Potential vendors' viability will be evaluated on the following six factors: Accredited Quality System, Plans and Procedures, Sample Management System, Facilities for Sample Handling and Storage, Data Management and Exchange, and Integrated Consortium of Laboratory Networks (ICLN). The ERLN review team will review these documents and calculate a score for the application based on criteria established by the EPA. This score is used to determine if the laboratory is eligible for ERLN and, as applicable, Water Laboratory Alliance (WLA) membership.

<SOLNBR>RFQ-DC-09-00337
<NTYPE>PRESOL
<RESPDATE>103009
<ARCHDATE>11302009
<CONTACT>Point of Contact, Ron Bell, Purchasing Agent, Phone (202) 564-4501

<a href="mailto:BELL.RON@EPAMAIL.EPA.GOV">U.S. Environmental Protection Agency</a>
<DESC>NAICS Code: 541380   The purpose of this amendment to the synopsis is to change the closing date from June 25, 2010 to September 24, 2010. Please read below. All other terms and conditions remain the same.
The United States Environmental Protection Agency (EPA) has the responsibility of enhancing national capabilities for decontamination and disposal as a result of terrorist events and environmental sampling and analysis of all environmental matrices in response to nationally significant incidents (NSI). To protect the nation from the potential threats posed by terrorism or environmental emergencies, the EPA implemented the Environmental Response Laboratory Network (ERLN). The ERLN is one of five laboratory response networks under the Integrated Consortium of Laboratory Networks (ICLN). The mission of the ERLN is to provide known laboratory capabilities, capacities, and quality data in a scalable, systematic, and coordinated response to environmental emergencies providing preparedness, response, remediation and recovery analytical support. Consequently, the USEPA Office of Acquisition Management (OAM) intends to establish Basic Ordering Agreements (BOAs) in accordance with FAR Part 16.703 with vendors who are capable of analyzing environmental sample matrices contaminated by toxic industrial chemicals (TICs), chemical warfare agents (CWAs), biological agents, and radiochemical agents as a result of acts of terrorism or an environmental emergency. A BOA is not a contract, as referenced in FAR Part 16.703; it is a written instrument of understanding, negotiated between an agency, contracting activity, or contracting office and a contractor, that contains: (1) terms and clauses applying to future contracts (orders) between the parties during its term, (2) a description, as specific as practicable, of supplies or services to be provided, and (3) methods for pricing, issuing, and delivering future orders under the BOA. Additionally, a BOA does not imply any agreement by the government to place future contracts or orders with the contractor or to be used in any manner to restrict competition. 
Potential vendors' viability will be evaluated on the following six factors: Accredited Quality System, Plans and Procedures, Sample Management System, Facilities for Sample Handling and Storage, Data Management and Exchange, and Integrated Consortium of Laboratory Networks (ICLN). The ERLN review team will review these documents and calculate a score for the application based on criteria established by the EPA. This score is used to determine if the laboratory is eligible for ERLN and, as applicable, Water Laboratory Alliance (WLA) membership.

This requirement will be posted for approximately  90 days with a closing date of September, 24, 2010 at 3:00 pm EST. A copy of this request for quote (RFQ) # RFQ-DC-09-00337 including attachments will be available at the following locations: http://www.epa.gov/oam/srpod/index.htm, and https://www.fbo.gov/.
Please submit ERLN application packet via electronic mail or in hard copy form to EPA Office of Acquisition Management (OAM) using the address provided below. No phone calls please.
Ron BellU.S. Environmental Protection AgencyOffice of Acquisition Management1200 Pennsylvania Avenue, NWMail Code 3805RWashington, D.C. 20460Email: Bell.Ron@epa.gov


Michael BartonU.S. Environmental Protection AgencyOffice of Acquisition Managment1200 Pennsylvania Avenue, NWMail Code 3805RWashington, D.C. 20460Email:  Barton.Michael@epa.gov

The United States Environmental Protection Agency (EPA) has the responsibility of enhancing national capabilities for decontamination and disposal as a result of terrorist events and environmental sampling and analysis of all environmental matrices in response to nationally significant incidents (NSI). To protect the nation from the potential threats posed by terrorism or environmental emergencies, the EPA implemented the Environmental Response Laboratory Network (ERLN). The ERLN is one of five laboratory response networks under the Integrated Consortium of Laboratory Networks (ICLN). The mission of the ERLN is to provide known laboratory capabilities, capacities, and quality data in a scalable, systematic, and coordinated response to environmental emergencies providing preparedness, response, remediation and recovery analytical support.  Consequently, the USEPA Office of Acquisition Management (OAM) intends to establish Basic Ordering Agreements (BOAs) in accordance with FAR  Part 16.703 with vendors who are capable of analyzing environmental sample matrices contaminated by toxic industrial chemicals (TICs), chemical warfare agents (CWAs), biological agents, and radiochemical agents as a result of acts of terrorism or an environmental emergency. A BOA is not a contract, as referenced in FAR Part 16.703; it is a written instrument of understanding, negotiated between an agency, contracting activity, or contracting office and a contractor, that contains: (1) terms and clauses applying to future contracts (orders) between the parties during its term, (2) a description, as specific as practicable, of supplies or services to be provided, and (3) methods for pricing, issuing, and delivering future orders under the BOA. Additionally, a BOA does not imply any agreement by the government to place future contracts or orders with the contractor or to be used in any manner to restrict competition. 
Potential vendors? viability will be evaluated on the following six factors:  Accredited Quality System, Plans and Procedures, Sample Management System, Facilities for Sample Handling and Storage, Data Management and Exchange, and Integrated Consortium of Laboratory Networks (ICLN).  The ERLN review team will review these documents and calculate a score for the application based on criteria established by the EPA.  This score is used to determine if the laboratory is eligible for ERLN and, as applicable, Water Laboratory Alliance (WLA) membership.

<OFFICE>Office of Naval Research
<LOCATION>Naval Research Laboratory

<CLASSCOD>59
