<OFFADD>4555 Overlook Ave. S.W. Washington DC 20375
<SUBJECT>Radio Frequency Continuous Wave Microwave Power Module Ku-Band Amplifiers
<SOLNBR>N00173-12-R-PW01
<NTYPE>PRESOL
<RESPDATE>040212
<ARCHDATE>04032013
<CONTACT>Patricia L. Woodhouse, Contract Specialist, Phone 202-404-2407, Email patricia.woodhouse@nrl.navy.mil
<DESC><span style="FONT-FAMILY: 'Arial', 'sans-serif'; FONT-SIZE: 12pt">The Surface Electronic Warfare Systems Branch at the US Naval Research Laboratory, Washington, DC, is responsible for research, design, and development of onboard electronic warfare (EW) technologies, techniques, and systems to deny or degrade hostile use of the electromagnetic spectrum and protect naval ships. This includes threat assessment and definition, development of EW operational concepts, EW requirements definition, electronic countermeasure technique research and analysis, EW signal processing research, EW system research and prototype system development, EW technique and system effectiveness evaluation, field experimentation, and system effectiveness assessments.<br /></span><span style="FONT-FAMILY: 'Arial', 'sans-serif'; FONT-SIZE: 12pt"><br />The Naval Research Laboratory (NRL) Tactical Electronic Warfare Division (TEWD) has a need for&nbsp;radio-frequency (RF) continuous-wave (CW) microwave-power-module (MPM) amplifiers for use as&nbsp;transmitters in a developmental system. The RF&nbsp;CW&nbsp;MPM amplifiers will be used to design and evaluate prototype shipboard and airborne electronic warfare (EW) applications and will be mounted in an enclosure that will be installed on both surface shipboard and airborne platforms.<br /></span><span style="FONT-FAMILY: 'Arial', 'sans-serif'; FONT-SIZE: 12pt"><br /></span><span style="FONT-FAMILY: 'Arial', 'sans-serif'; FONT-SIZE: 12pt">This&nbsp;solicitation is for the acquisition of up to 390 individual RF CW MPM amplifiers. Complete technical specifications are available as part of the solicitation (attached). A one-year indefinite-delivery, indefinite-quantity contract with two one-year option periods&nbsp;with firm-fixed-priced orders is contemplated. The government intends to use FAR Part 12, Acquisition of Commercial Items.<br /><br />
<p><strong>Proposal Submission Information<br /></strong>Proposals are due by&nbsp;2 April 2012, 2:00 p.m., Eastern&nbsp;Daylight Time (EDT). NOTE: Proposals may be submitted via e-mail to <a href="mailto:patricia.woodhouse@nrl.navy.mil">patricia.woodhouse@nrl.navy.mil</a>&nbsp;in&nbsp;Microsoft Word,&nbsp;.pdf, and/or Excel&nbsp;formats. The attachments to any single e-mail may not exceed a total of 15 MB. The e-mail(s) should have in the subject line solicitation number (N00173-12-R-PW01) and due date and time. Proposals must be <span style="text-decoration: underline;">recieved</span> by the due date and time.<br /><br />If mailed or hand delivered, an original,&nbsp;one copy of the offeror's proposal, and&nbsp;a copy of&nbsp;all proposal materials on&nbsp;CD-ROM or DVD-ROM&nbsp;shall be received on or before the response date noted above at the following NRL address 4555 Overlook Ave., S.W., Building 222,&nbsp;Room 115,&nbsp;Washington, DC 20375, Attn: Contracting Officer. The package should be marked with the solicitation number, due date and time.&nbsp;<br /><span style="LINE-HEIGHT: 115%; FONT-FAMILY: 'Arial', 'sans-serif'; FONT-SIZE: 12pt"><br />The U.S. Postal Service continues to irradiate letters, flats, express, and priority mail with stamps for postage and other packages with stamps for postage destined to government agencies in the ZIP codes ranging 202 through 205. Due to potential delays in receiving mail, offerors are encouraged to use alternatives to the mail when submitting proposals.</span></p>
<p>Contact the following individual for information regarding this solicitation: Patricia Woodhouse, 202-404-2407, patricia.woodhouse@nrl.navy.mil.</p>
</span><span style="FONT-FAMILY: 'Arial', 'sans-serif'; FONT-SIZE: 12pt"><br />The NRL uses electronic commerce&nbsp;to issue requests for proposals (RFPs) and amendments to RFPs. Paper copies of the RFP will not be issued.<br /></span><span style="FONT-FAMILY: 'Arial', 'sans-serif'; FONT-SIZE: 12pt"><br />All responsible sources may submit a bid, proposal, or quotation, which shall be considered by the agency. Other business opportunities for NRL are available at our website http://heron.nrl.navy.mil/contracts/rfplist.htm. </span>

<CONTACT>Lisa Hayes

<DESC>NOTE: THIS IS A SOLICITATION NOTICE, NOT A PRE-SOLICITATION NOTICE. PLEASE SEE RFP G12PS00055 FOR FULL DETAILS VIA FEDCONNECT AT https://www.fedconnect.net/FedConnect/
The Government does intend to use Federal Acquisition Regulations (FAR) Part 12 in conjunction with FAR Part 15. The U.S. Geological Survey, Crustal Geochemistry Science Center has a requirement for conducting helicopter aeromagnetic survey in Mammoth Lakes, California. The contractor will be required to provide digitally recorded and processed aeromagnetic data. The requirement is for a minimum of 1718 line miles, with up to an additional 6639 line miles. Delivery shall be FOB Destination to Lakewood, Colorado. Telephone request for the RFP will not be accepted. No hard copies of the solicitation will be available. An original plus three (3) written copies of the proposal will be requested. No Electronic Commerce (EC) proposals. The North American Industry Classification System (NAICS) for this project is 541360. The services/supplies described herein are Commercial Item. This requirement is not set-aside for small business.

<DESC>THIS SYSNOPSIS BEING RE-ADVERTISED IN IT'S ENTIRETY. <br><br>Under this solicitation, the Government intends to establish one (1) MATOC pool with two or more contractors within the Gulf Coast Region MATOC pool for the purpose of providing a full range of new design/build construction and repair type services in the area of operations indicated in this paragraph.  The construction contractors included in this MATOC pool shall furnish all plant, labor supervision, tools, materials equipment, design and other items necessary to perform general military construction projects primarily in Mobile District's military boundaries Alabama and Florida but may be used in other areas within the boundaries of the South Atlantic Division which includes the additional states of Mississippi, Tennessee, Georgia, South Carolina and North Carolina.  The contracts awarded under this solicitation, may result in two or more Indefinite Delivery/Indefinite Quality (IDIQ) contracts with duplicative scopes of work.<br><br>A Prototype Task Order (PTO) seed project that includes 100% plans and specifications and a bid schedule is included in this solicitation to simulate one type of firm fixed price task order that could be awarded under these MATOC's.  The Offeror will be required to use the PTO Seed project information and submit a completed bid schedule to simulate a fixed-price for the PTO seed project.  The PTO price information will be used during the trade-off source selection evaluation process.  The PTO seed project will not be constructed but will be used in this evaluation process to determine the appropriateness of the Offeror's pricing when compared to what has been constructed.  Reference RFP Section 00 12 00, Paragraph 2.0 "EVALUATION PROCESS" for additional information regarding price evaluation (Bid Schedule No. 1 and Bid Schedule No. 2) for the complete solicitation.<br><br>Description of PTO Seed Project:  In general, the work shall consist of the following:  This prototype project will simulate a project that requires construction of parking lots and infrastructure, to include electrical and communication distribution, water distribution and wastewater collection.  Buildings include the Group Support Battalion (GSB) Logistic, GSB Tactical Equipment Maintenance Facility, GSB Organization Equipment Storage Facility, GSB Oil Storage Facility, GSB Hazardous Materials Storage Facility and Wash rack/Platform.<br><br>The term of this contract will be for a base year and four (4) twelve month options.  Firm Fixed-Price task orders will be issued against this contract.  The guaranteed minimum will be $1,000 and the total capacity for the contract will be $499 million over five years.  This requirement is being handled by the U.S. Army Corps of Engineers, Mobile District, Mobile; AL.<br><br>The North American Industry Classification System (NAICS) code for this project is 236220.<br><br>The solicitation will be available for download on June 29, 2011. The estimated cost of this project is will between $250,000,000 to $500,000,000. The contracting officer is Mrs. Donna Parker.<br><br>Note No. 1:  All prospective contractors and their subcontractors and suppliers must be registered in Federal Business Opportunities (FedBizOpps) before they will be allowed to download solicitation information. Contractor must be registered in the DoD Central Contractor Registration (CCR) prior to award of this contract.  Solicitation documents, plans and specifications will only be available via FedBizOpps.  Registration for plans and specifications should be made via FedBizOpps Internet Homepage.  If you are not registered, the United States government is not responsible for providing you with notifications of any changes to this solicitation.  The solicitation will be available only as a direct download. This solicitation will not be issued on CD-ROM.  Neither telephonic, mailed, nor fax requests will be accepted.  Registration should be completed one week prior to the issue date.  It is therefore the Contractor's responsibility to monitor the website daily for the solicitation to be posted, and for any posted changes or amendments to this solicitation.  The plans and specifications and all notifications of changes to this solicitation shall only be made through this posting and modifications hereto.  Plans and specifications will not be provided in a printed-paper format; however, the Government reserves the right to revert to paper medium when it is determined to be in the Government's best interest.  NOTE: This solicitation is in .pdf format and requires Adobe Acrobat Reader.  Adobe Acrobat Reader may be downloaded free of charge at http://www.adobe.com/.<br><br>Note No. 2:  All bid forms, bid bonds, and other normal documents required for the bid submittal, including amendments to the bid submittal, shall be in paper medium.  Electronic medium for the bid submittal documents will not be allowed.<br><br>Note No. 3:  For the Prototype Project, Critical path method (network analysis system) is required.<br><br>Note No. 4: For this job, a small business is defined as having average annual receipts of less than $33,500,000 for the past three years.<br><br>Note No. 5:  The Prototype Project under this solicitation includes bid options.<br><br>Note No. 6:  All advertisements of Mobile District projects will be through the Federal Business Opportunities (FedBizOpps).  Detailed information on this and other Mobile District Projects (Ordering Solicitations, Points of Contact, Synopsis of Work, etc.) are available on the Internet at:  https://www.fbo.gov. <br><br>Address questions concerning downloading of plans/specifications to Plans Room at phone number 251-690-2535 or 251-690-2536.<br><br>Note No. 7:  The request for information (RFI) process for bidder inquiries during the advertisement period will be through the PROJNET internet based system, and specifics will be contained in the RFP solicitation package available exclusively from FedBizOpps.  Other forms of communicating RFIs to the government will not be honored.  The government will try to respond to all questions. However, responses may not be furnished to all questions and particularly those received late in the advertisement period (0-10 days prior to bid opening.)<br><br>All other information remains unchanged.

<SOLNBR>W912HN-12-R-0029

<DESC>Real Property Appraisal Report for Disposal of Lands and Improvements at Fort McPherson Military Installation City of Atlanta, Fulton County, GA. The offeor must provide estimates of Market Value (MV) for properties at Fort McPherson Military Installation to assist the U.S. Government&nbsp; (Government) in the negotiaton of the disposal and sale of properties at Fort McPherson.&nbsp;&nbsp;The subject property is Fort McPherson Military Installation, a historic administrative, strategic planning, and command center, home to the Third U.S. Army, U.S. Foces COmmand (FORSCOM), and U.S. Army Reserve Command (USARC). The installation is situated in the Campbellton District area of the City of Atlanta, GA, located 4 miles southwest of downtown Atlanta and 7 miles northwest of Hartsfield-Jackson Atlanta International Airport. Its facilities encompass over 2.3 million&nbsp;square feet (sf) of building space in 210+- buildings, 74 of which are on the National Registry of Historic Places. Type properties are residential, office/administrative, serice oriented, warehouse/storage, and a&nbsp;golf course, located on approximately 488 acres&nbsp;of land.&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;<br /><br /><br /><strong>THIS SOLICITATION NUMBER WILL CHANGE TO W912HN-12-T-0027. See the attached Solicitation for more details and proposal Instructions. </strong>

<SUBJECT>Solicitation for the Homeowners Assistance Program Property Management and Resale Services
<SOLNBR>W912HN-12-R-0027
<NTYPE>PRESOL
<RESPDATE>032312
<ARCHDATE>05312012
<CONTACT>Nikisha V. Weston, Contract Specialist, Phone 9126525102, Email nikisha.weston@usace.army.mil
<DESC><p><span style="FONT-SIZE: 12pt">The US Army Corps of Engineers, Savannah District, has a requirement for a variety of services in connection with the Homeowners Assistance Program (HAP).<span style="mso-spacerun: yes">&nbsp; </span>The Homeowners Assistance Program is a Government program designed to alleviate the undue hardship associated with selling a residential property, in an adversely impacted market.<span style="mso-spacerun: yes">&nbsp; </span>The properties to be managed and sold are Government-owned properties acquired through the HAP and shall be assigned to the Contractor for management, maintenance and resale. </span><span style="FONT-SIZE: 12pt">The required services shall include property management for one or two family properties, including condominiums, and all improvements located on the property.<span style="mso-spacerun: yes">&nbsp; </span>Marketing and final disposition of these properties shall be a joint effort between the Contractor and the Government with day-to-day management and marketing of the properties being the responsibility of the Contractor.&nbsp;</span><span style="FONT-SIZE: 12pt">The Contractor shall furnish all necessary facilities, materials, supplies, equipment, labor, personnel, supervision and management, and services to perform or obtain the services required.&nbsp;<br /><br />&nbsp; See the attached Solicitation for more details and proposal Instructions. </span></p>

<SUBJECT>Cultural Advisor/Linguist
<SOLNBR>FA5706-12-R-0006
<NTYPE>PRESOL
<RESPDATE>031412
<CONTACT>Dorethas Bracey, Contracting Administrator, Phone 01197125043362, Email Dorethas.Bracey@adab.afcent.af.mil - Karie Kapise, Contracting Officer, Phone 01197125043350, Email karie.kapise@adab.afcent.af.mil
<DESC>Solicitation<br />Solicitation Number: FA5706-12-R-0006 <br />Due: 12:00pm GST<br /><br />Supply or Services Classification Code: FSC: R608 / NAICS: 541930 / SIC: 7389 / SIZE: $7M
<p>Requirement: <br />Contractor shall provide Cultural Advisor personnel, equipment, tools, materials, supervision, and other items and services necessary to locate, screen, hire and maintain linguists capable of modern standard Arabic and standard English (minimum at the 9th grade level) to serve in the United States Central Command (USCENTCOM) area of responsibility (AOR). Linguists shall be assigned to the 380th Air Expeditionary Wing (AEW) and the 405th Air Expeditionary Group (AEG). The linguists' primary function is to furnish administrative and interpreter services for the following locations: 380th AEW and all tenant units and the 405th AEG. These duties include, but are not limited to, acting as a liaison on behalf of the wing/group leadership or authorized designated representative, interacting and coordinating with Host Nation personnel to include matters of security, medical and ministry personnel, deployed United States (US) military personnel, security of assets/resources, and base defense. Other related duties may be assigned by the 380th AEW or 405th AEG commanders or authorized designated representative, at the AOR site under the general scope of this contract. The linguists will also accurately translate orally, and produce English/Arabic language documents as required. <br /><br /><br />Please read all attachments thoroughly. <strong>Please adhere and only respond to solicitation 1</strong> (solicitation 2 is a repeat and is not going to be considered).&nbsp;&nbsp; FAR part 19 does not apply to contingency procurements. <br /><br /><strong>PWS: Section 1.6 Phase-In was revised on 2 March 2012. The dates should reflect the month of May 2012. <br /><br /></strong>Contact Points: (Contract Person(s), Title, Phone Number(s)):<br /><br />2d Lt Dorethas Bracey, Contract Administrator, 011-971-2-504-3362<br />Major Karie Kapise, Contracting Officer, 011-971-2-504-3350</p>

A Seller may submit a series of pricing bids, which descend in price during the specified period of time for the aforementioned reverse auction. VHA VISN 17 - 549 - North Texas Veterans Health Care System is taking this action in an effort to improve both seller access and awareness of requests and the agency's ability to gather multiple, completed, real-time bids.All responsible Sellers that respond to this solicitation MUST submit the pricing portion of their bid using the online exchange located at www.FedBid.com. There is no cost to register, review procurement data or make a bid on www.FedBid.com.Sellers that are not currently registered to use www.FedBid.com should proceed to www.FedBid.com to complete their free registration. Sellers that require special considerations or assistance may contact the FedBid Helpdesk at 877-9FEDBID (877-933-3243) or via email at clientservices@fedbid.com. Sellers may not artificially manipulate the price of a transaction on www.FedBid.com by any means. It is unacceptable to place bad faith bids, to use decoys in the www.FedBid.com process or to collude with the intent or effect of hampering the competitive www.FedBid.com process.Should Sellers require additional clarification, contact FedBid at 877-9FEDBID (877-933-3243) or clientservices@fedbid.com.<BR><BR>Use of FedBid:   Buyers and Sellers agree to conduct this transaction through FedBid in compliance with the FedBid Terms of Use. <DATE>0302
<YEAR>12
<AGENCY>Department of Health and Human Services
<OFFICE>Program Support Center
<LOCATION>Division of Acquisition Management
<ZIP>20857
<CLASSCOD>U
<NAICS>611710
<OFFADD>Parklawn Building Room 5-101
5600 Fishers Lane Rockville MD 20857
<SUBJECT>Head Start Region XI and Region XII T/TA and Collaboration Center
<SOLNBR>11-233-SOL-00253
<CONTACT>Camille M. Timmerman, Contract Specialist, Phone 3014436851, Email camille.timmerman@psc.hhs.gov - Clint D Druk, Contracting Officer, Phone 301-443-0403, Email clint.druk@psc.gov
<AWDNBR>HHSP233201200010C
<AWDAMT>$38,456,252
<AWDDATE>022112
<ARCHDATE>04012012
<AWARDEE>FHI DEVELOPMENT 360 LLC, 2224 E NC HWY 54, DURHAM, NC 27713 US
<DESC>The Administration for Children and Families (ACF), Office of Head Start (OHS) administers a nationwide comprehensive child development program serving eligible children from birth to five and their families. The Head Start program is child and family focused and has the overall goal of helping children from low-income families become ready to succeed in school. Funds are provided through grants to local public agencies, private organizations and Indian tribes. These organizations provide services in early childhood development and education, health, dental health, mental health, nutrition and parent involvement.
<p>The purpose of the Head Start Region XI and Region XII Training/Technical Assistance (T/TA) and Collaboration Center is to provide targeted training and technical assistance to individual grantees and groups of grantees serving Region XI and Region XII.</p>
<p>The T/TA provides grantees with quality, sustained, and intensive training and technical assistance that, "to the maximum extent practicable," improves the capacity of programs to deliver services that meet or exceed the standards described in Section 641(A)(a)(1) of the Head Start Act, with the following as priorities:<br />- Correction of deficiencies<br />- School readiness<br />- Training/career development needs of staff</p>
<LINK>
<URL>https://www.fbo.gov/spg/HHS/PSC/DAM/Awards/HHSP233201200010C.html
<DESC>Link To Document
</AWARD>

<STAUTH>FAR 6.302-1
<AWDNBR>FA2517-12-C-XXXX
<AWDDATE>043012
<DESC>NOTICE OF INTENT TO AWARD SOLE SOURCE

The government intends to award a sole source contract under the authority of 10 U.S.C. 2304 (c) (1) as implemented by FAR 6.302-1, Only One Responsible Source and No Other Supplies or Services Will Satisfy Agency Requirements.
 
The Government intends to make a sole source award to CloudShield Technologies (CS) Inc., 212 Gibraltar Drive, Sunnyvale CA 94089. The North American Industry Classification System (NAICS) is 541511 and the size standard is $25 million dollars. CloudShield Technologies (CS) will provide technical support and engineering to research, develop, and integrate CS Deep Packet Processing Module (DPPM) technology with current and future AF Global Information Grid (GIG) Information Operations Platform (IOP) and IOP compatible installations and upgrades for 90 Information Operation Squadron (90IOS), Lackland AFB TX.

CS DPPM technology is patented Intellectual Property (IP) and CS possesses the requisite knowledge, apparatus, and methodologies required for the AF to embark on any effort to create a portable, software-based, and VM-deployable DPPM execution environment.

All responsible sources may submit a capability statement, proposal, or quotation which shall be considered by the agency.

All submission must be sent to the point of contact (POC) listed below and received by 16 March 2012, 1:00 P.M., Mountain Standard Time (MST). This notice is not a Request for Proposals, nor does it restrict the Government as to the ultimate acquisition approach. This notice is not a commitment from the Government. The Government will not reimburse any bid or proposal costs as a result of this notice.

AFSPC Ombudsman information (AFFARS 5352.201-9101)
OMBUDSMAN (APR 2010)
(a) An ombudsman has been appointed to hear and facilitate the resolution of concerns from offerors, potential offerors, and others for this acquisition. When requested, the ombudsman will maintain strict confidentiality as to the source of the concern. The existence of the ombudsman does not affect the authority of the program manager, contracting officer, or source selection official. Further, the ombudsman does not participate in the evaluation of proposals, the source selection process, or the adjudication of protests or formal contract disputes. The ombudsman may refer the party to another official who can resolve the concern. 
(b) Before consulting with an ombudsman, interested parties must first address their concerns, issues, disagreements, and/or recommendations to the contracting officer for resolution. Consulting an ombudsman does not alter or postpone the timelines for any other processes (e.g., agency level bid protests, GAO bid protests, requests for debriefings, employee-employer actions, contests of http://www.whitehouse.gov/omb/circulars/a076/a76_rev2003.pdf OMB Circular A-76 competition performance decisions). 
(c) If resolution cannot be made by the contracting officer, concerned parties may contact the Center/MAJCOM or AFISRA ombudsmen, AFSPC/A7K, 150 Vandenberg Street, Peterson AFB CO 80914, (P) 719-554-5250, (F) 719-554-5299, mailto:A7K.wf@peterson.af.mil. Concerns, issues, disagreements, and recommendations that cannot be resolved at the MAJCOM/DRU or ARISRA level, may be brought by the concerned party for further consideration to the Air Force ombudsman, Associate Deputy Assistant Secretary (ADAS) (Contracting), SAF/AQC, 1060 Air Force Pentagon, Washington DC 20330-1060, phone number (703) 588-7004, facsimile number (703) 588-1067.
(d) The ombudsman has no authority to render a decision that binds the agency.
(e) Do not contact the ombudsman to request copies of the solicitation, verify offer due date, or clarify technical requirements. Such inquiries shall be directed to the Contracting Officer.
(End of clause)
Government points of contact: Email: joan.johnson@peterson.af.mil or anthony.saporito@peterson.af.mil
****See attached document for justification****
